qcWPUAcqvUEZiyDqQbIcxg.text: Purchased a Groupon deal for Fuego Del Mar while in Phoenix for this weekend but ended up here per the owner's suggestion as Del Mar is closed for a wedding reception. The host is pleasant but our server is snooty and the taste of their food do not justify their pricing. We're from CA and dined at places that charges this much but tasted way better than this. We were in Albuquerque (El Pinto) and Santa Fe (Taberna La Boca) the weekend before and had excellent food but didn't pay this much.

WaydUdSTo84lVcpscU1i1Q.text: NOT about the food, which was excellent as ever.    Service was miserable.  We sat in in the bar area, and the bartender grudgingly served us, never once checking on drink refills or food; she seemed offended when I asked for a clean glass (my wine glass was pre-lipsticked and not in my shade...)......  Each server  on duty on a quiet Thursday evening  had to pass by our table to pick up orders from the kitchen, not a one made eye contact or offered water refills, drinks, nor checked on food quality.  See Daren & Nathan's reviews; the owner is great, very sociable, etc, but the staff is ill trained,  not at all up to the five star food.    Towards the end of the evening, a nice young bus-girl asked if we'd like a to-go box, and she was literally the only person who checked back on our table with out being flagged down.    Previous visits had EXCELLENT service, to match the food, not so much this time........disappointed.........

e6KGnk_RY5TM3_svqJt5ZA.text: So good!  We sat outside and there was a great duo playing music. The tortilla soup was fabulous. Very accommodating when we asked for soup as a side dish and a meatless pasta!  Great service. It's in a funky area which makes it even better!  Highly recommend!

swpfHAmkSCqk28xC6iW91A.text: Hands down, my favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  The seafood chili rellenos is absolutely amazing, but so is everything else on the menu. My wife loves the drinks, but I don't have any room w/ all the good food.  Also, the owner Jeff, is friendly and awesome!  We've been there 20 times and excellent service and food every time- it's an absolute must whenever we get a visitor from our east coast home.

K4iK_waKWDa6UVfSE09r1w.text: Some of the best pork I've ever tasted in my life!  Super cool little patio that is tucked away hidden from the craziness of 7th st.  They were attentive and very helpful with menu suggestions.  They had some tasty cocktail suggestions as well to match the dishes and you can tell the staff has worked together for some time.  They were all working together and helping out.  Some people don't like that, I appreciate that vibe from a place as it tells the customer they all care and want to be there.

6HksuHVUHPOtpB7gdDSClg.text: One of my favorite places!  Great patio during "patio season".  Great drinks and friendly staff.  Always friendly and interesting food.

rYVWJE2fTTnqmuz5_fdnxg.text: Very nice atmosphere. The flavor combinations are absurd in there epic awesomeness. Tried almost everything between us blue cheese steak was sooo good, everything was excellent staff was incredibly kind and friendly.

o_Cwk3EBnulD4B91MbUSeA.text: This may be my new favorite spot in Phoenix! I have been here about three times over the last two weeks and every time was all around peeerfect! I had heard of this place a million times and had never made it in, so finally my sister was in town to visit from San Fran (total foody might I add) and I paid Fuego Bistro a visit! We were impressed! First of all their specialty-the empanade, was excellent, which you would expect considering it is the specialty...but seriously it was great right down to the house made salsa on top! We happened to be there at a slow time between lunch and dinner and our waiter was also our bartender and he made one of the best mohitos I have ever had state side! I wasn't going to drink (driving) but, after seeing my sister's, I had to try one! The pork nachos are fabulous: the chips are made fresh, the pork was perfectly cooked and the salsa again was very tasty! We both had salads and the veggies were fresh and I always love house made dressings!   Last time I went to Fuego on a date and we sat outside on the patio; it was very romantic and I ended up with the same server I had before...he is wonderful and he remembered me! My date ordered the ribs and they looked amazing and my tuna steak was tasty with the mango salsa and balsamic reduction! I HIGHLY recommend this place and the happy hour prices are wonderful considering the quality and quantity of the food!   One more thing, this place is a little hard to find tucked back off of Palo Verde Rd. and buried within the middle of a courtyard...but it is well worth the effort to find it!

4TAb4SB0f1249MUYLMlbkA.text: This place is just lovely - a True hidden gem.  I discovered Fuego Bistro after it was featured on Groupon, and I'm sure glad I did!  I have been there 3 times now, and each visit was just a great as the previous.   I have been there on a date, I took my 50 year old mom there, and I also went with my mid-20s female friends to celebrate a birthday.  All different audiences, but everyone I have taken has loved it!  Needless to say, it appeals to many, and is perfect for birthdays, anniversaries and friendly get-togethers.  Environment:  I have never sat inside because I very much enjoy the outside patio.  At night, it is very quaint and romantic with a water fountain, Christmas lights of sorts, nice trees and vines, and there has been pleasant live music during all 3 of my visits.  It is a quiet venue, making it very easy to converse with those at your table.  Service:  The Fuego Bistro staff is attentive, friendly and genuine.  It seems they have all worked there for some time and that the owner does a wonderful job of making them all feel as though they are a family.  They seem to know and care about each other, they believe in the place they work, and the customers benefit as a result.  Food:  Delicious!  My absolute favorite dinner dish is the braised angus short rib roast, and I'm not even a beef person!  It is wonderfully marinated and very flavorful.  I have had all of sides from the mashed potatoes to the carrots, and all of them are great.  What I love about Fuego is that they take a classic dish and add its own flare with an array of spices and sauces.  Prices:  The dinner dishes range in the mid to low $20s, but I have only visited Fuego with a Groupon or LivingSocial voucher in hand. I love that Fuego is so supportive of deals and the waiters/waitresses are not only accepting of the vouchers, but they are enthusiastic about your savings as well.  I highly recommend you visit Fuego Bistro for a unique and pleasant dining experience!

4YIjnwBkmeYINiZFKb_lZg.text: Oh how I love Fuego Bistro this place is top notch.  They even opened up another room for more indoor seating.    I ordered the Pernil Asado which is my favorite and their signature dish.  It is slow roasted suceulent pork served with an orange habanero mojo and local corn tortillas.  The pork seriously melts in your mouth and with the sauce I can't get enough of it.    For the two sides that go with it I love the Jalapeno Creamed Corn which is actually perfectly spicy and yummy.  I also got the Chipotle Cheddar Mashed Potatoes which are very good as well.    The Mojito's are a must have I usually can't go without at least two and they have many flavors to choose from I really like the Blood Orange flavor.    The best part is they usually have groupon's which make it very cost effective.

-JLuOjcNOLpABuC26QoYNQ.text: The place is oddly located and somewhat confusing to find. As far as the quality of the food, it is fantastic. My whole family went and we each got a different entree. All of which were delicious. The prime rib special had sauteed mushrooms, peppers, onion, topped with Bleu cheese, which was my personal favorite.  All the meat entrees was extremely tender and nothing needed additional seasoning (salt and pepper). Out of all the sides I would highly recommend the cornbread, mashed potatoes, cream corn, or the carrots. The cornbread was moist and had a kick to it. As did the potatoes, which had jalapeno and cheese blended in. The carrots were cook in a nice sauce and were soft and tender. I got the short rib and that had a great taste. Honestly you can't go wrong with anything.  The drinks were good, I loved the blackberry sangria, my parent's margaritas were top notch. It was a bit pricy and wouldn't suggest going with a family, but more as a date night. It's extremely romantic and has live music, tonight there was a solo pianist.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short rib with the potatoes and carrots.

9zP-O-nQPwRITpL_tzppgg.text: The waiter chased us down to give us a piece of his mind. Unbelievable. He spent most of his time talking to two other employees about sometimes appropriate things.  My tacos fell apart. I was expecting more but I got two small tacos that turned to pieces before I got them into my mouth.  The appetizers weren't the best. They were "pre prepared" so we couldn't get them they way we wanted.  The place was very tiny. I can see why there were only one other pair of customers there in the middle of dinner time. I was expecting a lot more than what I got.

9p9TkeQIVgQ4ue_NLU_sCA.text: A Groupon is what brought my boyfriend and me to Fuego Bistro for the first time last night. The cozy candlelit atmosphere was very inviting. The food was phenomenal!  The empanadas are a must for an appetizer. The crust was golden and perfectly and evenly cooked. That was followed by the most flavorful short rib enchiladas I've ever had. The seasonal (blueberry) sangria was the perfect addition to a magnificent meal. My boyfriend & I both found ourselves taking smaller bites and eating more slowly in an attempt to savor every morsel and prolong our dining experience. Will definitely be going back when the rain stops and hopefully sit in the courtyard for some live music.

ua-c8BqCy4c_jkBUcsdAow.text: Great food and friendly people. The owner is typically around and it was great to talk with him about the history of the building.  The plaza are are in is very pleasant and the food and service is always good. My favorite is the seafood telling.

cVUaEaYJk4EXaJoBSdF2mA.text: Fuego Bistro was one of the go-to lunch spots for me and my coworkers. I have since left that job, or else it would STILL be one of my go-to lunch spots (oh, if only you were closer).   The food here is wonderful, and the patio is just lovely to sit at when it is nice outside. My personal favorites on the lunch menu are the chicken tacos, with the cream sauce and the jack cheese. They melt cheese between 2 corn tortillas which give the tacos an amazing texture, and the grilled chicken, and the cream sauce (chipotle cream, i believe) are a perfect combination. My other favorite is the chicken enchiladas. They aren't too heavy, I love the black beans, and they are perfect for lunch. There have been times where literally everyone at our table order the chicken enchiladas. They are THAT good.   However, I must say that my absolute FAVORITE part of my dining experience here is the rice. I'm not sure what you guys do with the rice, but my goodness. It's so fluffy and compliments the meal perfectly.   The only reason I knocked down one star, is because of one particular server that we seemed to get quite often. The staff for the most part are wonderful and friendly, however this particular server just struck me as a little rude and hurried, even when it wasn't necessarily busy. We have had this same experience every time we've been seated at his table.  But besides that, Fuego Bistro is fantastic! I highly recommend (especially the rice)!

Zv7p3q1b_Y_new419_s6RA.text: This place is awesome! Love the setting, love the lighting, and the food is to die for! The only problem I have is that when you have a big party, you can't split the checks... You have one bill and take all the credit cards... It doesn't make sense.. I'm supposed to be enjoying my food and company but yet I have to sit there and calculate how much each person owes plus tip plus tax? They didnt even do it for you... or offered.. We're in 2013... I would go back but only if its for a party of two...

Ru09MoFLsHCYaTWpjggAwg.text: Best part of the meal was 3 olive dude vodka.didnt care for the empanadas like all the good reviews. The meatloaf sandwiches were bland. Sweet potato fries were hot. Beans cold. Rice was tasty. Meal for 4 people 75.00 wow

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dude adult soda
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Empanadas

CMRKKKWJJd-2A4RWrWk3Fw.text: First time at Fuego Bistro!  You guys hit a home run. Service, food, drinks, ambiance, entertainment top shelf.  The best Mexican food in Phoenix!  Nicely tucked away, unpretentious, ecclectic and welcoming!!  Well worth the drive from anywhere in the valley. How about a location in Surprise???

HhCXSGpwmQNIeXNjhzbn_A.text: The ONLY bad thing about this place is the location - it's hidden in a gem of a patio locale in the middle of north central phoenix.  You won't find it if you don't know where to go...so call ahead and ask for specific directions.  That being said, I was STUNNED at how goo this place was.  I love the Sangria, and the shrip cocktail is so unique I hate that I just called it a cocktail.  I want my VIP card...how does that work?  I would go all the time...if it was open later and on Monday (divorced single mom who goes on dates on Monday nights.)

4Vo47JAJSEMOhj8uyHUgQA.text: Best value for happy hour in town.  The appetizers are a good size for the money and are not a step down in quality.  You can't beat a pork quesadilla, a piece of key lime pie and 2 margaritas for a little over $20.

YcIF7izBoIU7ucKE6cVMyA.text: i gave this place 5 stars even though my mojito was really not good at all despite their status by the new york times. i actually didn't even have more than a few sips of it, it was that bad.   BUT! onto the good things. first off, puerto rican and cuban food is hard to come by so when i found this place on yelp and i was in arizona, i HAD to go. And, i wasn't dissapointed. everything i ate was so good. i had the empanadas app. they were good but when you put that sauce on them, it makes them even better. i had the ropa vieja with arroz con gandules y black beans. omg! everything was so yummy. the meat was tender and flavorful like my mamas! and the arroz was good along with the beans, they both had good flavor. i had the cheesecake flan which was equally good. i stuffed it down despite the fact that i was full.   the service was great. the atmosphere was chill. there was a guy performing jazz on the patio which set the mood. it was really a nice place and if i lived closer, i would be back often.   i only have 1 suggestion. you should have cafe con leche on the menu instead of just plain old coffee :)

tJ7k8UwQd1Dnsu8k0BFy7Q.text: so my review caused some hard feelings with the owner...i have to believe he felt attacked by some of my non food comments.  i just want to be clear. i was trying to be funny not hurtful. i stand by the 3 star review for the food (for me personally it was good but not great, hence the 3 stars). But the staff was very nice to us and if you are close to this place, it is certainly worth a visit.  finally, i am a HUGE fan of small, local owned restaurants....so if for no other reason, this place deserves a visit just because it is fighting against the chain mentality in PHX.

zj1fXQLJ3hLbSV3lhLLSCA.text: Unique and so well hidden!  Food is delicious, Ensalada Pollo is quite appetizing!  Must say, the wait for your food is quite long for being such a small place, but it was worth waiting for.  Hope I get to sit outside next time as it has such a nice feel to it.  Not a place to go with a big group.

SU3XCcX7lSJOm98PSPsOnA.text: This place is a gem. It's a bit tucked away. It kinda felt like I was going on a bit of adventure. The restaurant was very small and oh so cozy. Just they way I likem. We had the Rock Shrimp breaded in coconut accompanied by a Thai Chili Dipping Sauce it was delicious. My main course was the Chicken breast stuffed with goat cheese, apricot, basil, spinach, shrimp and crimini mushrooms finished in a balsamic reduction glaze it was yummy. Service was on Point. I would so go again.

3cfhp56gIQDgJNv0Viy9iQ.text: I really enjoyed Fuego. I went with an old coworker who is an uber-foodie to say the least. We would attempt 1 new to both of us restaurant at least once a week. Fuego was my choice. Being that my family is from Argentina I get some AMAZING South American home cooking, not to mention my own mad cooking skillz passed down from my Abuela. This place is a little tucked away and only has about 10 tables in the dining area. We got there right at noon and took the second to last table available and there was a steady stream of people coming and going as we sat. I had the Pan Con Ropa Vieja, a braised beef sandwich. My beef was so tender and flavorful! My uber-foodie friend did not LOVE it though but I can also say that she isn't a huge fan of South American cuisine. The service was also great!

WdkPCeAD4lLqjYNiJnzc6w.text: One of the best hidden gems in Phoenix!  Great food!

tEbD0WDQ_OQQdKxEFbSLWw.text: The Chili Relleno is wonderful! There are a few other things on the menu I would like to try if I can get past it. It's quite large and stuffed with chicken,cheese,cilantro & onion. It came with black beans which are okay but, not my favorire and rice that was very tasty indeed. I also tried the flan which was excellent. I thought was food was very good and it was also presented beautifully. Yellow rice next to purple cabbage arranged to be pleasing to the eye. The flan had a dollop of whipped cream, a scattering of nuts and carmel sauce drizzled in a zig zag pattern. Food that is tasty and beautiful. I will be going here again.

eh_8UpIKF3yDqZAn-ytg5Q.text: All I can say is "WOW" Fuego is a small place but the flavors are huge the dishes are creative and savory. I travel on business a lot and I was looking for a good meal close to my hotel and Fuego it. The service was good I took some of my customers their a few weeks later for lunch and they loved it also.  This place is a hidden gem I can't wait to go back.

gDLVmh2JwbmRrIaD2QRrkw.text: I have been here a handful of times and each and every time we have been VERY pleased.  The service is awesome and the food delish!!

nXaj5-QjDlwxxdZzhbsf5A.text: So my boyfriend  and I were suppose to go to this restaurant for a friends bday I called the place to get info about the groupon. He didn't know much about it, I asked to speak to the manager or the person who put it up, he then told me he was the owner. So I said well wouldn't you know about the info that is going up on groupon and he hung up on me. So I then blocked my number and called back cause he kept forwarding the calls. So then I told him there was no reason to hang up on me I was just asking why you wouldn't know being the owner. He said no I don't need some little girl telling me how to run my business. I said that's not telling you how to run anything it was a simple question. Nothing wrong at all. He continued to be rude. I said well I guess we won't be having the birthday here and he said well sucks for you then and hung up. There was no reason for his behavior like that towards me. I was very polite and nice the whole time even when he was being rude. I feel if you're running a very expensive restaurant you would know what is on groupon and in fact be nice to customers calling with questions. He was very out of line and I feel the Phoenix area should know how this owner is to customers. I will boycott and encourage others to boycott. He has no respect for his customers. Also I couldn't tell if the owner was a female or male so the "he" part may be incorrect, I apologize if that info is incorrect for your future visit there. The reason I choose not to go is because if I'm gonna be treated like that why would they deserve my money, and how will the service be? Horrible first impression. I'll go to the outback and spend $100 on great service

ekn8Jt69b5Ji34YPGSHIag.text: The service was so-so and the menu was extremely limited. There were a handful of entree courses to choose from and half of them were smothered in a cream sauce. Also, my food came out on chipped dinnerware that probably should be thrown away.  I think the chef and owner need to think outside the culinary box if they expect to compete with other restaurants in the area. I like to support local businesses but this just didn't cut if for me. Just being honest!

0XpylvHr1K2T9cIedUGdzw.text: The food here is soooo good!  The first time I came I had to try the chicken chili relleno, as it came so highly recommended. I was not disappointed! It's your basic chili relleno kicked up a notch with the addition of tender pieces of chicken, cheese, onion, and black beans to the filling.  Oh, and it's also GIGANTIC, so come hungry. Although I usually get the chili relleno when I'm here, I've also tried a few other things like the chicken enchiladas. Mmm, chicken, cheese, and a creamy enchilada sauce. So good! The drinks here are also fantastic - I love the sangria, but also enjoy their mojitos. The restaurant itself is so quaint; by that I mean tiny but very nice inside. They do have an outdoor patio, which is great during cooler months and helps with the space issue. Service is quick and attentive. I'm cheap, so I tend to go here for lunch when the prices are a bit lower, but the food is just as delicious.

hX5kKiD1OW8IGKoV8StKew.text: This is my second food review. Still new at this...  Mojitos rocked!! And so did our fabulous bartender (going blank on name) he even checked on us during the dinner. Jeff the owner, Kevin (yes you Kevin) were the hosts with the most!! Kevin gave recommendations and was dead on with each course. Jeff was so sweet and checked in on us as well. Fuego has a great patio with a guitarist on Fri/Sat nights. A relaxing fountain added to the atmosphere.  My friend and I started with the House specialty empenadas with ground beef, cumin, garlic, and peppers (I forgot to get pics) and I chose the Pernil Asado Nachos with homemade guacamole  with shredded pork..We also ordered the CUBAN FEAST: Pernil Asado, Ropa Veija, Plantains, Arroz Gondules, and Cuban black beans and seafood enchiladas with cheddar chipotle mashed potatoes and spicy creamed corn. They didn't have the full menu that I saw on line but still had great selections. And for desert the Baked Flourless chocolate torte with dark chocolate chile sauce..All of which got put into a doggie bag for later. The portions were huge. The atmosphere was relaxing. I would go back again...Especially for the mojitos.. Check this place out its a wonderful little hideaway in Central Phoenix.

rtRUsH05jcf4-LWWCjWsLg.text: Great food, we regularly go here, best bartender, great drinks...the only thing is, I wish they were open later, we've gone there several times at 9pm to find them closing for the evening...please Fuego, please stay open later!

5AITaLKvjG-NHTo97_e9sw.text: Wonderful, flavor-filled food.  I did mention Yelp and got the 20% off as promised.  The server was very friendly and when I asked about one of the sauces the chef gave me a full run down on the ingredients.

xXiBtkQQb8jOMty5u8jN8g.text: Fuego Bistro is AMAZING!  I normally do not write reviews but I cannot get the food out of my mind.  My husband and I tried this after purchasing the Groupon on a weeknight around 5pm.  BTW this is a tiny little place, so a reservation is a must. Hands down one of our favorite places! Shortribs  cornbread casserole and Sangira!!

pQJrfJzD6wOLPLuzUiebug.text: This place is fantastic. The food is amazing, the staff is friendly, and the drinks are wonderful. Do yourself a favor and try this place!

EcMutXsvuDl7Sby7AxMODQ.text: Got a coupon for this place.  What a unique menu!  Love it!

E7p1GXwf1qpIJnA7AqRk_w.text: I really enjoyed Fuego Bistro. It's a bit noisy inside so next time I'll sit outside, depending on the weather. The tilipia was excellent as was the mashed potato side and creamed corn. On Friday and Saturday nights, they have live music outside. Overall, a great place for dinner.

nVTy9KQBdndNzYxE7NLhkQ.text: The food was fantastic, as was the service.  The location is a little hard to find, but well worth the effort.  I cannot say enough good things about this restaurant.  I will be back!

rGOh_eFmnTtq7DJ8272dnQ.text: Decided to do something different for Thanksgiving so I gave Fuego a call for some Paella.  They were more than accommodating for a large order of Paella, which was delicious.

fTSHNpw6-hHju2C8IjxLKg.text: Fuego Bistro never disappoints!  We had the Latin Feast for dinner, everything was delicious. So much food!  Get the Feast!!  Service was amazing, we are still talking about it this morning!  Love love love Fuego Bistro.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uTNl8vcyUfWV4dyR9ZJ-LQ.text: Where do I start this is one of my favorite places in Phoenix! Aside from anything with shell fish (because I am allergic), I have tried everything on the menu at this point and the food is absolutely wonderful! My favorite being the enchiladas, the sauce is out of this world! And the Nachos are a must! Always love sitting outside with the water fountains and enjoying live music. The staff is always courteous and does a great job! Love every time I get to come here!

c5fhMKwBvjO3x5LodvRk9w.text: Had another amazing meal here. I always get the chicken breast which seems boring,  but this is clearly the best chicken breast I have ever had. Really. My wife usually gets the steak of the today: tonight like a two inch thick New York. Jeff is so friendly when we go, and the rest of the staff (Kennedy tonight) goes out of their way to make the experience memorable.

vN4Kva1AneaLEFLSOAKNCg.text: In an alley, off a side street is this wonderful restaurant. Every morsel of food we had was wonderfully prepared and extremely flavorful. We started with before dinner mojitos and concluded the meal with a Kahlua Creme Brulee. In between we had an appetizer of bistro cornbread, an two entrees (pernil asado & short rib enchiladas). If you can, try and arrive during "social hour" for the reduced price cocktails and appetizers. We traveled 100 miles roundtrip to dine here and it was well worth it. We shall return and recommend this hidden gem to our friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My birthday dessert....kahula creme brulee....outstanding!
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pernil asado (slow cooked pork) with green beans and glazed carrots.
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short rib enchiladas with oaxacan cheese, tortillas, mole sauce, green beans and creamed corn.

fJxLTPstDpvcztUK_i9LCA.text: I love the area, the food selections! I loved the seasoning and everything was great including a great atmosphere and live music out on the patio. A lil small but worthy lil gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bomb drink, great presentation

496fYsB7daKX9fNRIb0xgA.text: Awesome food! Can't say enough good things about the service. I went there with a group from work and everyone loved it.

B-8h_M95tdy6ANI4bBNDTw.text: The food-great. The service-bad. So. I had a Groupon for lunch. I ate lunch. When I went to pay, bartender told me I didn't buy lunch?? I know Groupon can be tricky. If the service was better, I would forgive it. My son and I......both had a soda. Both empty. She picks mine up to refill. Both empty!?! So I walked it to her. My soup. Asked if it came with bread. She said no. I asked for some crackers. She said she would check, but didn't think the kitchen had any???? It's a kitchen. It came with some damn good cornbread. I almost went 3 stars, but waiter made it a poor interaction.

2Q_VZeX-gE8XAhCQMWUYqA.text: I had dinner here with a friend for Restaurant Week--Had the paella which was terrific.  This review is about the service and response.  The service was terrific throughout the meal--they were busy that night--but everything went fine.  When I got home, I did the math in my head and realized we had been overcharged.  I called them that night and the immediate response was, yes indeed a mistake had been made and how can we make it right.  They indicated that my refund would be available for pick up at my convenience.  A few days later, I got a text that said not only was my refund waiting for me, but they were also including a gift card.  I thought it was a nice gesture and showed concern for their customer.

FUi5I0nojVvUDly7_LY2Gw.text: Love this new find!  Awesome food and drink!  First time we came the place was so busy it was over an hour wait to get in, so we left with stomachs growling because everything smells so good as the wait staff walked by with orders -  so we got smarter and made reservations on our return trip.  So worth it!  I had the seafood special and my boyfriend had the nights grilled salmon special.  Everything was exquisite - the food, the service and our drinks!  We will put this place on our favorites list.  Wonderful- just wonderful. Do yourself a favor and try this place out -you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum

ZuwFbSQu5BpcQy8bLW3nEA.text: Went back on a 'Living Social' deal with some Friends.  Drinks - Still Fantastic Food - ALL (Variety on the 'deal') GREAT!!! What a great little eclectic place.......

e0I5p8np1jls1gxLXNrrsg.text: We've been going to Fuego for years and the food and service are always excellent. Atmosphere is also fantastic, as is the live music (when they have it). Highlights for me: sauteed prawns, cornbread, and spicy margarita.

uzR4kqUlEjv804UFQ_a-UA.text: We tried this restaurant for the first time on Saturday night. We all ordered the special where you can get a four course meal for $40 I believe... we got soooo much food! Everything we got was so good! I ordered the paella with green beans and mashed potatoes it was all fabulous. Everyone at the table loved their dinner. I was a little nervous before we arrived about the service because of what I read on yelp but we had excellent service. Are drinks were refilled, and our waitress was on on it with the entire meal. Nice band playing outside made for a great atmosphere. Thanks so much!

jF9dBO8bKRKVZkCKpvTFZg.text: Just had dinner at Fuego Bistro last evening and it was delicious as usual. I had the Pork Medallions with mashed potatoes and carrot as my two sides. All delicious. I cleaned my plate and didn't have room for dessert. I really like the setting. Far enough off 7th St to not have the traffic noise and with umbrellas and misters it was cool enough to sit outside. Perfect!

7sHy-zfn4OKbmP9DDVbXvw.text: A little hard to find but holy wow! It was so worth it when we arrived. In the back of a little hidden courtyard we found a small 12 table restaurant with a 10 page menu full of exciting cocktails, wines & delicious food.  I was so hungry I didn't even take pictures.  We had the HH Pork Nachos, Tacos, Salmon Croquettes and all was delicious. To finish the meal I enjoyed the Ancho Chile Flourless Chocolate Torte!  Interested to see this place at night time with their live music.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. HH Ancho Chile Chocolate Torte
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. HH Blanco Margarita &amp; The Green Gossip!

BqB8o65QGmqMf26gQpYppQ.text: My husband and I love everything about this place. The food was amazing, phenomenal outside atmosphere, and friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blanco margarita on happy hour
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cubano sliders
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood kabobs with rice and green beans

cNbvyU1yiaep_jprQse5XQ.text: We just tried Fuego Bistro for the first time and can't wait to go back. Their menu is creative and they serve large portions of excellent food. The appetizer sampler was great, an Empanada, Cubano Slider and Veggie Tostado served with fresh salsa, yum. The Paella, Ropa Vieja and Sangria did not disappoint. We finished with the Berry Empanada served with Pina Colada ice cream. Everything was really delicious. The staff is friendly and made us feel right at home. This place is truly a hidden gem.

Cz_cVVxl1pLvpLFAgqcHWA.text: Our First time-we came for the social hour And it was delicious. Loved the chicken chili relleno, the maple syrup ancho carrots and the pernil tacos, and great green and red house salsas, accompanied by Whoopie on the Beach cocktail Every aspect of the meal was treated with care, including rice and black beans.  The dessert-warm flourless chocolate torte with House made ice cream--OMG-to die for and too much for two, so some for breakfast tomorrow. I'm a baker and it is rare to find a dessert better than I make at home.  Atmosphere on patio cozy with good music Sinatra etc  We'll be back, with friends.

9dh6Wmr2F9bt47ZB3SEjfQ.text: This restaurant has really interestingly different food that is excellent. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Our banana burrito desert was awesome as well. Only complaint is the prices are steep.

OuquzKxzFbSkSvi5DGwq9A.text: Such a cute location and the atmosphere was great. We sat on the patio where there was live music.   It was very busy and they couldn't get to us right away, but I had great company with me and we barely noticed.  All of the staff was very friendly and apologetic for the wait.  I had the special for the night, which was Mahi Mahi, and my date had a pork dish. Both were AMAZING!   We will definitely be returning.

tNSng-DkqEYS0HA-YCbi1g.text: Outstanding!!  Service, vibe and absolutely awesome meals!!  Short Rib Enchilada, Surf & Turf, Pork Tenderloin and Seafood Chili Rellenos all top of the line.  Will not only be back, but will recommend Fuego Bistro highly.  Thank you for a stellar dining experience!!

sLuqtIyojXCc-EdO4cuqow.text: I am very glad that my mom and I weren't deterred by Fuego's sort of hidden location and lack of visible crowd. We had a fantastic dinner this past weekend.   Service was great - enthusiastic and informative.   Mom started with a coconut mojito (one of Fuego's signature cocktails) and I had a glass of white sangria. I don't even like coconut and I thought her drink was delicious.  We shared an order of empanadas as an appetizer, per the recommendation of fellow Yelpers. I don't remember what they were stuffed with but they were good. I could have perhaps used a guac or some kind of dip, but then again I am a condiment freak.   I let our server pick my entree, between their nightly special (a blackened mahi mahi in tomatillo cream sauce) or the short rib. He chose the mahi for me and it was really, really good. All entrees come with your choice of 2 sides and I chose some sauteed green beans and jalapeno creamed corn. The creamed corn was tasty, but definitely had a kick to the aftertaste! Mom got the seafood stuffed chile relleno and let me tell you it was AWESOME. I was super jealous of her entree but she was nice and let me have a bite or three. I would definitely come back just to have that dish. Yum.  I will also be back to check out Fuego's happy hour, which runs Tuesday through Saturday from 3-6pm and includes a bunch of small plates and discounts on booze.

4wOywDC0eE65ulMrD9ODKg.text: Wow - I hadn't been to Fuego Bistro in years and was pleasantly surprised by our excellent meal, great service and beautiful setting on the patio.  I had purchased a Living Social certificate, so we decided to try it out one Friday night.  First off, to really enjoy the experience, make sure you request a table on the patio so you can enjoy the nice live guitar music as well.  The entire menu sounded amazing, so it was difficult to narrow down the choices and decide what to enjoy.  I finally settled on the chicken stuffed with spinach, apricots and cheese special with a side of jalapeno cream corn and a green chili cornbread to share with my husband.  He thoroughly enjoyed his pork medallion entree with a side of chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes.  Next time we want to try the feast to taste many different items as it appears you can't go wrong!  We can't wait to go back, so try this place out pronto!

0yIsN6ZMb3FtznDParCWcQ.text: Wow! The portions here are way more generous than I had expected.   Not to sound like a total cheapskate but the prices had scared me off of Fuego Bistro for a long time. The menu sounded great and I came for lunch and LOVED my Cuban sandwich - A LOT - but dinner seemed steep.   Came for happy hour and had a top notch mojito and enjoyed delicious sliders. Still, for dinner... I wasn't convinced.   I saw a Groupon but the conditions (must buy 2 entrees) didn't earn any points for me, personally. My friend, however, had a Groupon and suggested we meet here for dinner.   Holy mole! The dinner portions are HUGE. No wonder the prices are what they are. You can easily share an entree - or take home left overs. There must've been a dozen shrimp on my plate. MOUNDS of pork on the other. You get to choose 2 sides and they're all wonderful.   So, to put an end to this long story... do NOT let the dinner prices scare you off. The food is delicious and you get your money's worth, not just in the quality but in the quantity too!

Nftpyw0uhh_vw4ri52hH6g.text: Came here this past Saturday during Phoenix Food Week and got their Pre Fixe special for the event.  It was 30$ and had 3 courses including a free drink choice. Not a shabby deal.  I went with a date and we agreed to get different things so we can sample more of their offerings.  For my drink I got the Blood Orange Mojito.  Supposedly this place is known for their Mojitos, but as a huge fan of Mojitos, I can tell you that the Mojito is simply "Ok".  They use Monin syrup for their flavorings so dont expect an actual prickly pear or blood orange in your mojito.  The other drink we got was a Carribean Volcano which was made with SoCo and some other medely...but all I could taste was Pineapple.  Ok so drinks aren't their thing....on to the food.  Course 1:  There was 4-5 things to choose from but the two that caught our eyes were the Salmon Croquette and the Chili Empanada.  From what I hear, the Empanada is also something that Fuego Bistro is known for.  I dont know if maybe I got unlucky but I really did not care for the Empanada.  The shell was crispy and tasty but the beef filling was bland and boring.  The pico de gaio sprinkled on top did not really do anything to the dish either.  In contrast...the Salmon Croquette was amazing...I want to go back and order a whole meal of that! lol.  The salmon was perfectly mixed with the other spices in the Croquette and it was cooked perfectly.  Course 2:  We got the Pernil Asada and the Tilapia.  Both dishes were tasty and I cant say anything bad about them, I also cannot say anything great about them either.  The Tilapia was basically Country Fried with a mild sauce on top and the Pernil Asada was a well executed pulled pork.  Each dish came with 2 sides and I can safely say that the side dishes impressed me more then the main course.  The creamed corn was heavenly, the Mashed Potatoes were delicious and the cornbread was phenomenal....(im out of adjectives, sue me)  The Green Beans were cooked well but needed seasoning...simply adding some salt fixed that problem.  Course 3:  We got the Bread Pudding and the Chocolate Torte.  Both were served with a scoop of ice cream that had chocolate slivers in it.  I gotta say, the bread pudding was awesome...I wish there was more of it, though im sure my waistline is glad there wasent.  I am not a fan of heavy chocolate dishes so the Torte was not for me, but if you ask my date how it was she would probably describe the event as orgasmic...at least thats what it sounded like.

u0NhPvkllonfrxtC2k4OWA.text: After my third visit to Fuego, I am finally writing a review! I was early for my hair appt (Veez, next door) and my stylist was still with her previous client, so I went next door for a happy hour drink.  After perusing the hh menu, I decided on a margarita and the pork nachos. I wasn't hungry, but i am a sucker for pork and nachos... Put em together and seems like a winning combination, right?  Well, it is!! Wow, that pork is so incredibly tasty. It was all I could do not to moan at the bar while I ate them. The chips are good and thick (girth is important ;) ) There was perfect amount of melted cheese, black bean salsa and a nice pile of guacamole on top. I put a serious hurting on them nachos. And my margarita you ask? Fantastic! With salt, on the rocks... Classic. Delish. Perfect accompaniment to the nachos.   I honestly can't remember what I ate on the two previous visits, as they were sometime last year, but I've not been disappointed in the food. On one visit last year, the service was a little slacking, but not enough to keep me from wanting to go back. I think I'll always plan to be early for hair appts now...

R3yDeRvE6f_J3KvDQ6l2Jg.text: Lunchtime on a Wednesday, four of us and I only saw one other table of 2 come in.  Maybe it was the monsoon weather, but it was sweltering!  Cute, warm colored walls and original artwork. It could have used some fans.  I think we would have sat outside if it wasn't so hot.   I ordered the Cubano sandwich.  Lot of really good roasted pork!  I opted for beans and rice over fries. Both were nicely seasoned and the rice was good (it can be really bad at some places) Huge portions and our server was super friendly and relaxed and kept my water glass filled.   Desserts all sounded to heavy.  Might be nice to go in the evening and have coffee and something.   Triple check directions, it's off the main street and parking is common to other businesses in the court.

yrVTS3X_JnP3vM6-oMktOQ.text: Another incredible fisrt time dinning experience, thanks to Groupon. The restaurant itself is set back away from the street away from the noise. We were warmly greeted by the bartender as we walked inside, of this quaint little hidden romantic spot. Service was top notch, especially our waiter Jesus Ruiz!

klf3UWBl4TY5zzPkBxo2Qg.text: I just read the owner comment to my review & lowered to 1-STAR. The worst customer service!!

9zl7LC9So7-Wdy9_Ts0dMA.text: I have been to this place about 3 times now.  Although I do enjoy the outdoor dining, lights, nice music, etc. this last time was not so good.  Maybe this was because it was a Friday?? The place was very busy and although we got seated fairly quickly it was at a table situated above an overhead mister which dripped water on me throughout my meal.  I managed to maneuver around the problem so it would not hit my head or food.  I have to admit, it  sort of surprised me that the establishment was not aware of this problem.  At any rate, I did not mention it to the staff until much later in my meal and I did not ask to be moved since I managed a "work around" the problem.  The music that evening was louder than the previous evenings.  I personally prefer music to be an undertone when I am dining.  Don't get me wrong, the music was good, I just hate having to raise my voice to be heard over dinner which is the last thing I feel like doing on a Friday evening toward my significant other.  I am starting to question the food here  -- the fact that it comes out so quickly makes me feel like I am being served fast food and the prices do not reflect that. Perhaps it's the ambiance we pay for.  The dessert we shared was, in our opinion, not so good even though we ate it but who has not eaten something they thought was not that great??  If we all did that, how would that change dining out?  Everybody has different taste buds and dietary concerns as well.

8QbQC4K80oD0QHJknCpShA.text: Excellent as always!! Tried the pork tenderloin this time and it was fantastic! A great combination of flavors and the side dish of green chile cornbread casserole is a must!!! If you don't get this as a side, it's a wasted trip! ;-) Also, always start your meal with an appetizer and highly recommend the empanadas!!

Ll2bADU1WchBA_RBtM8r3A.text: This review is based on two visits. The first was during restaurant week with a group of friends. I had the short ribs and was wowed by the sweet/savory tender meat and the delicious cheddar mashed potatoes that came with the entree. The serving sizes of all the food was so ample, I mis-judged the capacity of my stomach and overate. The service was fine that night. I remember our waitress being very acommodating and prompt. We sat in the pleasant, quiet patio area and had a really nice dinner.   I went back with my husband a month or so later after telling him how good it was. This time, I ordered the nightly special, a grilled tuna dish. The tuna itself was fine, actually seemed like a high quality piece of fish. My criticism was that they served a large piece of tuna unsliced. It made the fish kind of chewy because I had to cut off large pieces with a less-than-ideal steak knife.   So, the worst part was that the service was poor enough that even I was annoyed. We sat and waited for our dishes to be cleared and our bill to be presented for probably 20-30 minutes. I'm usually pretty tolerant of mediocre service, but man! If it was like this every time, I would definitely have to avoid the place even though I like the food. I plan to give it another go, hoping the poor service was a fluke.

_G-PskSWkskW40zOutjf3w.text: Took us a few minute to find the spot - tucked in on a side street as it was, in a courtyard of a older, kitchy shopping area. Between the old gurgling fountain, colorful christmas lights, old trees and flowering coriander plants, my girlfriend and I quite enjoyed the offbeat decore. Not your typical bistro spot.   The waitstaff were attentive and friendly, especially our waiter, a young dude who's name escapes me. He answered my celiac girlfriend's questions courteously, and was mild mannered and easy-going in a way that really suited the environs. Happy hour menu looked great, and the house marg and mojito were both fresh, simple and tasty.  GF got mussels and a street tacos, with the mussels being right up there with the best she had, and the tacos fresh, tasty and clean.  My main course was the Soy & Cola braised short-ribs with something-something au-jus, I opted for the mashed potatoes and maple chile glazed carrots as sides. At this point, i was feeling like, while the drinks were good, and the atmosphere & service was quirky, natural and relaxed, I wasn't totally expecting the food to blow me away - I was wrong. The dish was both incredibly well balanced and delicious (and very healthy portions at that). Spicy, rich and fall apart tender meat, with gentle touches of sweet, fruity, savory and spicy. The potatoes were addicting, and the carrots (being from Vermont, and a maple lover, i know that maple can be a difficult thing to cook with) were not over sweet, but perfectly tender, buttery, a touch of salt and heat.  All in all a great, friendly and offbeat dining experience. We'll be back.

5pC-iWntoxT8wjTaDpE00w.text: This is our favorite place to take friends or to go it alone whenever we can! Delicious food, comfortable outdoor patio, great entertainment and friendly staff. Not to mention being able to text in a reservation! So cool! Pernil Asado and Bistro Seafood Chile Relleno are our favorites and any of the sides are delish. My "Major Foodie" bro-in-law who lives in Vancouver, BC, dreams about the meal he had here last year. Just for grins I send him photos of our meal when we visit, just to get him drooling. Fuego Bistro never disappoints except when they close on Sun and Mon. Lol. They deserve the days off since they work so hard for us the other 5 days!

zyjD-nz2J15pywOTwUX7YA.text: Continues to be one of my favorite places in Phoenix.  We do not live here, so look forward to returning for this restaurant.  Try everything.  Leave room for dessert; they are all fabulous.  I love sitting out in the courtyard.  I prefer lunch as it is not as crowded.

L7Xevc8LnV71WVcRKUfErw.text: Great happy hour for both food and wine!  There is live music nightly and both inside and patio have a nice atmosphere. Excited to come back for dinner soon!

zZYFWKNDleT-QevlUnO8SA.text: We really like Fuego Bistro. It has one of the best patios in Phoenix, the staff and host are awesome, and the food is spot on. They have a great wine list and the short ribs is one of the best dishes in Phoenix. When the little lady and I dine at Fuego, we always share the short ribs and the pork. For sides, I get the cornbread and mashed tatters, she gets the tatters and green beans. The one downside is this is what we always get. We really like this combo, but we haven't really found anything else we like. We have tried almost all their other entrees, and several specials but haven't found anything we would order again. With that said, I would recommend the short ribs to anybody, anytime, over most all other Phoenix restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short ribs, pernil asado, with mashed potatoes and green beans.

XNBFnTOhXLhMPGckOVbxXQ.text: Only had one waitress, that had her young daughter sitting up at the bar eating lunch, A table was trying to get her attention she told them to wait while she attended to her daughter whom seemed to have been OK eating her lunch while we sat there for 10 minutes waiting to be helped there was only 3 tables with patrons and they all had food. That was just the beginning of the bad experience...we were going to leave but I had bought a voucher from Amazon Local and because of the time they wouldst except it I talked to the owner who was very rude and didn't want to give away food even though I paid for my voucher......Will never go back there again.....Amazon did refund my money

m_XHR6Z637CehWhyrU_HXQ.text: We went to dinner at Fuego Bistro last week.  It was a great night to sit out on the patio and have ourselves a quiet dinner with some delicious food.  If you've never been here before, its' tucked away off the street so it might be a little hard to find.  It's outdoor seating is set in a courtyard with indoor seating set in the building behind it.  We walked up to the hostess who was very warm and welcoming and she asked if we had a reservation.  We didn't, but she was still able to accommodate us.  She sat us next to the water fountain which was very relaxing.  We then were promptly greeted by our waitress who was extremely nice and a little playful.  I really liked that.  We ordered our drinks and then perused the menu.  We placed our order...  I had to do it. I had to have the Cola & Pineapple Soy Braised Angus Short Rib Roast.  When I got this, it was like heaven met earth!  SO tender and flavorful!  With your meal you are able to order 2 sides.  I had to have the cornbread and mashed potatoes.  The cornbread is amazing! So moist and the texture isn't like traditional cornbread.  The potatoes too were so yummy, I couldn't' stop eating them.  Yes my plate was pretty much a carb-fest, but sometimes you just have to do it.     If you're in the area, check them out sometime.  I know on the weekends they can get pretty busy, so maybe make a reservation to be safe.

2Ed9snOjxvAaw8lqw3-kLw.text: Finally made it to this hidden gem...have to go back and check if anyone else had to search for it. The fact that it is inside the courtyard of the complex threw us off for a couple of minutes. Liked that we had to hunt for it a bit!  This is a place where once you start eating, you want to fast forward to the next day so you can try something else on the menu.  Dined off the happy hour menu.  First, if you order a salad of the HH menu....it is the big dinner salad, so be advised....you will get filled up! Jeannie and I each had different salads and they were both very good.  The downside was that we could not gorge ourselves on the other good stuff .   BBQ pernil sliders & tilipia tacos....too hard to call one the winner.  Will require a rematch or two....  Will be coming back until we get through the entire menu!...at least a couple times.  Happy hour means drinks and the bistro did not disappoint here either. Jeannie went with a well liked sangria and I tossed back two margaritas. Very picky about my margaritas and this was a good one. They do use a bottled pre-mix, which I didn't recognize, but it was neither too sweet or sour...the death knell of a good marg and a waste of a shot of tequila.  P.S. Was in Costco two days later and saw a gift card offer.... $49.99 for  $100 in gift cards! They are good at all three locations. Guess you know what we are buying!

aC6wzwR3o5yrBwkq29u47g.text: There is nothing more exciting than trying a new restaurant without any huge expectations and being blown away. I was celebrating my gf's b-day week and we decided to check out Fuego Bistro. Thank goodness we found this place, the experience from beginning to end was flawless. You can tell immediately that the food is made with love, every single thing we ordered was absolutely flavorful. We started with their cornbread 1/2 portion, personally I didn't eat it as it contains bacon and I don't do meat but my gf said it was the best cornbread she's ever had. For our entrees we ordered from the "small plates" section as we wanted to definitely save room for dessert. I ordered the fish tacos and she ordered the Peasant paella. My tacos: OMG, 1 bite in and it was love. They use 2 tortillas to make sure you have a good hold of all the good stuff and nothing falls out. Mind you, they are full of good stuff. Let's just say if the fish was missing, I wouldn't care, everything in this taco was magical! Did you hear me, magical I say (I don't use this word often for food mind you). I will DEFINITELY be ordering their tacos again. I liked that as a pescatarian they had veggie options as well. Black beans: I'm cuban guys, we live off black beans as it's a staple in the cuban culture. OH man, these beans tasted just as good if not better than what my family made growing up. They are legit, tasty, unbelievable black beans! Totally unexpected to love them so much but like I said, made with love. Glazed carrots: Damn, best carrots ever! If a restaurant's sides are this good, you won't be able to wait for your entree and dessert! Peasant paella: One of the best paella's she's ever had, and this is a dish she grew up eating made by spaniards. It did look great with a perfect balance or rice to meat ratio and delectable flavors. Mind you we both felt for the "small plates" the portions were plentiful and filling. Then for dessert we opted on the berry empanadas with pineapple icecream on top. WOW! One bite in, again that magical dreamlike experience in your mouth. Absolutely made with love, from scratch with tons of berries. I wouldn't have changed 1 single thing from our entire dining experience. Now, the service. It was slow when we went, about 8ish on a weekday. We were greeted right away with a smile from our lovely server and another server which was nearby also gave us great service such as refilling our waters, offering suggestions on some food items and picking up our empty dishes. I LOVE getting great service, being in the food industry in the past it is just AWESOME when a restaurant gets it right. We visited several restaurants (all very different cuisines) during my gf's birthday week and I must say, Fuego bistro won hands down best meal of the week. It was such an awesome experience I would've paid twice as much for our meal because man, it was just that good. This doesn't happen to us that often, to be THIS pleased with an overall dining experience in every possible way. Well, guess what Fuego bistro? Not only will we most definitely be coming back, but you've made our list of places to take all our out of town guests to knowing they too will have an amazing mouthwatering experience. Thank you so much for having such an attentive staff, cozy but inviting atmosphere and ridiculously great food. Much appreciated.

Td9MVhOtP8OFBY9Ct4jImw.text: Wow. What a nice little find. Bought a living social for this place and tried it out. Based on the location I was not expecting much but what a nice surprise. Food was very good and service was excellent. Small but interesting location in a courtyard. Heat lamps so we are outside and listened to live Jazz. Will definitely go back.

6Qic4zELJIh_1lXchmLllw.text: Tried this place for the first time last night.  Expiring groupon coupons will force you to do it, NOW!  It was early,  so getting a table wasn't a problem, or parking (small parking lot, can definitely see it as a problem finding a place once it gets crowded).  We were greeted by a lovely hostess and given the option of indoor or outdoor, we chose indoors - cozy place with tables somewhat close in proximity to each other....I can tell you what they were talking about at each table around us- "I would have left him too if he acted like that" LOL!!    Our server was very nice, answered all our questions, we told her we were first timers, and she educated us on the menu and made some suggestions - which were fabulous!  Drinks were delish (red sangria for both my hubby and I) and then we ordered the salmon croquets (so good), entrees my husband had the pulled pork, and I had the enchiladas - both very good and plentiful.  My only negatives are these   1) food came too fast, we had just started to enjoy our drinks when the appetizer arrived, I like to enjoy my drink a bit before I start eating, didn't happen had to start on my croquets NOW, then half way through our croquets, here comes our entrees  - I felt rushed and don't like that my food has to sit on the side and wait till i'm done with my appetizer (it was simply too good to let go and we were paying for it).   2) Had a hard time distinguishing staff from customers, not that i want to see uniforms on staff but wasn't sure if the lady with the coat was just taking food to & from random tables ...and there was a guy that kept rubbing girls shoulders (on staff masseuse perhaps) just give me something that helps me determine who's who   3) kinda pricey...here's an idea scale back the portions and adjust the price.  Portions are LARGE - but I don't think enchiladas should cost $27.00, and pulled pork $25.00.  Salmon croquets (2) $14.00 - come on man...... (we chose sides of mashed potatoes and corn bread, my husband had cornbread and green beans).  Didn't save room for dessert and we just couldn't finish the meal...too much, saving it for the next day.

kHXtsw1DkvaoqgihViwXtQ.text: This is the second time we have been here via GROUPON. This time we sat on the patio. I highly recommend the patio seating. Even this time of year where out evenings get pretty cold, they have the heaters working. I had to take my jacket off. The heaters made the patio area the perfect temperature for enjoying eating outside on the patio. This is a Saturday night so live music is playing. What a wonderful time. We are warmly greeted and quickly seated. We had a reservation, and I'd recommend you have one as well. This place packs up. With a GROUPON you must get an entree. Although you are getting $30 off the bill, it does limit you as to what you can get. Next time we are going without the coupon so we can try the other many non entree items on the menu. I had the short rib enchilada with a mole sauce. It was wonderful. My wife had the seafood Chili Relleno. It was also an amazing dish. Sangria's are great. And the mixed berry empanada for dessert was a great finish along with a french press coffee. If I could give more than 5 stars I would.

UCgSvVMYvpYcDT3G7YEwrQ.text: What a foodie gem in the Valley! I was hesitating to write a review as I want to keep this gem in the circle!!!! Great outdoor seating in the courtyard with numerous different size tables. We came without a reservation on a busy Saturday night  and were seated within 10 minutes! Everybody was very kind and super nice. The place was very busy but you can immediately notice the stuff was working as a team, checking on everybody and bringing the food out with a smile. It felt like I was in my Latin friends house! The courtyard is so cozy and has local art! We ordered 3 different tapas! Let me tell you - they are perfect sharing size ! We were so full. You might think the restaurant is pricey but I believe you get what you pay for. It was certainly worth the bill!Excellent food! Great wine! And not to mention live music! Good live music. Not over the top... not loud... just a great place for either a romantic date or friends gathering! Love -love -love Fuego Bistro! Phoenix food scene has great future!

Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yAwpWvyX6RWFhdohLKrDmQ.text: Saturday night lead us to Fuego .The location is near a very up and coming booming area with other great restaurants and bars. Luckily we didn't drive , as this place is tucked away and was tricky to find at night! Upon reading the menu, that's part of its charm:'hidden' , 'secret hideaway' &'tucked away'. We had reservations & were seated in the courtyard. The hostess, who was on her cell phone, decided to seat us at a far back table in the patio , ( other tables for two were available near the live music ). The patio is charming with iron tables & a fountain.  The live music, though not Latin, was a nice romantical touch. Here is where the issue begins & it would follow thru the evening :service. We waited a good 13 minutes for anyone to greet us &take a drink order. When I asked to see the wine list  as the drink menu has a quip at the bottom and I quote , 'a library of unique and quirky wines is also available', response given to me from our waiter was, 'What is it that you are looking for? The bartender just keeps different wines back there.' I looked at him so confused, because I was. I asked for a sparkling wine & was told ,'Oh no, yeah , we don't have that, just these', as he points again to the wines listed on the menu. Okay, confused I may be, but I can bend & clearly this waiter was not interested in explaining why the wine menu said there 'may' be more! So, I ordered the Remix Sangria, a mix of red and white wine sangria. It came with fresh fruit & not too sweet. Perusing the menu for the next 20 minutes (yes 20!) we found a lot of items we wanted to order! The menu is very Latin with classics like Empanadas & Croquettes. We ordered the Empanadas & Sauteed Prawns. These two orders were HUGE! The empanadas are like 'turnover' size! They were full of ground beef, cheese, peppers and so much goodness! The prawns were so delicious: two sauces divide the plate for a nice presentation: a green tomatillo sauce and a chipotle chile sauce that's sweeter and down the middle of both: mango and avocado chutney! This was a great dividing balance for the spice of the shrimp. I truly wanted more of the mango chutney. It was chunky and fresh! My entree choice was the Pernil Asado: authentic Latin slow roasted pork served with orange habanero mojo & corn tortillas. Again, HUGE entrees! My husband had the Short Rib Enchiladas : a sweet flavor of cola & pineapple over the tender short rib and Oaxacan cheese stuffed into tortillas and topped with more of the cola sauce. It tasted much like a sweet mole to me. Very tender and rich. The entrees come with TWO sides. There is an abundance of sides to choose from. I had a Fuego Salad that was said to be 'small'; its full size! I also ordered the Black Beans. My husband is a carb king! He ordered the Green Chile Cornbread ( the size of a hand!) & the Chipotle Mashed Potatoes. Now for the big, fat negative: The only thing on my plate that was hot were the black beans. My tortillas were literally cold to the touch. The pork , although amazing in taste, was lukewarm. The mojo, barely warm at all. The salad was served when the meal came. Pet peeve. We also had now ran out of water and drinks. We flagged down a bus boy, ( seemingly the only one working on a busy Saturday night, & a hostess who would not put her cell phone down! ) who would bring a water pitcher out and fill a table next to us; go drop the pitcher & he's done! I asked for lemon ; never got it. The busser got our server to take our drink orders , who then sent a runner with my second sangria but forgot my husbands beer. She came back a few minutes later with it; in a Latin restaurant, water is needed! THAT said , I wasn't going to send my food back for a heating up. It may have taken another twenty minutes to get! There were only two small corn tortillas with my meal. We just never saw the waiter & again, the hostess never helped anyone. We ordered the Ancho Chile Chocolate Torte to share from  our waiter who finally showed up, only because it was so unique sounding, in fact, many of the desserts are. I can not have walnuts so they were put into a small ramekin for my husband. We think this is where the 'chile' taste was in the torte , although he said it was slight. Otherwise , the torte, albeit very good, was just a chocolate flourless torte , IMO. The sauce was amazing & the Malted Ice Cream was unique! I would have loved an after dinner coffees .. but we weren't asked so, that is that. All said, great  food , but the service and unprofessionalism of the staff (taking drinks after being off to the front to gossip ??) are def things that make me rethink a return. Social Hour looks amazing with many apps & drinks for $6-7! The Latin Sampler for dinner would also be a great way to sample a lot of Latin dishes for $32.95 pp (you can not use a cert for this or Social Hour). NO one wants to pay a premium for lackluster/uncaring service. 5stars-Food 1Star-staff

LMhkYRjmBg0Dq1lzSPh5LQ.text: I've never eaten such a delicious Mexican Food until I've got here! Amazing service, delicious drinks and sympathetic staff! Oh and a real nice live music!!! I loved it!

NYhaETJyFbCyvwgGKsj2BA.text: Hidden gem that I hope stays hidden! Owner and staff are fantastic! Food is outstanding. Drinks are custom and fabulous. Patio is the best in town. Let's just keep it between us though so it doesn't get too crowded. :)

slVLaUrcMxieD5lNe5MT4A.text: Drinks, appetizers, dinner and dessert and service were excellent!! I love local restaurants where the owner is there running around to make sure everything is perfect!! Thanks Jeff!!

0l3wwSN1m_UWeO7OuZPHVg.text: We've eaten at Fuego at least a half dozen times and it is always excellent food. The menu used to have an amazing cornbread covered in pork roast yum that was always recommended as a specialty. Then, it was gone. When we asked about it, our server and the chef was always happy to accommodate and make it as they have the ingredients.  But today was a very different experience at Fuego. I feel compelled to leave a review on here in the hopes that a manager or owner will see our concerns. Our server (Sarah) gave us grief at every turn today. When we asked about our favorite dish, she made it sound like it would be a huge inconvenience to make it, but that "she'd ask." (It came out and was delicious.) When we got our bill we were given grief about using our Groupon because the cornbread was on the dinner menu, not the lunch menu (and has the price to match!). We assured her that we'd used a lunch Groupon many other times with no trouble. "Well, we already made an exception by making it and I don' think you can use your Groupon, but I'll ask."  She mentioned the huge exception one last time when she dropped off the bill.  Sheesh. Server to server -- just say "no problem." There's no manger out there that is NOT going to accommodate a more expensive meal or a pre-paid Groupon. We've met the owner of Fuego before, and he's awesome -- once offered to buy us dessert because we knew a mutual friend.  Across the street there are two new restaurants that had a steady stream of customers we watched while we ate on an empty patio. Customer service is the first thing that will drive away customers. If our experience today is any indication, I can imagine why they're not coming to Fuego.

5dmhF6NKqhazfvlK_--Stw.text: This restaurant is a fusion of Puerto Rican, Cuban, A little Mexican, Spanish and French Cuisine. The pork is cooked Puerto Rican style hence the naming on the menu "pernil". The rice is also Puerto Rican. The beans and ropa vieja are "Cuban". The Paella is from Spain. Highly recommend visiting this restaurant. The quality reminds me of New York style Latin food. Probably one of the best restaurants in the Valley.

sf3aZrtmffPWtEYWODdqAw.text: Had an appointment right around the corner so we  went here yesterday for dinner after seeing good reviews.   The entrance to this establishment is a little confusing. You have two options. A side or  front entry. Either way it's awkward cause you have to walk through the tables of patrons eating to get to the host to get seated.  The tortilla soup had a nice strong kick to it. Probably the boldest in flavor I've had. Wished I had got a bowl.  The seafood chile relleno had a great presentation but unfortunately it wasn't quite hot in temperature and the flavors didn't seem to distinguish themselves as much as I'd hoped.  The side of jalapeno corn had good flavor but the jalapeno was missing.  Bread pudding for desert it was decent.  Our experience wasn't bad but not close to spectacular either. All in all I was expecting a little more seeing 4.5 stars. Personally I would give a 3.5.  Nice atmosphere, we sat outside. Live music was being set up as we were leaving.
