VKEHSJQujwd05r5wfcttFA.text: I was introduced to this place through Groupon. If not for Groupon, I would have missed this gem.  The gentleman host was very outgoing and friendly. They provided my group of 4 a standby table while our table was being prepared.  With the space heaters, my friends and I was quite comfortable.  The servers were polite and friendly. They were trained well.  Food was simply amazing. I can understand why it has such a high score....I am contributing.  Live music was the cherry on top. Wasn't too loud. We had a great and cozy time.  Definitely be back!

GtD2rBHJWiT1dJ_3Z-Mmbw.text: It's patio weather people!! So of course I had to come and sit on the cutest little patio of Fuego Bistro. It was my husband and I's second wedding anniversary. And I thought it would be a nice romantic setting for the 2 of us. And sure enough it was. With the live music playing on the patio with us, to the pretty lights hanging above us, green sounding us, cobble stone beneath us, and sexy Latin food and drink in front of us. It was pretty much what I was hoping for. My only complaint would be the service. It took about 10-15 minutes for someone to come great our table. There were other tables that got sat after us that were greeted by their server. I am not really sure where ours was at the time, but I'm just going with he had an emergency bathroom break or something. It was just odd to me as the busser and hostess standing in the middle of everything sat and watched us sit there that long with out saying something. But, Once our server arrived everything went very smoothly.   We started off with 2 of their signature cocktails and the Salmon Croquettes - Salmon With Bacon, Onion, & Mashed Potato,Dusted With Ancho Chile, Pan Fried & Topped With A Lemon Caper Beurre Blanc Sauce. Oh man.... I do believe I will make those my meal next time. Perfectly seared, and that Lemon Caper Beurre Blanc Sauce... just amazing.   For our Entree we ended up splitting Pernil Asado - Their Signature Slow Roasted Succulent Pork,Served With An Orange Habanero Mojo & Local Corn Tortillas, with the Green Chili Cornbread Casserole, and the Chipotle Cheddar Mashed Potatoes. And boy was it plenty. Not only were we unable to fit dessert, we couldn't finish the plate. Everything had great flavor. I really enjoyed the Pork. Tender and juicy.   Thank you Fuego for making our anniversary night so great. We will be seeing you again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their Signature Pernil Asado with Green Chili Cornbread Casserole and Cheddar Chipotle Mashed. Pork was so good.
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My favorite. Salmon Croquettes with Lemon Caper Beurre Blanc Sauce. So good!

8ybTzijCxrs9PnnOE0FN6Q.text: Such a cute place, nice patio. The food was really good (We tried the empanadas and Cubano both from the lunch menu). Live music on the patio in the evenings. No problem using Entertainment Book coupon. Great service! Want to go back for dinner...

96skfgfiEfidkBVNSmQkbA.text: Came here for lunch and got the light fuego salad which was delicious! The inside is very small and quaint with a cool bar to make all the cocktails you want. The food is fresh and the atmosphere is perfect for a quick bite to eat.

2auZcAECIS8N0DYnxk5zHw.text: Absolutely loved sitting out on the beautiful patio.  The live music was wonderful and the atmosphere is really top notch.  The service was very good, we had someone come by pretty frequently to fill up waters, check to see if we needed anything, etc.  We enjoyed the margaritas - they were generous in size and didn't skimp on the tequila which is always nice.  Unfortunately there are some areas that could use some attention. Making a reservation is a pain.  Once you call the restaraunt you learn through the recorded message that you have to text a seperate number (not listed on the website).  Due to how busy the place is, it can be a bit before you get a reply, which I totally understand, but it would be really nice if there was an online reservation system or a person you could talk to.    We found the food itself to be mixed.  We both really enjoyed the short rib enchiladas (the mole is beautiful and the ribs are tender) but thought that Fuego Pasta was just OK and overpriced for what it was.  The mushrooms in the dish didn't work for us and I can't say that we felt a pasta dish needed to be served in a tortilla and then topped with fried tortilla strips.  We also tried the Horchata Bread Pudding and were a little disapointed that we couldn't taste the horchata and found it to be a little dry.  All portions were really generous, you will not leave hungry.  Overall I think there are places at this price point that have more consistent food but you won't find a better patio for a Saturday night dinner.

ngANon4VJa0IJTOYFnIzZg.text: We really enjoyed the entire meal.  We had their Latin tasting dinner which included several of their menu items.   Great outdoor area with live music.  The margaritas and horchata bread pudding were my favorite. We will be back.

kSmk_9CuLn6WWpyZQcAtbA.text: this is my favorite restaurant in phoenix!!! the waiters are so awesome and make sure you are taken care of. My all time favorite dish is the empanadas, and the chile relleno. For the main course my family likes to split the pasta and chicken!!! Highly recommend!!!

Ej6dTgxubrsmkcPpY1hUrA.text: Holy crap.... What a waste of time and money! I should have listened to the previous commenters. Such a disaster and so unprofessional.  We went here on last night (Saturday night), got a sitter, got the Groupon, and wanted a great meal. Ya know, the whole bit. It's the first time we had been out in a while so our expectations were high, especially for the stars and detailed reviews on here. We pulled up and there wasn't enough parking. We found parking down the street and walked through the side entrance. We passed five separate staff members and not one said "Hello" or even acknowledged us. We obviously looked lost and yet had no idea where to go.  We found our way up to the stand and the host called me "Boss" every time and was very unprofessional. We were seated right away outside and were seated on a slanted table and chairs. It took at least 10 minutes for the server to come out and greet us. She was at first interested in us, but once we mentioned the Groupon, she told us the terms of the Groupon and disappeared.  We ordered an appetizer, The Tour de Fuego. The Salmon Croquette was dry, flaky, and had overbearing taste with the capers on top. The Empanada (the popular item that everyone raves about) was overcooked and had a very strange sauce on top. The veggie tostada is a joke. The highlight of the meal...and I mean the whole meal was the Cubano Sliders.  We were sitting outside for this meal and were extremely parched. We had to ask for refills from just about everyone else but our waitress. She was no where to be found. Once she finally returned, we had some questions about the menu but she seemed less than interested in going through the menu with us. She was put-off with our questions.  We asked for recommendations on the entrees, we were pitched the Pernil Asado and the Short Rib Enchiladas. The Pernil Asado came out dry. There were hard pieces of pork and hardly any flavor. Worst part was they only included two small, and I mean SMALL tortillas with the plate. For $25 I would expect a hell of a lot more than that! My wife ordered the Short Rib Enchiladas had an overbearing Mole sauce that just made her gag. I thought it was because she's 8 months pregnant but I tried it and found it to be overbearing. The meal comes out like mush and leaves much to be desired. In addition to the disappointing food, our sides were wrong and the whole experience was a disaster.   To end the disaster we tried paying with our Groupon, which we showed to the waitress upon arrival. She looked at the Groupon again and straight up told us that she couldn't accept it. We didn't meet the terms of the Groupon. We asked for clarification and she told us that we had to order Four Entrees after she just told us that we had to order Two Entrees. WHAT THE EFF? I sat there asking her what she could do and all she could say was that I could order two more entrees or settle the bill and leave.THIS IS NOT HOW YOU TREAT YOUR GUESTS. THIS IS EXTORTION!   I won't ever return and won't even pawn this Groupon off to the next person. DO NOT GO HERE! Go somewhere were they know how to cook, know how to treat people and will anticipate your needs. The value isn't there and what you pay for is not what you get. If you want to feel like another number or to feel forgotten about throughout the meal, come to Fuego Bistro.   Oh and Mr. Owner, your snarky comments to reviewers shows just how pathetic this establishment is. Oh, and fire your staff!

-yhqVN5uc5S1CB6XzdyRnw.text: Went to Fuego Bistro last night with my girlfriend.   The Martinez cocktail was great, worth ordering.   The Argentina blended red wine was delicious.   The seafood chile relleno was ok.  Too much sauce drowned out the flavor for me.   String bean side were simple but good.   Mashed potatoes are good.  Mahi mahi special was good on flavor.   The maple glazed carrots and the corn bread are AWSOME.   The bread wasn't as hot as I liked though.     Here is the best part of the night.   STACY was Awsome.    She was a server I don't think but she was incredible.   Personable, lively, fun, friend, and she was hustling to take care of the table all night.   She was the best part of the night.  By far she made the experience   The live music was Awsome.  The guitarist had great music selection.   Although he was Awsome the music was a great variety of classic rock, country, current hits, there was no Latin music to keep with the theme of the restaurant.   I would have liked something Latin sprinkled into the mix during the time we were there.

3r3o3VlLpr2v9T7xnsM04Q.text: Oh my god, ohmygodohmygodohmygod! The food here is INCREDIBLE.  The owner is friendly, the ambiance is soft and super pleasant--even romantic if you want it to be, and did I mention the food?  A group of us went here for Restaurant Week.  SO HAPPY we did.  I had the cola and pineapple braised short ribs, the green lipped mussels, and the horchata bread pudding, along with a berry sangria.  The short ribs were amazing and a good portion.  the flavors balanced beautifully and the meat melted in my mouth.  Oh, and the sides?  The corn bread casserole was enough to make me cry for joy. the mussels had blue cheese and fresh tomatoes on top, and were good enough to be a meal on their own.  I would never have thought blue cheese and mussels could be so amazing together. The bread pudding?  Not so great.  However, I tried the key lime pie and I wished I had ordered it so I could take it home and roll around in it like a happy puppy.  Holy moly, was that key lime pie crazy delicious!  Fuego Bistro is top notch.  Loses one star because while I was there, my chair got kicked by passing waiters and busboys ELEVEN times.  Three of those times  the chair was kicked so hard I was smacked into the table.  Not exaggeration.  If they had not been packed, I would have insisted on being moved elsewhere.

W6g0fZuqIcquR2FoPMo2-g.text: I just love this small locally own business they are just so into making your experience there the best.. I had the beef short rib and my friend had the pasta. Tried both meals and equally impressive. Pictures posted. I made reservation for only  4 in our party & we got right in. The location is in a different setting at first I didn't like it but I do now.. Give them a try. Oh and the first picture is funny 0% off.. I forgave them but the do need to change this.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good corn bread
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I guess not

VDsDXU6yjdIhzIZ6fnOFbw.text: Food was excellent beyond my expectations! Because a lot of the food served here is also my cultural food I could say they had big shoes to fill and they did!!! Every plate was exquisite!! The atmosphere was wonderful for a family afternoon! We used a group on ( awesome!) waiter Kevin was fabulous, very resourceful and knowledgeable on the restaurants history! Great experience!   You may ask yourself then why not give 5 stars!! The only way to eat inside is by calling ahead of time for reservations! Something we didnt know. So we dined in the patio and although the weather was lovely the flies were very present!! It was difficult to enjoy such a lovely meal while fighting a brigade of flies!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime rib!!
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chile relleno

ILkfaKdM5LsO6Mj3pkKcmA.text: The food was so delicious - short rib Enchiladas with the Fuego Salad and Chipotle Cheddar Mashed Potatoes - I finished the entire meal even though it was nearly twice as much as I would typically eat at one time. Our server was friendly and accommodating and the musicians/singers - Jimmy Pines & Washboard Jere - were quite entertaining.  We loved the rather hideaway location and dining outside in the nearly fall weather here in Phoenix!

qfyYd09xz9FsqhKzzDnMQQ.text: So good, I already wanted to write this glowing review while still at the restaurant! Came to Phoenix for the first time and found this place off Travelzoo.   Atmosphere: It's tucked off a main road in a quaint little plaza strung w/ festive lights and has ample outdoor seating with heating lamps. There's live music (not sure if it's every day, but lucky it was going on at dinner time) and the musicians are so talented.  Food: The Travelzoo voucher is probably the best bang for your buck. I tried the blackberry sangria (highly recommend), and a little bit of everything -- I mean everything. Pernil, mashed potatoes, jalapeno biscuits, chorizo penne pasta, corn, salmon croquettes. Super flavorful! I don't think there was an item I disliked.  Service: Amazing! I think this is what really did it. The hostess is so bubbly and the waiter is genuinely nice (sorry I don't remember their names, but previous posts mention them as well so you know they're consistent).  Zero complaints for this place. Very glad I stumbled upon it!

0LBYu6lyBcKNpP7vL16k_g.text: Absolutely love this place!  We sat at the bar since there was an event going on and we didn't have reservations. The bartenders are awesome (STEVE!) The apple crown royal concoction Steve made me was good, as well as the Jamaican Mai Tai, but the guava mojito was so-so (not enough liquor lol) I ordered the seafood Chile Relleno with maple glazed carrots and jalapeno cream corn. All of it was delicious but I think the crust of the chile relleno was too thick and too much so I just ate the inside lol. The boyfriend got enchiladas with green beans and chipotle mash as the sides and it was all yummy!  A couple got engaged next to us which was cool.  Oh we also ordered the chocolate Torte which was decent.   We used out Living social deal ($10 for $30 can be used any day for dinner between the times of 5-9pm for a party of 2 or more buying 2 entrees, Groupon is $13 for $30 ) which helped with our hefty bill!  Our overall experience there was great!  P.S. The patio is beautiful and a bit romantic with the hanging lights all over

i5hMZWjLF876iiV0KLbgFg.text: We stopped by to try this place out after seeing lots of positive reviews here and it was a great place! I wish I would have taken more pictures, but we were trying to eat and get to the event on time. They have a great outdoor seating area and the inside is much smaller. I would highly recommend coming here when the weather is cooler out. The food is pricy, but the portion is huge. So you have to factor that in. We happened to stop in during restaurant week, and we barely got through the 1st course and we were full! Everything is good. The only thing that we were not a big fan on is the Salmon Croquette appetizer. Otherwise... Everything is very flavorful and full of spices! I am excited to come back! The Pernil Asado was my favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Desert!
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pernil Asado, Fuego Pasta w Chorzo &amp; Chicken;Crusted Tilapia;Chipotle Cheddar MashPotatoes;creamed Corn, Green Beans, &amp;Cornbread

8cU_TIEBbcSc4Ov5jIso0g.text: Back a 2nd time, no way it could be as good as the first, right? Omg was I wrong. Seafood relleno is off th charts. This IS the best restaurant anywhere in Phx metro.  If you've not been here and you're considering, go! Go! Go! Go! You will absolutely, 100%, guaranteeeeeeeddd, have the best food you've ever eaten.

8aXpeV-sidGNfPDPArzrBA.text: Great little restaurant.  The staff is super friendly, and their happy hour specials are pretty amazing.  I got thePanko crusted Tipalia which was a little dry, but my girlfriend's stuffed mahi mahi was delicious.  The Horchata bread pudding was really good too.  They have a nice patio where most of the customers sit, I will be bringing my dog with me next time.    It is a bit expensive, so be prepared to drop some money, but it's definitely worth checking out.

GGtYqnsvgIIYQzWfT-l_mg.text: Absolutely awesome!!! The ambience is great at night--cute patio with string lights and a pretty fountain, live guitar on Saturday night, as well. We had the empanadas which were awesome and also the pernil which was out of this world. Slow roasted pork, corn tortillas and the best cornbread ever! We can't wait to go back.

xLfxjbnRDtqhJwVSFeTz_Q.text: Just had my father's 70th birthday. They customed our meal to my parents' likings. We started with croquets and salad Which were delicious. Though the salad included walnuts...of which I'm not the biggest fan, the croquets were flakey and the meat was seasoned well. The main dishes included a Panko fried, thickly cut tilapia that was covered in a semi spicy pepper sauce, pernil asada that is HANDS DOWN the best pulled pork I could ask for, spiced mashed potatoes (against my diet but well worth the splurge), green beans and a pasta dish that I was too stuffed to try (and my carbs were already high). I tried a bite of the cheese cake which was awesome. The chocolate chip horchata bread was creative but not to my liking, but I also have an extremely high standard for anything sweet.   The service was superb! They were well trained and deserving of big tips. They didn't get in the way but were very pleasant at the same time.  Great left overs. I'm looking forward to lunch. The chef has really matured in quality over the past 5 years since my first review, and even then they were a 4 star restaurant in my book.   All 24 of us had a great time.

CSipFkPe8TH63shJqmGMBw.text: Service was delightful, very friendly staff. Food was out of this world, absolutely amazing dining experience! I wish we could have stayed for the music, just the mic check sounded great! I will be recommending this place to anyone and everyone!

Hz1hdBM_HPtovPAR0TDXUA.text: Ok first time here with a groupon. The deal was good for $ paid vs. $ you get . Thank god because the dishes were expensive, but we aren't yelping groupon.  Ok let's start the review  First we could find the place. They are located down an alley like street with no signs indicating their location. After circling and then making a phone call we see a wrought iron sign indicating their location down in a courtyard. Although we arrived shortly after 5 (beginning of dinner service) we were told if we didn't have a reservation we could only sit outside. Well since we had already drOve all the way across town over 20 miles I wasn't turning back now. So we opted to sit outside. It was shady but come on this is phoenix and it didn't take long Til I was dabbing my forehead with sweat.   We were given a menu and ice water. We had restrictions to our Voucher and had to order two dinner entrees which started at 21.00.  We started out with a beer and a reposado margarita. The margarita was small! They also used table salt instead of margarita salt. I had salt running down the cup everywhere.  Then we ordered two of the same dinner entrees. The panko crusted chicken breasts with two sides. I chose the cheddar mashed potatoes and sauteed green beans. My husband had glazed carrots instead of potatoes.  I felt like our food was Luke warm and my plate was chipped.  Our bill was almost $60 and I could have fed a family of 6 the same food at the same price.  They get rave reviews for their happy hour which may be "great" but our dinner certainly was subpar.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Are they serious? Hahahah great check in offer!

1gMIUcoj-QL5rRsL878uGA.text: Sooooo good full of options and great staff! The food is so delicious I will Have to come back again! Deff recommend it!!

LxdLmWrAGymEfbNUZPN-ZQ.text: Fantastic little place and yes it's off the beaten path a bit, but worth the adventure to find it.   We were looking for something new to try and bought a groupon for this place. The dishes are unique, very flavorful, and good portions. Service was very good, everyone was attentive, drinks were well made, and desert was aces.   It is a bit cramped and you feel like your into the next tables conversation, but I'm there to have fun and do business or divulge my deepest secrets at the table so who cares.   Worth the stop if your looking for something new and exciting.

5TqMFHKtMZUCg1uYYpB8SA.text: You know that guy you dated who is really cute and really smart, but he smells or he's bad in bed or he's got a personality quirk that you just can't accept?  That is this restaurant.  I've been here twice now.  Awesome atmosphere and the food is great.  I'm being generous about the food because I only ate half of my nachos.  They were too greasy because of all the pork, but I think if I ordered it without pork or only half, they would be good.     But the service sucks. Both times, it sucked.

eiPvUZITmh57tzwjBrw0BQ.text: Thought I would give it a second chance. Wrong! Owner was rude and so is staff. Had a groupon. They refused to honor it because we didn't order off right side of menu. Didn't know we had to. It would be no problem if we planned on going back. We would never go back. Very unfriendly and food isn't very good. So many better places to go to especially ones that care about your business. Stay away.

9DxSF5U4pAyf3rEVbE7cXQ.text: The food is more than enough. have to save half of it for lunch tomorrow. Nice environment with music and band:)

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

t2TxCLdd4AfSVu6Gh26E8g.text: I wish I had the same experience that other reviewers did. I just left dinner there for my first visit and it was terrible. I would blame it mostly on our terrible service from our waitress. We saw her a total of maybe four times (we had to ask other people for more drinks, water, and to bring us our food) in an hour and a half time period. After wAiting 45 minutes after we ordered, we finally asked someone else about our food since our waitress was no where to be found and they brought it to us right away but unfortunately it was cold so it's hard to leave a review on the True quality of the food. I would imagine it would be pretty good if brought to you right away. Spending $100 on dinner for 2 people I would just expect our server to actually bring us our food and more sangria when we are done within a reasonable time frame, especially on a slow night. The other servers were awesome though for picking up her lack of service. I won't be returning.

fmi7kk7q5Gbpfmg5YnMpBQ.text: 07/05/12 Had two Voice Daily Deals ($10 for $30) to use up before the 14th, so I asked my young cousin to meet me for dinner. I'd never eaten here before, but I know from the reviews that it's popular for happy hour. Indeed, the HH menu sounds fantastic, and so do the prices. However, these certificates were only good for dinner, and so here we were. But first, about the location-- it's tucked away a bit, away from the road, so don't blink, or you might miss it. There are many parking spaces, so that's not an issue unless you're there for HH. (If you are, then come early.) FB has a small patio area that looks promising, if only it was decorated a little better. I remember seeing two tables, but cousin remembers four. I don't think there are misters to help keep cool. Inside, it's even smaller. I would say about six tables of two- and four-tops, and about five to six seats at the beautiful blue-tiled bar. Sit here to maximize on atmosphere, have questions about the wines or cocktails, and if you want to be entertained by the staff. My cousin doesn't drink, so she had water, while I tried the guava mojito. yelp.com/biz_photos/HGvN... It tasted like a regular mojito, but a bit sweeter. It's alright- nothing fantastic. Maybe I'll try a regular one, without the added flavorings, during HH one of these days. After poring through the menu and asking our server Steve (who is also the bartender) about the dinner special (ribeye), I found I could only try ONE item, since everything else had allergens all over the entrees (shellfish, corn, guacamole, bell peppers, dijon reduction, etc.), instead of just added on top, and so I ordered the Natural Farm Chicken Breast, with tomatillo sauce, pico de gallo, goat cheese, and bacon. yelp.com/biz_photos/HGvN... My cousin ordered the ribeye special, with mushrooms and a dijon reduction. yelp.com/biz_photos/HGvN... Entrees come with your choice of two sides from the following choices: green chile cornbread casserole, jalapeno creamed corn, sauteed organic green beans, chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes, and maple-glazed carrots. Cousin chose the cornbread and creamed corn, and I asked for the green beans and mashed potatoes. Cousin LOVED everything on her plate! She especially liked the cornbread. I enjoyed my dish, as well. I liked how spicy it was, which may turn some people off, but I thought everything worked well together, especially the addition of the goat cheese, which helped to cut the spiciness. I say add more cheese! Loved the bacon bits, as well. The green beans were sauteed to perfection-- nice green color and crisp, and not greasy. We both thought the mashed potatoes were very tasty! It's a good thing I liked the dish, since it's the only one I can order, unless they offer something new as a special. We were too stuffed to order dessert, and it's a good thing, too, since out of the five choices (Ancho chocolate torte, Banana burrito, Kahlua creme brulee, Horchata bread pudding, and Homemade Key Lime pie), I could only have the brulee, and I wasn't feeling like creme brulee that evening. Prices were too high for me to consider dining here for dinner without a discount. Now, it's one thing if the menu is all-organic, but it isn't. Service was attentive and friendly, so that's a plus. Loved the intimate setting, but only if I can sit at the bar- we sat at a table. 07/12/12 Came back solo to use up the second certificate. This time I sat at the lovely blue-tiled bar, even though the seat wasn't too comfortable, especially after leaving a massage session... It was great fun speaking with bartender Steve and server Kevin. "T-Bone" was nice, too -- he always made sure to open the door for guests. Had the chicken breast again yelp.com/biz_photos/HGvN..., with a glass of sauvignon blanc, and the Kahlua creme brulee. The chicken is as good as I remembered it, but this time there was even less goat cheese! However, the creme brulee made up for it. The best part of the dessert were the caramel and chocolate sauces that accompanied it. yelp.com/biz_photos/HGvN... Mmm! I'd like to have these over ice cream, but not the Thrifty ice cream that accompanies many of the dessert plates offered here. (Sorry, but I cannot have products that use corn syrup. Besides, I'd rather have ice cream made from high-quality ingredients, and carrageenan and corn syrup, high fructose or otherwise, aren't.) Thanks for honoring the Voice Daily Deals, FB! I'll be back with family and friends for happy hour, maybe.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guava mojito, $9.
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kahlua creme brulee, close-up.
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kahlua creme brulee.

0PAfA-LR_dQZquEwMlsKiA.text: Tucked away from view, and the busy 7th Ave buzz, you almost miss it walking by, but once you walk into the area, past a few tables, you notice it has spectacular ambience, with a spacious patio, and relaxed live music. We loved it! We had some killer margaritas, and chips and salsa. The food is pricey, try to come for happy hour. Excellent date night spot!

9yO80341OGzREu9YVAoOvg.text: After reading some good reviews we decided to buy a groupon for this place while in town for a week.  Excited to have drinks and dinner we made our way over after shopping in Scottsdale.  At first since it was dark the streets seemed a bit sketchy but as soon as we walked in the place was magical.  There were lights strung across the courtyard and live music playing in the restaurant.  There was limited seating indoors but the weather was pleasant so we sat outside.  The service was a bit slow and the dim to no lighting made it hard to read the menu but once we were able to see what we were ordering I decided to have the Fuego Seafood Chile Relleno : a signature dish; scallop,shrimp, and Mahi Mahi stuffed in a jumbo Pasilla pepper with a panko crust and a lobster chile cream sauce.  The food made the extra star on the rating.  Amazing and fullfilling to the max! The Chile was full of flavor and the side dishes could have easily been a dish on their own! The corn bread puts any other corn bread to shame and the mashed potatoes were the perfect creamy and extra kick with cajun flavor.  I'm glad we had this groupon otherwise would never had made our way to this hidden gem.

WOSbo2PTp_1G1hI58Dh_sw.text: Awesome Happy Hour spot! Pretty much can't go wrong anything you order! Love the nachos, although if they got hey salsa to go with them that would make them even better. Also love the Veggie Tostadas and Empanadas! Blood orange mojito is awesome as well as the Chocolate Torte! Meals here are amazing too and bring you appetite! Beer selection not so good but awesome sangria, they add cinnamon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Hour Empanadas!
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Hour Veggie Tostadas! delicious!

tDt7XDKljeKbBqRXO7gtLQ.text: Was visiting from out of town. Love this place! The food was excellent. Everything was flavorful and beautifully plated. The staff was wonderful and we even got to meet the owner who is passionate about his business and cares about his customers. Definitely make this stop a priority if you are looking for a delicious Latin meal!!

vGR_uyPzZiE4FceX1DW5bA.text: I was underwhelmed by my Fuego experience. Terribly slow service. My Moscow Mule, when it finally arrived, was just ..ok. (was there really ginger beer in there?) The Tortilla Soup, when it finally arrived, was cold and uninspiring. And the Pernil Asado, while flavorful, was very salty. Seemed a bit pricey also.

zEK8WMI-3Hx9kE3XbJhEPg.text: I can easily give this place 5 stars. Service was wonderful, very friendly. Food was delicious, lunch portions were huge & reasonably priced. The cuisine is Latin so the flavors are a bit different than your typical Mexican/American resteraunt. The menu had an interesting and variety of delicious foods such as empanadas, Ancho dusted Wild Salmon croquettes and I had the smoked chicken poblano pepper which was amazing!  A bit difficult to find since there aren't any signs. It's tucked in between a dance studio & a hair salon. The patio is a big open courtyard shade by large trees and a nice ambiance from the bubbling fountain and music. They have live music ever weekend. Will be going back soon & want to check out their other locations.

QxnM163j5CQD_GN8RKyR8A.text: If u blink you'll miss this place.  Once you find it there is usually a wait  to get in. No tables left outside so we sat at the inside dinning area where the tables were crowed together, the noise level high, and the servers running back and forth to the kitchen made me dizzy. There were four of us and we each ordered an appetizer. Our server suggested we share appetizers since they were large portions. And sure enough they were. My three friends ordered the pulled pork entree. They all agreed , it wasn't as tasty as they were expecting. I ordered the vegetarian enchilada, also not as good as I was expecting. All our dishes' presentation were sloppy, as if  taken out if a freezer , microwaved, and then served.  I should of blinked.

dZAJRXn1Yu5pctycNAJmaQ.text: After reading previous posts I was expecting a lot more than we received. Service was not great, asked for another drink and they never returned with our drink before we received our check. The food was pretty good but expected a little more for the price

URYDiC-6p8kkHtzzCmeo-g.text: For what ever reason we had not visited Fuego Bistro until about a year ago. Now we have probably been 12 or more times, sometimes for full dinner with friends others just to sit at the bar and nibble appetizers.  If you're expecting white tablecloths or unusual architecture, you will be disappointed but the quirkiness of this place is its charm.  The menu is extensive and we have yet to try anything that was not to our liking. I would call the prices reasonable and in-line with restaurants we regularly eat at. The drink list is extensive and Steve, the bartender, very personable.  At their busiest, service has always been good to excellent. And now when we show up we are greeted like family. And then there's the live music.  Check out their menu and give them a try!

t3FGgg3q8v9z2be7L9-BOg.text: Expectations were high after everything that I had heard. Fuego Bistro did not disappoint. Jesus was our server and he was superb. The seafood chili relleno is amazing.

glW7MGnTc0mKOOnipuhydg.text: This was a favorite of mine years ago, in another relationship, and I must have forgotten about it after than relationship failed.  I remembered about it the other day and was glad I did. Lot of my old delicious favs still on the menu, lots of new stuff as well.  If you do nothing more, go and have a the empanadas and the pernil sliders..With a nice glass of their delicious sangria of course.  You'll leave smiling....I know I did.

-YEQqHwQj2ECGQbOkdlv6A.text: No joke, this restaurant is Arizonas best kept secret. Easily a top 5 restaurant in Phoenix for my wife and me. We've never once had a bad server and the food is HANDS DOWN some of the best in the valley. Live music sets the perfect atmosphere for this hole in the wall gem. Go here... seriously... you wont regret it! (Must order the cornbread appetizer)

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Electric Koolaid
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fuego Salad
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily Special Mahi Mahi

Jd-fhbOwzOwDkgmpe0vCrA.text: I looked up best Mexican restaurants in Phoenix and this place was listed number one, so I made the drive. Enjoyed the ambiance and band. Service was slow and seemed to cater more to the locals who frequent the restaurant.  Food options looked great. I finally decided to go with the seafood chile relleno. It was average at best.  Couldn't really taste the seafood.

lWSSisVgewr8JhafOYnt9w.text: We feel very blessed to live in, what we consider to be, the best part of The Valley when it comes to great food. Fuego Bistro isn't the newest and flashiest place in our neighborhood, but it's one of the best! The food is so savory and delicious and the atmosphere is relaxed and comfortable. My favorite is the pork medallions and my wife loves the seafood chile relleno. And you HAVE to get the cornbread and creamed corn! We've dined at Fuego 5 or 6 times now and we've never been disappointed. You feel like you're dining with family. Their staff is amazing! They have great line music every night. Tonight was our anniversary and we wanted to be somewhere where we could sit back and enjoy a little conversation with each other with a nice romantic backdrop. Fuego was the perfect choice. You guys are exceptional! Thanks for doing what you do for our neighborhood.

79IAGD4cOS5qv34wfM3eJA.text: Wow.  What a memorable dining experience; if I could give six stars, I would.  This gem is hidden from the street and you wouldn't know it was there if it weren't for the interwebs!  It can be a little disorienting finding a place to park and finding the restaurant for the first time, but once you are past that, who cares?  The charm of the place is the courtyard-patio dinning experience with live music and lights strung everywhere.  Wonderful character that I don't see often in PHX.  I appreciated that the hostess asked if we wanted to be seated closer or further from the live music; she cared about our preferences for noise.  It does get a little noisy with the live music and that it is full of patrons, but nothing that bothered me.  I enjoyed the live music and it added to my experience; it wasn't too loud.  My meal was excellent and looked very colorful to the eye.  The chicken dish was extremely tasty, and so were the sides (salad and black beans).  I couldn't believe how the black beans tasted, I had never tasted anything like it.  The entree was fairly spicy, but not too spicy.  I really wish I had room for dessert, so next time I will definitely order appropriately.  My dinner date left a yelp review to get a discount on our meal and there was no trouble at all from the server.  Also, I must add, our food came so fast that we were shocked.

71LJCN1GHbLNMUYnHQtaVw.text: I heard the summoning of my fellow yelpers confidence in past experiences of pure delight. Exotic pleasures upon my pallet were soon to come.   If you simply can't choose for yourself on which meal to dine; their savory beef, flavorful chicken or succulent pork are sure to inspire. I experienced the "Cola and Pineapple Soy Braised Angus Short Rib Roast", "Signature Pernil Asado", and "Pernil BBQ Quesadilla"; all cooked to inspire moments of bliss.   The Short Rib Roast; my favorite of the three, leaves no room for disappointed, and that's a personal guarantee ;)  April and May are the perfect months to enjoy their outdoor patio, tucked inside the conspicuos hidden courtyard at the corner of 7th street and Palo Verde.   As usual with many establishments I visit, snag a great deal by picking up a $25 off 2 entree's certificate from restaurant - com. With certificate in hand, you could walk out the door for close to $30 including tax and tip. During the hours of 3-6 pm (Tuesday - Saturday), try appetizer portions of most popular dishes for $5 - $7 each.  Happy dining my friends!

Y9zCGqm3XQ8gvtlNr5QhVQ.text: Awesome food.  Great portions. Pernod Asado is delicious. Cornbread is delicious. Green beans are delicious. Get the idea? It's all delicious!

oIHYGnr7OpAjQdTfs6KS6Q.text: By far one of our favorite restaurants in the valley!!! Food is always consistently yummy!!! Shrimp Appetizer and chicken pasta dish are phenomenal. Definitely have to try the corn bread and jalapeno creamed corn. I suggest sharing, you'll both leave stuffed!!!

XYWQZd12ZljJRpqh_oWBRg.text: Our daughter had given my husband a Living Social voucher for Fuego Bistro.  She used to take dance class in that building so we had all watched the restaurant evolve into the lively location it is now.  My husband made reservations for Valentine's Day as a surprise!  We got dressed up and went to the booming "Crown Plaza" area.  We selected a table indoors as it was 8 pm and getting cool.  We started with cocktails and I had the Ernest H. Mojito.  It was the closest to the cocktail described by Papa himself I have found!  I selected the pasta for an entree and the husband had the special paella.  We also got a side of the maple chili glazed carrots.  The food was delicious and the carrots are to DIE for.  Oh my...I could have just had the carrots and cocktail and been happy.  For dessert I sample the key lime pie and it was quite good.  The hubby had the Horchata bread pudding and it was huge!  It was a wonderful celebration!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The hubby&#39;s paella and my pasta.
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Key Lime Pie and Horchata Bread Pudding

kx2E8dyt10vh1fOx_dGm_Q.text: Oh my, my Latino sensors are tingling! The food is absolutely incredible here in this friendly neighborhood bistro full of flavor off 7th Street. They also feature a vast variety of local talent which is a great way to support everything "Local." So many delicious options you will easily get caught up in the web of "what should I order??" Try the Latin Feast for a superb smorgasbord of the best Fuego has to offer. And you're welcome!

EuXrAjiQyfgNIolm3BMsBA.text: Good paella.  Nice empenadas.  Good ambiance.  Live music.   A go to place    Good for dates.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great paella.   Try the Empanadas!

fshgWdhQynNcsOzT0wEz6Q.text: We called on a busy Saturday and we were able to make reservations. We got a table for two. There are tables inside and out. They had music tonight. Very lovely. The food was fantastic. We had Paella and pernil  with MaI Tai's. We will definately be back!

9H8_qk96pRnucM8vP1NZhQ.text: We had the mole enchiladas those had a great balance of heat, sweet and salt. Chicken tortilla soup was great! Cheddar mashed potatoes were excellent.

xbP9uuICxClajg5oluEs9Q.text: Their Salmon Croquettes are the best!  Every time I go I say I'm going to try something different, and I have had several other dishes, but I always have these with whatever else I order.  The atmosphere is nice for friends to gather and catch up too, not just for couples.  It's cozy enough that I have dined here alone and didn't feel like I was on display. Staff is friendly and attentive as well.  I can honestly say I have never had a bad or questionable experience here.  I'm looking forward to my next visit!

w1xqp6nIyf5ybVNlXeNFLA.text: This place is absolutely lovely. I love to sit outside. Right now it is a little hot to do that in Phoenix ,but God willing it will be cool again soon. The trick is to go as early as you can.  The setting is wonderful, it is if you are in someones backyard. A really nice Back yard.  The Service was outstanding. We had a lovely young lady, that was very attentive and knew the menu very well. She explained a lot about the ingredients to us. The drinks here are divine. I actually had one of the best Bloody Marys I have ever had here. We started with the Empanadas, they were delish! Our meals were fantastic! We came for lunch, but we were full for the day.  My daughter has been coming here for quite some time and that is how I discovered it. It is a hidden gem in the city!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wonderful bloody Mary&#39;s
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My meal was not only beautiful, it was delicious

ZQEYu5hL3JTmQJyDcW5Pwg.text: Every time we eat here the food and drinks are spectacular. It's a great spot for a date night and no matter what you try, you won't be disappointed. I love that there is a big selection of mixed drinks to choose from as well.

RBMAwPhjO1oL2yZ72VFBKg.text: The patio had a great ambience and we were greeted by the owner, Jeff, very nice guy. The food was very tasty and the portions were huge. Service was also top notch, friendly and speedy. We didn't care for the drinks we ordered but Jeff went above and beyond to make it right for us. Great customer service!

Ppc8dHR_eOMxW4-bxKVPhA.text: Had a Groupon...got ignored by that, patio misters should have been called sprinklers, Inside an auditorium...you can here everyone's conversation...hostess was very nice and helpful...I wasn't impressed with the food but my boyfriend said his was good...would have had more drinks if offered

dTGW11zoUbrRy659KJmHGw.text: As other reviews have said, this place is a hidden gem. Fuego Bistro is amazing! We (the boyfriend and I) come here so often, yet Fuego Bistro is always beckoning us back for more. If you like awesome food, friendly waitstaff, and a hip ambiance, FB is the place to be. The pernil asado, glazed, carrots, and tomatillo/cotija/bacon chicken are our favorites; and don't even get me started on the horchata bread pudding! The tables are candlelit, the patio has a fountain and string lights, and there is live music several times a week. Everything here is awesome. A bit on the pricey side, but definitely worth it. Try it, you will not be disappointed.

6CMldxxDrF62JRNMZYy-aA.text: Loved the tacos that I had. Great sauce and flavors.  The side rice and beans were nice. Really enjoyed it

8gAxVVtNFWqndzuI92J-tw.text: i got my food to go, and i have no complaints. bc it was to go, obviously it wasn't piping hot but thats ok, sacrifice of to go orders.  i got the chili relleno app, side of cornbread and cheddar mashed potato. one of the best chile rellenos ive had, corn bread was off the charts and mashed potato was delicious and filling, would def recommend. a little pricey but they do follow through with size

xvxWdNjyNq3uTc9-G7gDnw.text: My new favorite restaurant in Phoenix. I had the enchilada short ribs and they were amazing. I highly recommend the jalapeno cornbread and the cream corn for sides. The staff was amazing and quick. I can't wait to come back!

T4J2a9FBergYXJ2LyJgnNw.text: I love this place. It's a bit quirky  and not what y po u think the menu should be.  THE NACHOS are off the hook!! Guac was awesome. Pork was delish. Service was a hit too!! Try it out.. big patio for evening ...

Ly4DaQItlzD0I8kkzJ1yRA.text: The fried shrimp "martini" was great, sweet and spicy.  Loved the chicken tortilla soup (not pictured) which was among the best I have had.   The chicken chili relleno was good, not great.  Only major complaint was the nachos we not hot enough so much of cheese was not melted.  Guacamole was not a favorite of mine either.  Pleasant patio atmosphere, a little tight quarters but could be called "cozy".  We will certainly come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7izWBuMTjUG9p7f0CoSWSQ.text: Hands-down the best Mexican food I've ever eaten! Went with a group of friends and we all agreed we would remember this meal for a long time. It was Restaurant Week so we ordered the four course option with drinks. The next time I'm in Phoenix this will my first dinner!

adQb3BwM4ypQ4dHU0ru7uQ.text: I had the Fuego Chicken Breast and it was very moist, tender, and delicious. The chicken tasted fresh and the green tomatillo sauce, bacon, goat cheese, pico de gallo and tortilla strips complemented the chicken well. The tortilla chips were crispy and delicate, which I thoroughly enjoyed because they seemed homemade. For my first side, I had the cornbread, which was also moist and sweet. There were real corn kernels in the bread. My second side was the chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes. I thought this was also delicious and creamy. I would like to go to this restaurant again and perhaps try out their desserts.

KAiafmVUV-tEoLgpN1f0aA.text: This has constantly been one of our favorite restaurants in Phoenix. We have never had a less than perfect meal. The Fuego salad is to die for. This place is a real sleeper! The entertainment on the patio just adds to the total experience. The portions are very large and is always good for leftovers the next day. Thanks and keep up the good work! This place is special and well run.

guzphQZho0giCYlCF-PQnA.text: My fiance and I had been here once before about 3 months ago, stumbling upon it during happy hour. What a delight! Cheap drink and eats however don't think cheap as in quality. Low priced yes! However the small plates were absolutely delicious!!! Service was attentive and friendly. Relaxing atmosphere and the ambience was perfect. Such an unexpected yet great evening that we agreed to return for an actual dinner. Fast forward to tonight where we returned for dinner. Holy cow. Again, so pleasant from the moment we walked in. Hostess greeted us, asked if we wanted to sit inside or out. Now it was about 105 degrees at 7:15 however the misters, other folks sitting outside and the live music made us want to be out there too. Glad we did. Musicians took requests and were just awesome. However I'm a huge music fan so the fact that they were able to play George Benson and Al Jarreau did it for me. And live music on a Tuesday?? Score! Moving on to service. Excellent. I wish I remembered his name but our server was great in every way. Attentive and friendly. Was able to elaborate on dishes we had questions about. Entrees: my fiance had the tilapia with jalapeno creamed corn and chipotle mashed potatoes. Good lord!!!! That corn is probably one of the tastiest side dishes I've tried in a while, so flavorful! However I didn't detect any jalapeno or spice. Yet soooooo good and worth trying. I had the special of the night which was a chicken dish, the name evades me. Chicken stuffed with apricot and other delicious goodness. Paired with arroz and black beans. Oh my!!!! Such flawless flavor! I am not a fan of salt. I prefer flavor. Fuego comes through with the flavor, not the salt! Give this hidden gem a try. You'll be glad you did. Perfect for a romantic date night. It's such a casual place yet the food, staff/service, water fountains, umbrellas, misters and music turn it into a worth visiting! I'm an official fan and plan to return again and again

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Friday night patio

HPdEqVi6Eg24bcO62jdwUw.text: Pretty dismal indeed   The bar area was very uninviting albeit awkward. Don't bother sitting there  The servers were distracted the whole evening  The margaritas were bitter and I can't figure out what went wrong.  Even agave didn't sweeten them  The cornbread is dense and laden with fat or some oil   Personally I don't like food that greasy. Food should not be laced with fat.   I took my food for the enjoyment of wildlife   Back to la pinata

vs8KtUN7u9aPTOvDG9P9CQ.text: There are few dining experiences in which I could say were amazing, Fuego Bistro was definitely one of them.  The food blew me away, I mean really really blew me away.  It was freaking phenomenal hands down so yummy!!!!   I mean If I knew the world was ending tomorrow I think I would pick this place for my last meal then I would take nap and die happy man.    I ordered the filet mignon (medium)  It was cooked to perfection the meat was so deliciously tender melted in my mouth.  As a side order I included the Jalapeno Corn Bread and the Mash Potatoes,  It was by all means a new edgy spin on comfort food.    Location is small and intimate, family owned, cute patio, perfect for a date or couple of friends.  The staff was great, greeted with a genuine smile.  Our waitress, a blond gal with curly hair was awesome, attentive and made excellent suggestions.  Can't wait to come back for more!!!!!

SS7nWAQhhIo7Y1RawBhJGA.text: I was visiting Phoenix last week from Chicago and found before I traveled a coupon on restaurant.com so I bought it and I am so glad I did. Everything was fantastic and the service was impeccable. Everyone was nice and attentive, but that being said ,this has to rate as one of the BEST meals I have ever eaten. Its hard to find, but well worth trying. I eat out about 2-3 times a week and living in Chicago we are not hard pressed for a variety of places to eat, and I'm telling anyone that reads this, if your in the Phoenix area , you have to check this place out.

puekHuSKIbqY6hgfL2gdDQ.text: Consider this 3.5 stars.   So here's the deal.  The service is great, the atmosphere is nice inside and out and the food is good.  The prices?  Not so great for good food.  The sides were actually better than the main dish which is where they fall from 4 stars, especially considering that entrees are $20-25 bucks.  I had a chicken breast that was panko breaded, smothered in tomatillo & cream sauce, topped with bacon, goat cheese, pico de gallo (fresh onion, tomato, cilantro, etc) and crispy tortilla strips.  Frankly I don't think I ever tasted the chicken.  Or the bacon.  Or the goat cheese.  Those are the things I was looking forward to.  That's what sold me on the dish.  But they were lost in the tomatillo, the cream, the salsa, the tortilla strips...this dish tried to do too much and suffered for it. This chicken was a jack-of-all-trades, master of none.  The sides-cornbread casserole and spicy mashed potatoes-were very good.  The bottom line?  Good but not great and if I'm paying $21 for a chicken breast I should be wowed.

-CeGwbeClBEarcrTXOxMGQ.text: AMAZING!! I completely underestimated this place. The atmosphere is a perfect lil patio. Me and my date ordered the 2 specials they had which was the steak and Mahi Mahi. Both delicious! Not the best steak ever but let me tell you the sides made up for it! Green beans were by far the best any restaurant is going to serve. Chipotle mash was creamy and fluffy and not over powering on the chipotle. Cream corn was sweet and my fave of all was the corn bread casserole!!! Wow! You're not gonna find a better one anywhere! The service was quick and so friendly! Wasn't busy for a Friday either. Definitely coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and Mahi Mahi special

ZX3H-Rr65yqwBAXRmYC2Sw.text: Fantastic food, but a little pricey.  I grew up in the neighborhood, but after all these years I FINALLY sat down to dine at this place.  My family took me here for my birthday.  Would've sat outside, but a monsoon rolled through so we settled for interior accommodations with a view of the bar.  Being a newbie, I pretty much stuck to anything on the menu that said "signature" on them.  So started with their "signature" empanadas.  Wow, were those awesome.  Almost look like a meat turnover, but packed with flavors across the board.  Also went with their "signature" pulled pork.  Grabbed their cheddar chipotle mashed potatoes and green beans too.  The pulled pork was tender as can be.  The orange sauce that came with it was sweet, but had an almost ferocious spiciness to it that caught me be surprise.  The mashed potatoes were excellent and I used those to absord the meat juices leftover.  The green beans were good, but nothing special.  Washed it all down with a red sangria.  As mentioned earlier, the prices were on the steep side.  The empanada appetizer was $10 and the pulled pork was $25.  Including sangria, tax, and tip, it was about $60 for my whole meal.  I definitely left full and the service we got was excellent, but still pricey.  I know for a fact they participate in Restaurant Week and usually charge about $30 for a three course menu (including drink), so if you're looking to save a few bucks and take this place for a test drive, that would be a good time to try.  If money isn't an issue, you can't go wrong with this place.  Great Latin American flavors abound and the sides and appetizers are great too.  I'll definitely be back at some point down the road.

Q07sjQS4WHLaiYJHOkyXxw.text: This place is seriously tucked away.  You just have to know that it's there.  This place has a very rustic atmosphere and very cute patio under giant trees.  This would be a great place to spend an afternoon or evening.  The food, while not to my taste, seems to be a hit for everyone I have been there with, so it does score good points for that.  I just like my food a bit  more spicy and rich.  While I am not drawn back for the food, my companions are.  I am mostly drawn back for the small-town, quiet, woodsy feel of the place.

v7tn9RIEuR_wBecXSAmplA.text: Had the chili relleno for lunch. It was delicious. I want to go back to try the signature pork dish!

sATwROdF427Kq5A8YRBWPw.text: We had a Groupon for this place that we just couldn't seem to get around to using. I suppose it was because the place was nearly an hour from our house. Anyway, I really wanted to love it. But here's what happened:  Things I loved: When we couldn't get a reservation the last week of the Groupon the owner offered to extend the date so we could use it; They have a GORGEOUS patio - with live music; service was very good; portions were generous: amazing mashed potatoes and cornbread casserole.  Things I didn't: The prices - they are steep; the complexity of the food. Now this last requires elaboration. I was reminded of a TV show (this actually sounds harsher than it is) that Gordon Ramsey does. In one episode a very nice French restaurant was having trouble and he explained to them that their dishes were too complex and it hurt the flavor. He suggested they simplify, which I believe they did, and to good result. This was my experience. The dishes I loved were simple and absolutely delicious.  But our entrees were not and they suffered for it. For example, my ribeye had cajun seasoning, then it had a roasted vegetable medly on top, then it had melted blue cheese over the seasoned meat and vegis. Too many flavors. And not one wowed because they all got lost in each other. Same with Jim W's chicken. It had panko breading and tomatillo cream sauce. But it also had goat cheese, crumbled bacon, pico de gallo and tortilla pieces. It sounds delicious but when I tried it the flavors were muddled and confused.    I hate to say it, but I would have been happier elsewhere. I'm going with 3.5 stars. I'm going to keep an eye on their menu. Maybe I'll give them another try.

uI_Qj0ceypbW90LofpKOtA.text: My husband and I had lunch in the courtyard.  Delicious food and excellent service.  We would love to return for dinner, when the music will be playing!

C_TPXC6l3qQJ4uMbi-3H9Q.text: Went for dinner last night and it put a huge smile on my face. I really wanted the Cola and Pineapple Soy braised short rib roast, but the special was a Rib Eye steak ($28) which we paired with the Empanadas  ($10)and Salmon Croquettes  ($11) for a wonderful dinner for 2 and leftovers enough for a steak sandwich today for lunch. I could eat a bowl of mash potatoes here.....probably the best I've had and the green beans....crisp and flavorful.   Just fabulous! This is a quirky place that has been around a while and why I have not dined here is a mystery to me. But this is a must CenPho restaurant. Can't wait to dine on the patio.

ExnxdEfnIYk2mT4Is2QT8Q.text: Incredible drinks made  from scratch, great live music that is soft and appropriate for a dinner setting, lots of gluten free options, best tortilla soup ever, nice staff, pretty courtyard, need I say more! Go here!

jnwYFR3BUpdS4Tcu5g-fSg.text: I bought a living social deal for me and my bf to use and we made a reservation for us to go for dinner last night. We arrived a couple of minutes early but we were seated right away and the owner Jeff came over and said he would be taking care of us personally. The deal included 5 tastings and 2 drinks, and Jeff went above and beyond what we expected. He asked if there was anything we were allergic to or didn't like, and then he just started bringing out food:  First dish - Veggie tostadas. Seemingly pretty basic but very flavorful Second dish - Beef empanadas. Delicious! Third dish - Jumbo prawns. Also very good, I liked the avocado sauce Fourth dish - Fuego pasta. Winner!! Super good and flavorful. Just had my leftovers for lunch and still held up.  Fifth dish - The "finale", cola and pineapple short ribs, ahi tuna, chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes, cornbread casserole, jalapeno creamed corn. I am not a huge seafood person, but the ahi tuna was really good, a great "vehicle for flavor" as my boyfriend said. Everything else on the plate was great. Unfortunately we were stuffed from everything so we were at odds with ourselves trying to finish what was left.   Just as we were remarking about how excellent everything was, Jeff brought out dessert! omg...  Sixth dish - Horchata bread pudding, key lime pie, chocolate malted ice cream, and ancho chile chocolate torte. My bf loved the chocolate torte and I could not have gotten enough of the bread pudding and chocolate ice cream.   To drink, I had the caribbean volcano and sangria mix. The sangria mix makes me never want to go back to just red or white sangrias.   The experience was great and Jeff and his staff were wonderful. We sat in the courtyard which was heated and had live music which was a nice touch. It was pretty busy the entire time we were there, and it looks like Jeff knows how to run a successful restaurant. We will definitely return.

WmRvm1lJRWcxrNEofUYodw.text: The owner's response to Ashley just steered me away from here....The response to her was disrespectful and uncalled for

Hw9kK-UKC_0qXqdlGfuFPA.text: I don't really like meat. In fact, I eat meat so rarely that I'm practically a vegetarian. And on the rare occasion that I do go carnivorous, I tend to prefer chicken. Well, I am here to inform you that I tried Fuego's pork dish, their signature pernil asado, and it was so very delicious. I'm talking moist, tender, pork with some seriously heavenly flavor.   So yeah, Fuego has that going for them. They also have good service and a cute little patio. But this restaurant is in the weirdest location and I've never seen it busy. In fact, on all three of my visits, the place was practically empty. I also am not super interested in the majority of their menu options. They do have some tasty drinks, but their menu is lacking basic options for those of us that aren't quite up to par in the foodie world.   Anyway, if you're looking for something a little different with a delicious pork option, then this is your spot. Try a mojito and have some fun.

bTtWS-_jW7Pz7IhmEPVp6w.text: My husband and I went to Fuego Bistro last night for restaurant week and had a great dinner. It was 8:00pm reservations so the weather was perfect. We sat on the patio where there was live music playing! The restaurant week menu can't be beat. Appetizer, Entree, Dessert and Sangria all for $30.00 per person. The entree itself would have cost 30.00, so the restaurant week menu is a great deal.  We had the empanada for appetizers and they were very tasty. For an entree I had the Fuego pasta and my husband had the chili releno. We were both surprised at how large the portions were. 2 sides accompanied our meals and we both got the cornbread and I had mashed potatoes and he got the jalapeno corn.   Overall great food, great atmosphere and we will be going back very soon!

SIQemqaHLQIpIGKQbAq_Ew.text: I'm embarrassed to say that I'd never heard of Fuego Bistro until last night. Now I'm a fan and I can't WAIT to dig into leftovers and go back again! The empanada app was delicious and a perfect portion. There was risotto special with seafood (that isn't always on the menu).... If this is a special when you're there, do yourself a favor and order it. Put the menu down, don't think about it again and order the risotto. Wow. Amazing. The Seafood Chile Relleno was equally delicious. Go on an empty stomach though - the dinner portions are HUGE!! But like I said earlier, I'm already excited for leftovers (I only finished about 1/3 of my dinner)!!   The staff was so nice and so much fun to be around. Our server was very attentive and super funny. The drink selection was quite unique with many drinks I've never even heard of and a pretty good wine list.   Like I said... GO ON AN EMPTY STOMACH! Portions are huge and so delicious it's difficult to stop eating even when you're full! :)

gFwzWByUZD5AXr6Y7jpvpg.text: Amazing food! Unexpected, but wonderful flavors. Excellent service! Steak was legendary and chocolate torte divine.

ipVQSZb3ZxY7qX1G2BU_Vg.text: If I could give this place 50 stars, I would. My first visit I wanted something to go and ordered the Cubano sandwich. Now I lived in Tampa years ago so I know how a real Cuban sandwich should be. This was the absolute best one I have ever had. (My mouth is watering now). The rice and black beans that were with the sandwich.....well I almost didn't try them...how could beans and rice be anything but blah?   Well let me tell you, they were delicious and I ate them all.  Three weeks later I was back in the area again and I could hardly wait to get to Fuego Bistro. Ordered the empanadas and they were wonderful too. I mentioned to the server that next time I would try the pork because I love pork.  When I I started to leave she brought me a "to go" box. I had cleaned my plate so wasn't sure what it was. When I opened the box at home there was the most delicious pork I have ever had..I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!  I live in Scottsdale so I can't drop in every day BUT every three weeks I go to hair salon nearby. And I will always have lunch at Fuego. I'm going to work my way through menu. And one night soon I will be coming for dinner with hubby and friends.

LbORMWts_p_Lz5eDk3LN7A.text: BETWEEN FAIR AND GOOD.  We went here on a Friday night.  I had short ribs, which were a big pile off the bone and recommended by the server, huge portion, tasty, and in general pretty good (I shared with everone and they were a hit with young and old).    My wife had the tuna, which was at best average.  I'm terrible cooking fish, and I do better.  What shined were the side dishes.  I dislike cornbread normally, but the cornbread caserole was filling and outstanding.  The mashed potatoes with cheddar tasted several hours old, but still were good.  My wife tried the cornbread and like it, but also tried the carrots and said they were very, very plain and disappointing.  Children had standard fair chicken fingers and fries for $5.  Other option was buttered pasta.  Can't complain about the price, but it would be nice if they had something a little healthier or interesting for the kids, like a very small portion of the short-ribs, which my kids loved.   So here is the verdict... setting was pretty nice, especially in the enclosed patio, but food was just okay for an upscale restaurant, and in general overpriced.  For $20-30 entrees, I expect tastier better food.  However, quantities were nice.    Use your GPS, because it's easy to get lost finding this place.  Just when you are about to turn around because it's residential, look to your right and it's there.  Would I be back?  Perhaps.  I would like to try the happy hour (we just missed it) and try greater variety.  But I think there are definitely much better options in this price range in this portion of Phoenix (for example, Sierra Bonita Grill up the street comes to mind).

myTA26JM58eY7903HGSUmg.text: A few years ago, this place would have gotten a minimum of 4 stars from me. I'm not sure what's happened to the food/drinks recently but it has gone a bit downhill. Maybe it's all the new Fuegos they're opening up around town?  This also used to be my favorite place for mojitos, but no more. They've either changed their ingredients or the bartenders have forgotten their craft. It tastes even worse during happy hour.  Their food is still good, but its lost something recently. I wish I could describe the prior experience better, but its still a go-to place near the house. My main dish is always the short rib and I love their cornbread casserole and mashed potatoes. Happy hour is hit or miss at times on taste(both food and drinks). Service is always great and I've never had issues.

U0oVivAGav-AHBWhtUNA0A.text: My wife and I love this restaurant food is superb patio is great they always take good care of us best kept secret in town.

36YDuRcvlOgSilIU64Ai3g.text: We've been to Fuego Bistro a handful of times. The tasting menu is fun to share and a great way to try several items. We ask about it every time we go, but it's always the same items. I wish they would change it up. The cornbread and mashed potatoes are hands down our favorite side dishes. My wife  loves their pernil. I'm a fan of the vegetable enchiladas. Also, the jalapeno margarita is excellent and they make a great Moscow mule.

bUtNnQQ4js22V2H1Nppfeg.text: Great prices for lunch in a relaxed and inviting atmosphere. The food came out quickly and service was attentive!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sWjcn1E1IXNbv-SyQEsNHA.text: Like this place for happy hour! A wee bit on the small size, and a little hard to find, it's kind of like around the back. Drinks were . Didn't try the food, cannot speak on that.

bAw1Ma3IbEQm6ADzhOlWKw.text: It took me a couple of u-turns to get to this place and I parked in the wrong parking lot, but I made it! It's definitely tucked away.   The patio is inviting; tables have umbrellas, lights are strung around the patio and could provide intimate dining ambiance in the evening.  I was here early 4:30ish for "social hour" and there was only one other patron. It appeared regulars and groups started to trickle in after 5:30.   They have a pretty good "social hour" menu that enables you to get a sampling of food. I shared the Peasant Paella that had shrimp, chicken, fish , chorizo with traditional saffron rice. The paella was filling and had a good amount of protein. It's only $11 on the HH menu and enough for two. We also shared the Pernil Tacos (shredded pork).  I would order both again, but the favorite was the Peasant Paella.    The drinks here could fair better. I ordered the Guava Mojito... But there was not one bit of guava to be savored. It was a refreshing drink, but not much alcohol in this $7 HH drink. My second drink was the Seasonal Sangria which was served with Apple sections and blackberries.  The dessert was rather large! It consisted of two robust squares of "Horchata" bread pudding scoops of Chocolate Malted Crunch ice cream and topped with whipped cream. I did not taste the Horchata, but It was good. Not phenomenal, but good.   The bathroom can use some MrClean and elbow grease.   On the menu it acknowledged the time that each of the employees have worked at Fuego. It's nice to know that employees have been with them for several years. They also advertise on the website that there is entertainment during social hour. While we were there (Friday 4:30-6pm) we simply enjoyed the swoosh of the leaves on the trees as the nice breeze pushed through them.  Overall, the food was good, the service was quick and the environment enabled the enjoyment of the food and company.   This would be a fun place to bring a large group.  our tab was just a tad over $55 : Mai Tai , Blue Hawaiian, Guava Mojito, Seasonal Sangria, Peasant Paella, Pernil Tacos, and Horchata Bread Pudding.  All items were off of the HH menu.  I would go back for dinner and I would bring a few friends.

Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seasonal Sangria and Jamaican Mai Tai
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pernil Tacos- not skimpy on the shredded pork. Tasty.

UsjxxI_exVKTeQXqCYvCow.text: Love love love the food!  This is the second time I've been here and it's so delicious.  Empanadas. Enchiladas. Pernil asado. Must get the corn bread. It is to die for!

HfshgJnCA_RD6-fjwYcLXg.text: Fuego Bistro is hands down my favorite restaurant in Phoenix! We've been coming here for almost 10 years and have brought many family and friends over the years as well. Great service, wonderful food, and the live music is fun, too!

dXu-UbBcQa4cChbjnsiNXw.text: After our last visit we were really disappointed but we decided we'd give them one more shot & leave our final review of this restaurant in Missy's hands & so so glad we did. She was bar tending but was more then happy to take care of us, thank you Missy!! So glad we came back because our experience was again just as awesome & unbelievable as the first time!! We believe so much in the fact that a server can really make or break a business & keep the customer coming back for more. I'm not sure what Missy's position is at this establishment but she is the glue as we she that keeps it together!! With Missy we got hot fresh food, awesome cocktails & some great service!! We will definitely be back with one exception Missy has to be working & available to get a reservation with her!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes, yummy!!
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken tortilla soup closeup, so good &amp; fresh, just enough spice!!
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixed seafood grill, shrimp, tuna w/peppers &amp; onions served with chicken tortilla soup &amp; cornbread casserole = happy wife!!

Z6ECoMIUmkNyyLdvNTB5Pg.text: So we were in the area and heard about this place, plus we had a Groupon so we decided to check it out..  Talk about a hidden location! lol. I figured it would be on a main street or something, but nope. lol. It was down some alley way. The ambiance and environment of the restaurant was kind of weird for me. You have the option of sitting outside or inside. When we walked in I felt like I was in Ikea. lol. It looked like a home decked out in Ikea. Everything from the lamps to decoration to seating. haha  We ordered the Reposado margaritas since they were on happy hour. Hello Tequila! Oh my gosh, it was definitely worth the $5! The food was actually reallyyyy good. I ordered the Fuego Pasta which comes with a special creamy sauce, chicken, mushrooms, sausage and tortillas. I really liked the sauce. Some of the dishes comes with sides that you can choose from. My boyfriend got the creamed corn side and corn bread and they were both delicious! The creamed corn had a hint of jalapeno in it. There was a kick to it but it was amazing!   Each entree is a bit pricey.. we're talking about $20 a plate but I thought it was worth it because it was quite delicious. Other then their hidden location I loved their food. Plus I love me some Mexican/Latin food. =)

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fuego pasta
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Reposado margaritas!

rGb74jTBK0M6v6u2lyrlOw.text: There is so much to love about Fuego Bistro.   One of them is the ambiance. This is the perfect place to take your date to. The setting isn't anything overly fancy and/or cheesy, but somehow they manage to make anyone feel romantic. We had dinner outside, at a time when the weather in Arizona is at its best and had a wonderful and picturesque dinner while being serenaded by talented musicians. I love this place because it doesn't try to be trendy or try too hard period.   The food of course is great. We started off with their signature empanadas, and it is definitely something I would recommend. The ground beef with the onions, cheese and barbecue sauce mixed together is spectacular. We also had the salmon croquettes and they were delicious. For my entree, I ordered the seafood kabobs with rice and the cornbread casserole. The seafood kabobs were just okay. I thought the kabobs lacked flavor. It was topped off with pineapple and papaya, which I've never really liked to begin with so maybe this entree just wasn't for me. The cornbread casserole however was AMAZING. It's probably one of the best things I've ever had. I would eat that cornbread every day if I could. My boyfriend had the seafood chili relleno and he is completely obsessed with it. It came with the jalapeno cream corn which was good but definitely not as great as the cornbread casserole. Our server said that we should try the chipotle mashed potatoes because it's supposed to be amazing. Speaking of our server, service was great. Everyone was helpful and ensured that we had a great time.   I'm planning on coming back soon to try their happy hour menu which consists of items that are not included in their dinner menu such as paella.   Writing this review makes my mouth water. I cannot wait to go back to Fuego Bistro!

jMAtvdxmbQC49UnEcWntog.text: One of the best places in central Phoenix to eat. Great food, great ambiance and excellent service. My new favorite

cfeosoYHIQPkQPT3zveT9g.text: The food was very good, as was the service. We went with a Groupon and weren't treated any differently. We sat inside, but with the nice weather now sitting outside would be great.

bS0AWafp9g3kjbU5PE1ukA.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in the Valley! I had been waiting for their made from scratch nachos my entire life! The Chocolate Chili Torte is heaven on a plate. The wait staff is gracious and efficient. 5 stars! 6 Stars if it we're allowed!!!

LjW5VUDhN-Sp2HdTBAz4ug.text: Customer service was horrible. The waitress was rude after we asked if there were any other options on the menu and continued with her attitude the entire night. Also, we asked the host about the menu and he told us he didn't know and to "just ask the waitress" as he walked away form us.  Food and drinks were good though!

4APBt82HwmUgJpsLJgI1bA.text: I've been going to Fuego for five years and I've enjoyed their unique and flavorful dishes.  I've put up with the inconsistent service, from good to indifferent and inattentive.  I've learned to stay away from their cocktails (weak and overly fruity sangrias and syrupy sweet mojitos) and just order wine or beer.  I always look for something new and exciting on the menu but it just doesn't happen. On this visit I had the usual short rib dish (that and both the pork dishes are the only stand-outs for me).  I've watched the prices rise and have not seen the menu options or the service keep up.  I realized on this visit that I only go here because I like to support an establish local business and the food is fairly consistent.  At this price point however, I'm looking for something a bit more.

RMtMFnMdA5W5gj-AlzXqqg.text: Cute and quaint, with delicious food and excellent service! A few friends and I stumbled upon this restaurant and had such a wonderful time, we loved the tilapia relleno and fuego pasta in particular

800h14edRHyeYl70DJgvgA.text: Yelp has yet to failed me. Went on a trip to Phoenix and had to hit up as many food joints mentioned on trip advisor. Rated as number three and close to our hotel this was our first stop. And boy did every restaurant afterwards have tough competition.   Not only was their food amazing their outdoor seating has heating lamps. Allowing you to enjoy the great outdoors Arizona has to offer. Being from Chicago we only get three solid months to enjoy outdoor seating. Needless to say I try and pick outdoor seating options as much as possible when I travel.  My food was Delicious and fresh! Which is winning overall for me. The only complaint I had was service. Our waiter was a tad bit rude and rarely came to our table. But it didn't matter because there was busboy that was very accommodating.   So if you're in the area defiantly make your way here! Now enough with words.
