tG7ifCXanQVV-PUj-EKUsA.text: Can't say enough good things about Fuego. This is been a place I've been coming to for several years, and I always like the fact that the owner is active in the business. Either working the front desk or checking on gas, he seems to take a passionate interest in what happens at his restaurant. From the food to the drinks to the desert all our top shelf. There's often a special or some kind of limited offer on the menu which is always a win. I've probably been here for happy hour over a dozen times, for lunch half a dozen times and for dinner a few times other than that. You can't go wrong with Fuego, I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a unique concept.

UeaWrrp8Trwe4HiRUggo3g.text: A hidden gem near downtown Phoenix. Latin inspired food and drink in a funky back of parking lot location   Cocktails and sangria are interesting, intricate and made with love.   The food in complex and deep in flavor. Example --the cornbread is fresh made with whole corn and baked to a crunchy crust.  The empanada appetizer is nothing like the street food you may have experienced in the past and is made with a light crust and filled with a ton of meat, spices and a few veggies for accent.   4 people in our party and our dishes ranged from steak to seafood and everyone raves about the food.   They have inside and outside seating in a cute out of the way location.   Owners and staff have been together for many years and you can tell everyone has worked together for a long time and still enjoy working together.   Funky not fancy. It's awesome.   Go now.

VQYd5Px0HOoLz3nAiBZ2tA.text: My wife and I joined a foodie meetup here for our first visit. Before anything else, be sure to bring your appetite! The portions are very generous, from the tapas, to the entrees, and even the desserts.   I had the pernil asado with sides of maple chile glazed carrots and the green chile cornbread. The pork is very flavorful and juicy. The orange habanero mojo sauce adds tang and zip. There is enough pork for at least two dinners! The carrots are tender and tangy, with just a little heat and a little sweet. The cornbread is both crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, with loads of corn kernels, slices of chiles, and smokey bacon bits. Heavenly!  My wife had the vegetarian pasta. After eating her fill, there was enough for two more meals. It was filled with green beans, mushrooms, onions, bell peppers, and a chipotle cream sauce to add some heat and zing. She loved it.   We shared the ancho chile chocolate tort for dessert. The tort is a dense lode of chocolate goodness with just a touch of the ancho chile's heat and flavor. This is joined by a huge scoop of chocolate ice cream, crunchy malty bits, whipped cream, and a drizzle of chocolate sauce. As good as it is, we were not able to finish it, as it is as generous in size as the entrees.   This is a place we will keep on our list of favorite restaurants!

0ycxjtq3jNI8S1LjwT9U0g.text: Amazing menu, amazing food, love their Sangria too.  Very nice outdoor seating with heaters when it is chilly.  They have live music, usually a person with a guitar and a lot of talent.  I was there to early for the music last night but had the opportunity to enjoy the music in the past.    I love their seafood options which are all very good.  The other options look great too.  I always have great food here.   I love the ambience there too, very cozy, even outside.  Service has never been a problem, neither has parking, again, no valet, yay!  I need to come here more often!

Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood Child Rellano, really good with green and black beans.

AcBCb8iArFs8DjZyauwoBQ.text: 2018 YELP CHALLENGE: 68/100  3.5  More like PRICEY Mexican-inspired Latin fusion! Incredibly festive yet relaxing atmosphere. We luckily got a reservation on Mother's Day/Graduation weekend Saturday night (which is kind of odd). Again, expensive, but the portions are good and it was such a relaxing experience.  Quick Tips: -GROUPON. -Mostly OUTDOOR patio, but they do have a private dining room (great for groups, family outings, and date night!) -Bad cell reception.. but who's on their phone at dinner? ;) -Live music 7pm-9pm that changes nightly! A Mariachi band proceeded the Live Music (wish we came later!). Check their website for a Live Music schedule. -They share a tight parking lot with the Ballet Boutique, but there's street parking and another restaurant's lot next door.. -Only ONE bathroom for each gender. It's a wait on a busy night. -Skip the cornbread.   Taste  Tour of Fuego ($16.25) 3.5/5 A crispy empanada (4/5) with ground beef (supposed to be pernil?), a salmon croquette (4/5), a spicy veggie tostada (3/5), and a cubano slider (4/5). The MANGO SALSA on top of the empanada was delightful! Tostada was NOT spicy. It was meat, pico de gallo, and guac. The croquette was doused in a light butter sauce and the salmon resonated throughout! Cubano slider was good. This appetizer was hard to split among 5 people.  Fuego House Salad ($11.25) 4/5 Mixed greens, black beans, corn salsa, 1/2 an avocado, pico de gallo, candied walnut, tomato, and tortilla strips with an onion vinaigrette. I think it would have been better if the avocado was sliced in thin slices or cubed instead of two 1/4 pieces, but the cinnamon spiced walnut was really good. Not overly dressed. Simple, somewhat substantial salad. Expensive for no protein.  Coconut Shrimp Martini ($15.25) 3/5 About 6 huge battered prawns nestled with pickled red cabbage in a martini glass. Fun presentation! Well seasoned and sweet. Worth the price? ehhh.  Short Rib Enchiladas ($28) 4/5 I split this dish, and half was the perfect portion. Entrees get 2 sides, so I got the Cornbread (2/5) and Black Beans (3/5). Cornbread was like baked mac n cheese. Supposed to taste like green chile, but I didn't get a hint of it. Black beans were a little watery, but good. Not enough cilantro. Short Rib enchiladas were topped with very complex mole. LOVED IT. All entrees (except the Surf and Turf) come with a side of pickled cabbage, which gave a lot of contrast of texture to our dishes.  Surf and Turf ($30.50) 4.5/5 A huge piece of steak and a massive amount of penne and veggies. We had asked for the steak to be cooked Medium Rare and it came out PERFECTLY. The sauce, however, was just a creamy sauce (the green chile flavor was too subtle). Yes, this was worth it, even though it did NOT come with sides.  Pork Medallions ($26.50) 3.5/5 More like chorizo stuffed rolled pork, but it was delicious. About 5 slices of pork rolls (like sushi) were smothered in a heavy creamy sauce. Good, but again, the red chile was too subtle. We got green beans and black beans for the sides. Nothing special about the green beans (3/5) and the black beans were a little watery (3/5)  Key Lime Pie ($10.25) 3/5 WAY WAY too expensive for a slice of pie NOT a la mode. The good thing, the key lime is not subtle!! Maybe too much key lime. Coffee is necessary to cut the key lime. Ice cream would have brought balance to the force.  Price 3/5 The reason why we didn't LOVE it.   Service 3/5 He checked up on us only at the end. But he was sweet. Shout out to the wonderful busser who kept our waters full!  Come for the vibe and share plates (which are much more expensive than most tapas). I really recommend the Short Rib Enchiladas and Surf N Turf Pasta.

czXVegC2rpOXY4UOzhj6Ig.text: Loved it! My husband and I came here for a date night and it was definitely worth it. They were quick to seat us and to get food/drinks served. Everyone was also super friendly and attentive. I know we will be back for sure.

K0277JCEq4I29BOWupn1Mg.text: GREAT.... customer service...!!! Haven't seen customer like this in a long time!! Food was something like I have never tasted before...this is a place where you go with friends and family...

BVNuU0rQP9x-0taAnZVqwQ.text: Really good selection of happy hour items here but somehow still spent almost $50. Got the fuego  empanadas, chicken tacos, peasant paella, blanco margarita, and ancho chocolate torte. All tasted really good, I can't complain about any of the food I had and servers were friendly. Sat outdoors, but I should mention that I saw a tiny baby spider crawling on the wall next to our table and also flies hovering over our food the entire time so I was constantly trying to swat them away. Apparently they also have live bands (maybe just certain days) but we left before they started.

GWuFD-YohYRGwgE3BtY_KA.text: We've come here twice. Initially, I had just bought a restaurant.com certificate online since I had some spare credit there and we came during happy hour - they didn't let us use the certificate AND take advantage of the happy hour deal but the happy hour was so nice we didn't mind. Shared a couple cocktails, empanadas, paella, a quesadilla, a plate of nachos, and the berry empanada desert. It wasn't the cheapest dinner/happy hour, but every dish was well executed, not greasy at all, appropriately seasoned, and left you wanting more. The second meal is what earns this place five stars though - we came during restaurant week. Holy crap. Most places during restaurant week offer 3 courses for $33 but shrink the courses significantly to make up for the fact you aren't paying full price. Fuego? Four courses plus a glass of sangria, and if the entree wasn't full sized I can't imagine how large it normally is! Where do I even start? The sangria was tasty. All three of the appetizers (empanada, spicy veggie tostada, cubano slider) were well-seasoned and we could have had more of any of them - but quickly forgot about that as we ate the chicken tortilla soup. I had the pernil asado and my wife had the chile relleno - but both of us got the two included sides as well. I could have gladly filled up on just the cornbread, which was infused throughout with fresh corn. The jalapeno cream corn was well done as well as were the mashed potatoes. I barely had any room left for the desert! All in all, this is freshly made, tasty food and you'll pay for it - but it's a cute little place that's definitely worth a good date night. I still have yet to use that initial certificate so I'm planning on coming back for sure.

C6CHoF9RcYmlfINQhCCEuw.text: Went to lunch with a friend were the only two in the restaurant and they set us at a little teeny table, the tea tasted like water they only had one slice of lemon and no more in the restaurant, the server was one of the rudest people I have ever met in the restaurant business! I ordered nachos not realizing they had meat on them, I'm a vegetarian, I apologized and she was so mean and hateful about it my friend also apologize saying we did not know there was a meat on the nachos  she was so irritated she took the guacamole off the plate and slammed it down on the table, we complain to the owner he told us she was the nicest person and everybody loved her and that's just how she is, The owner was very rude to my friend she had a coupon from Groupon and they seem to have looked down on that, he said to my friend that you Already got your free meal we had to throw away and were nice enough to make you some more nachos, all they were with chips with some dried up cheese on them for $11.00 it's basically a little dive with overpriced mediocre food , it's a hole in the wall! And would never recommend this place! Never! OMG, now the owner has actually message my friend writing her horrible ugly things calling us fat when obviously he was the big fat person, he is rude judgmental he said horrible things about both of us called me stupid! He's a total jerk!

0BH7OWby9ZG9pjpSX04PTg.text: My parents' favorite place to eat in Phoenix.  Here is what they would say:  The Mojitos were outstanding and both of our dishes were amazing.  Can't wait to go back again on a date night.

Zd9f5Q6fgH70awmYXdqtaw.text: Went for Happy Hour with friends today. Everything was SO good!! The pork tacos, the empanadas, veggie quesa...would get them each again. The prices were awesome for the portion sizes. Our server was excellent!! Respectful and attentive and helpful. Will be back very soon, was my first time.

9naea2yttfpqXzo4VlvZjg.text: Wow! I can't say enough good things about this place. The location is perfect, the menu is great, the drinks are incredible and most importantly, the service is the best I've received anywhere.   Don't pass up the chance to visit. I'm there for happy hour at least three times a month!

BxO30v8tFUpOoRwODV1vXw.text: Came here for dinner tonight, what an amazing place. The waitress / bartender  was very courteous, service was excellent , food was perfect but save room for dessert because it's amazing. Will be back very soon. "!

rCxOZl7l9ysF_LKEtEYMug.text: Was impressed with the service and desire to make our group of 10 happy.  We had our own room and personal service. Food looked good, but lacked spice/flavor.  Not sure why, because it was full of all the stuff I like.  Peppers, cheese, spices.   Thought it might be just me, but most of the people in our group felt the same way.   Dessert was very good. If I go again (which I probably won't), I will ask for heat.   I guess I just expected heat based on the name of the place...

_SomrJtmWM5SVsYcRfg0fA.text: Amazing food, ultra cozy atmosphere, and a huge patio (a little too cold for the patio tonight). The owner operators are obviously passionate about great food and great cocktails.  I had the Scallops and she tried the Pork... both done to perfection. Try the creamed corn with jalapenos for a side!!!  The menu is simple yet diverse (steak, chicken, pork, shrimp, scallops and fish), and they also offer nightly specials if you burn through the menu too quickly. Highly recommended for a romantic dinner... I will be back to try lunch next time I'm in the area.  This gem is off a side street near 7th and Bethany, and in a courtyard off of that street... Good luck finding it :)   *Thanks goes to Groupon for helping me find this place...

83VNI0qoVAcayZhlfQCf2w.text: Entree portion sizes are generous. Cheddar mashed potatoes and the green beans were both delicious. I was disappointed in the waitress recommended braised short rib. Good flavor, but meat was a little dry and chewy. Not tender at all. Drinks and appetizers seem to be overpriced, but at happy hour are reasonable. The Reposado margarita tasted great, but didn't seem to have much alcohol and was served in a smaller glass with lots of ice. Empanadas as our appetizer were good, but not great. Lots of meat in a tasty sauce.  Plenty of options for happy hour and very cool that they let you combine happy hour prices with Groupon. My friend got the special, which was a chicken dish that I enjoyed more than my short rib. I love the concept of picking side dishes and portion sizes were great, but wish they had more healthy options. The green beans were just about it. The corn bread had actual chunks of corn in it, which I am not a big fan of. The service was very good. Ambiance is pretty solid too. Only drawback is the main dining area is slightly cramped. Would go again on another Groupon or special occasion otherwise just a bit too pricey regular dining. Overall, a nice experience.

e82C6ISI2anjyKCGtwzHuA.text: I recently went to Fuego to use my Groupon and enjoy some good eats.  This place is a little hidden but the menu is awesome.  When we got there we had to wait for the wait staff to find a table.  For a Thursday night the place didn't seem busy but the wait staff couldn't handle the crowd.  After several minutes getting soaked by the misters we finally got a table.  Several minutes later we received our waters and several minutes after that we finally got our Sangria.  The host/waiter seemed very flustered even though the place did not seem too busy.  For my meal I decided on the Organic Spinach Salad.  The salad was perfect for such a warm night.  The bacon citrus vinaigrette dressing and goat cheese were a perfect combination!!    I have heard so many wonderful things about Fuego but my experience was not the best.  The host/waiter kept apologizing which didn't help the situation.  The food was amazing and I will probably go back to give this local place another shot.

AYbxJyh3fCw2TzU7-os3kg.text: This is one of the best culinary finds in AZ. Wow amazing food, healthy portion sizes and great service. When these guys out for a casual dinner out and you won't be disappointed.

m4yynfSAuPMvKNW0A7mUbQ.text: I knew that Fuego was better than they performed that night  I was there for dinner.  I just had to go back, I went for lunch and service could not have been better.  Greeted with a smile immediately, waters on the table as we were seated, cocktails made perfectly - not everyone knows how to make a good mai tai or a mojito!    The chili relleno was outstanding, the hard exterior and the outstanding chicken and cheese inside was the perfect Friday lunch, the mai tai just topped it off.  Looking for a good dessert place, Fuego has what you need, the chocolate cake was phenomenal.  Sitting inside was new for me but it was way to hot mid day to sit outside, the interior is just as cute as the outside.  I know I will be back again!

ePqteOpvRizWjYJBOUaJfg.text: Me and a friend who lives in the area decided to try something a little different. Uninspired I decided to use my Yelp iphone app and Fuego Bistro seemed to have great reviews...for good reason.  The location isn't the most visible but at night when we went the patio/courtyard has it's charm and the food is definitely outstanding. I had the Fuego Pasta and loved it and my friend had the seared ahi tuna.  If not for the location being a bit far from me, I'd definitely make it  my neighborhood restaurant of choice.

ina28J0gVW6BDY6wTgQOWA.text: No place does a better job of transporting you from a nondescript commercial corner of central Phoenix to a quaint open air patio of San Juan better then Fuego.  It will utterly surprise you how comfortable that spot is.  It definitely eases you into a singular culinary experience. The menu is relatively small but that's not a problem.  Every dish is percolating with flavor.  The Cuban-southwestern fusion that they've got going on is enough to make Fidel wonder if he should foment a revolution out here....just so he could get closer to these dishes.  The pork dish is on par with the Barrio Cafe Cochinita Pibil in terms of bliss. But the nod goes to Fuego when you consider the incredible sides, namely the jalapeno creamed corn and mashed potatoes.  The tilapia is also an item worth the return visit.   A great restaurant, in my opinion, is a combination of several things namely food, service, and location.  The Fuego excels on all three counts.  Drop by and experience what it is like to escape Phoenix while still being in Phoenix.

lhwBX6ybJsKGDQISQ75gtw.text: We were gifted a Groupon for Fuego and had the pleasure of dining there on Friday night. We did not have a reservation, which would have helped us sit outside, but we were seated inside right away. The host was very pleasant and welcoming.   Much has already been praised about this little gem, and I agree with all of the accolades regarding the atmosphere, the service, the food...it was all wonderful.   We had the Fuego salad, which was huge and lovely (although I would have liked some diced onions on it; maybe I'll ask next time), the tortilla soup (husband raved about this), the Pulled Pork with cheddar chipotle mashed potatoes and maple-glazed carrots, and the panko-breaded chicken breast with creamed jalapeno corn and maple-glazed carrots.   In all it was delectable. The entrees were succulent and nicely plated. I particularly loved the creamed corn, which was perfectly spicy and helped clear by sinuses (I succumbed to a bad cold the next day, so maybe I need some more!).  The only thing I would not order again is the carrots. I didn't feel these added anything to our dinners. The maple taste was pretty subtle, to the point of being nonexistent. Also, I think that if you're going to put yourself out there as an upscale restaurant, go the extra mile and use real carrots instead of the bagged "baby carrots" that you can find so readily on cafeteria lines. It will look better.   Our waiter forgot to charge us for the soup. I pointed this out, and he comped us anyway. I will definitely continue to patronize an establishment that empowers its staff to make decisions like that without worrying that they're going to get a dock in pay.  We'll be back, probably first to try out the amazing-looking Happy Hour!

ZI2ATZ8QpLmBx4QQgRRsUw.text: Don't be deterred by the location, unusual outward appearance, limited parking, or dinner prices -- any of which could have steered me elsewhere. Thank goodness we tried it because now Fuego Bistro will rank among the few restaurants we make a point to patronize whenever we visit AZ! This is 95% due to the heavenly dish we both ordered: pernil asado, with jalapeno corn bread casserole and maple-glazed baby carrots. The cheapskate in me told my friend who suggested we eat here that, for $25, "the pork had better be moist and flavorful." When the waitress brought our plates packed with shredded pork and sizably-portioned sides, my first bite revealed the juiciest pork I've ever had and it was bursting with porky goodness! The carrots and cornbread were likewise delicious, and half of my meal sufficed as dinner while the other half was reheated and just as yummy for lunch the next day. I can't wait to go back!

d2eD8Bhp2OXvMrVV1ovr-A.text: They sure know how to cook pork here, the BBQ pork sliders and BBQ pork quesadillas are delicious. I would give it 5 stars but i don't like the food I ordered coming out on a community plate, it makes me feel inclined to share my food, and I hate hating food. Happy hour here is great. $3 beers baby

Oiitb616APlUVWzUyfdnMA.text: Over rated and pricey! Had to wait 15 minutes before a waitress even knew we were there! Ordered 2 of the short rib enchiladas with corn bread and their mashed  potatoes? Both dishes were cold!!!! Sent them back! The second set was better but smothered in too much sauce( I love sauce but!!!) The potatoes were gooey, the corn bread ok. Over priced!!!bWould not go back!!!

xftohQFjn03MVU-7GxUGFQ.text: Fuego is simply awesome -- one of those hidden gems in Phoenix for local foodies.  It was so good, I've now been twice in a week.  Happy hour is fantastic, with discounts on signature drinks and food. The service also doesn't disappoint.   No doubt one of the best latin places around town.

WpeMow-GyAjqbpa7sETNeA.text: First heard of this place when I saw the Groupon for it. Checked out the reviews on Yelp, so I decided to buy 3. Big mistake. Should have bought 10!  The mojitos are among the best I've ever had. Including the ones I had when I was actually in Havana. Heard the portions were big so we decided against an appetizer, but the empanadas looked delicious.  Ordered the pork and the Fuego Pasta. The sauce that came with the pork was great, but the plate could have come with a couple more tortillas.  Had the chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes and the green chile cornbread casserole. The potatoes were good, with just the right amount of spice, but the cornbread was amazing. Seriously, its one of the beat sides I've had in Phoenix.  I'm a big fan of the Big Rig at Oregano's and the Carlsbad Pasta at Carlsbad Tavern, but the Fuego Pasta might be the best pasta dish I've ever had.  Can't wait to go back during happy hour to try the sliders and pork quesadillas. I can see myself becoming a regular here.

Ur6t8hs0e8sj-WqjnTC9IA.text: Unique restaurant that is hidden in the courtyard among some dance studios. Great drinks and the happy hour is worth finding this place. Nice to sit in the court yard when the weather is nice.

cb5aoyGnZUIJ0dRS7wOsBw.text: Best Mexican food with an authentic twist. I love the food and the atmosphere, and the staff is great! Their pork is amazing, and I have no words to describe the corn bread.....

iuQyaGPBXtUBjLp5wtXzUg.text: Me and my wife went here on a Thursday night. One of the best dinning experiences we have had in awhile. We tried the empanadas. They were so delicious with the sweet salsa on top. For our main course we split the chicken with a side of mash potatoes and tortilla soup. The chicken was perfectly done and my wife loved the potatoes. Because it looked so delicious we asked our waiter for a side of corn bread for dessert. One of the best decisions. It made the perfect savory dessert ending to our evening. If you love ethnic/Latin cuisine and great service try fuego bistro!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Empanadas

YiQR_U68FPtSqNhNrjxazg.text: My husband and I really enjoyed our dinner here! It's a bit of an odd location but we found it ok. We started with vegetarian tostadas which were delicious. For my main entree I got the Chile relleno  which has seafood in it and is topped with a creamy lobster sauce. It was amazing. My husband and I agreed that mine was the better dinner of the two (he got the pernil asado). For a side dish I got the green chile cornbread casserole which is very tasty. I also got a small fuego salad which isn't small. It had a delicious dressing on it and was a very good salad. For a drink I got the pomegranate mojito which was ok. It had salt on the rim instead of sugar which I thought was odd. I also got a chocolate espresso drink which was very good. For dessert we got a banana burrito. It is a tortilla wrapped around a banana and chocolate and deep fried. It was served with chocolate malt ice cream, candied nuts and whipped creme. It was very delicious I highly recommend. The only downsides are that the atmosphere could use some improvement. We were outside and our table was dirty. Things appear kind of run down. Also the wait staff isn't dressed very professionally although we received good service. I think it's a little high priced considering those things, but the food is top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate espresso drink.
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fuego salad
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chile relleno and green Chile cornbread casserole.

lSoHGvonQ9113elvT0Rxhg.text: 1. Food: It's good and all of the main entrees I have had have been excellent.   The cuban sandwich served at lunch is pretty good as well. I have been looking for a decent Cubano in Phoenix and have tried a handful of places. This is the best in town that I have found thus far, but the search continues for one as amazing as what I had on a trip to Puerto Rico a few years back.  2. Cost: The prices are a bit high for this part of town. You get what you pay for though.   3. Service: The servers I have had are a mixed bag. One of them was really great and the other was pretty inattentive. She spent most the time conversing with a friend of hers rather than tending to the customers. I overheard a couple at another table complaining about it as well.  4. Atmosphere: Clean. There is only a small indoor section and most of the tables are outside in the courtyard. Keep this in mind on those blisteringly hot Phoenix days.   I gave 4 stars instead of 5 simply due to the waitress being so absent. 4 stars is a good rating and I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants Latin food. I have every intention of coming here again and again as long the food remains so excellent. The owner of this restaurant clearly takes pride in their work and you should try this place out without any hesitation. If you are particularly sensitive to having a good wait staff then you should go elsewhere as it is very unreliable in that department.

t3s5-hf41E3xl3HUl8H-oA.text: So I was excited to try this place on a Saturday night.  Very disappointed they stop seating at 8:45pm, unheard of for me. We ate quite a bit earlier in the day and I initially thought of getting there a bit later, ordering later. So our reservation was for 8:30pm, the place is definately hidden. Most tables are outside, three small tables and a very small bar is all that's inside. I thought we could hang out a bit, enjoy the ambience, have a couple drinks and either share a plate or have an appetizer. That would have been lovely.  But, we were seated outside and it was a little cold. I was really looking forward to the live music I had read out. They had a 2 person hillbilly band playing a banjo and washboard, not what I had in mind. We were there, so kinda felt obligated to stay. We ordered the appetizer platter ($16) and the short rib enchiladas (about $27).  The service was attentive. The food was good but overpriced. I didn't enjoy it and wish I'd tried somewhere else for our Saturday night visiting Phoenix.

SdsNWXEyW-9x5ubcqDUHAg.text: Outstanding food. Lovely patio. Great service. Dog friendly. Get the chili Relleno for lunch with chicken, or with seafood at dinner. Unbelievable. You will not be sorry. It's a bit hidden and off the beaten path, but definitely worth it.

aTa7-JBmE4GQtTHShaztgg.text: Patio is very quaint and servers were attentive. My husband had the seafood chile relleno and I had the blackened ahi tuna special. Everything was delicious and come hungry as the portions are large and relleno sauce was extremely rich. Jazz band was odd - would have preferred Latin music given the fare. I would not give it 5 stars because the patio needs work (aesthetic) and we sat near the back building which had a separate music/jam session going.

iya2lv6Jl_4XQtaZhVMUMQ.text: Glad I used Yelp and found this tucked away treat. Open air seating and live music at the right volume for dining. We dined on enchiladas and the pulled pork dish. The green chili cornbread was a super side item. Take your time and enjoy. Our food came out in less than seven minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fuego Bistro setting
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fuego Bistro

_2dT4b1pww08OfBRZufHkg.text: We went to Fuego using a Groupon. We ordered the chicken and cornbread dish, the spicy veggie quesadilla, and the sample platter. The food came out luke warm and every single dish was extremely salty. They have a cute patio and the live music was nice otherwise this restaurant would get 1 star at best. Our bill came out to $45 which I found absurd considering the quality. I so wanted to like this place but will not be returning.

kqDJqYxh6ffuKqxeZXrK8g.text: My girlfriend and I went to this little quaint place about 3 days ago. The atmosphere was amazing and the service was really good. Our waitress Missy was outstanding. This was our first time here since we have just moved from Chicago. I cannot wait to return for some live music as well. Thanks, Missy and see u soon.

X5l3_kWKcAU1e0BYtvFCUg.text: First time to Fuego, I enjoyed most everything, very flavorful, my wife is very picky but still managed to find the Paella and enjoyed it.  Her only complaint was that it was made with chicken breast and not thigh meat and the breast was a little dry. My only disappointment was that the horchata bread pudding was dry and cold and instead of a delicious warm tres-leche or horchata type sauce, it came with chocolate ice cream?! very disappointing,  wife had the chocolate cake, it was good but had the same not very flavorful ice cream.   In conclusion, overall the meal was very good, I would recommend this place for very flavorful Latin food, but hold on the desserts!

t4Ml4Lo_l1WiTbLAE5wwZw.text: Too spendy at 20-30$ entrees but the food was really good, next time I'll try the smaller plates they seemed to have just as much food as entrees.

7tjY41s2V0Sr2NwrgyQhMg.text: Made my second visit to Fuego last night. Went with very high expectations after the great evening we had last time. The food is still amazing. Had the house special pasta dish the cornbread appetizer which is a meal unto itself and the New York strip which was the evening special. All of the food was terrific!!  Really look forward to our next visit for the food and cocktails, BUT, the young lady who was our wait person was incredibly slow and in-attentive. Something I don't appreciate when paying for a fine meal. Here is hoping management can fix this issue. I would also suggest selecting a musician who does not have a tin ear for the entertainment. We do look forward to visiting again!

fX1gGbwatdOMhVx_Ash6Kw.text: Waitress not friendly or helpful. Only good, and I do mean good food was empanadas. Order those, they redeem all the rest of the staff and food.

SPBptp5o3y63xpxfIdMTFA.text: Great food and my favorite part was the Tortilla Soup!

IG44Ya2GJTxhNkQGyP1y9A.text: Thank you Fuego for continuing to serve outstanding food! I came for dinner on Saturday and had the short rib and I ate myself in to a coma.   The food is fantastic, the service is stellar and the patio is bustling and cozy now that the weather is cooling down.   I continue to recommend this place to friends and family and I am always glad I did.

UVj7eB7gGc7fZYaj3B-L_g.text: Wow!!! Visiting from out of town, my friend that lives down here found this amazing restaurant online and we decided to check it out, so glad we did!   We arrived just after 4 PM on a Saturday, the back patio was still getting set up, but totally ready for us. Our waitress was very helpful, friendly, and patient. We started with drinks, and social hour appetizers. The cubano sliders, and nachos were simply mouth watering. The mojiti was so fresh and light, I could have sipped them all night!  Then we worked our way on to the dinner menu. Even the sides looked as fantastic as the main courses! All 4 of us ordered different items (chicken, pork tenderloins, short rib enchiladas, and pernilas) and plenty of sides. Everything was above and beyond our expectation!   The musicians were getting set up as we were eating, I only wish we didn't have plans after dinner, or we'd have stayed to hear them. They sounded so whimsical, funky, fun, and eclectic!  The ambiance was magical, and truly tied everything together. I can't wait to return, and will certainly recommend to everyone in this area!

Z6PYZcvk714Gkm6nCbDZ4A.text: My boyfriend and I shared a three course sampler meal here which was a great way to try a bunch of different items. My favorites included the pernil asado (pork), cheddar mashed potatoes, sliders and empanada. I had a coconut mojito which was just okay. The ambiance is great- mostly outdoor seating with live music.

unk8waFEQInIE0nUrN8OmQ.text: Amazing meal, considerate service and a great setting. The menu selection was great and all 4 people in our party loved their meals. I will be back!

QU-N_sOODIKPFR2ZTAzjJg.text: There's really nothing I can say that hasn't already been said except that this is going on my "Pissed at myself for not trying sooner" list. Hats off to Lisa E. for making me get my ass in here.  I knew where these guys were located but I had no idea how charming their set-up is with courtyard dining, the main dining room and bar, and the secondary room where we had dinner.   I was able to try the empanadas which were delicious while sipping on my first pomegranate mojito which was dangerously refreshing and delicious. Might have to "go home sick" from work some day around Happy Hour!  For my main I had their out-of-this world, mindblowingly awesome special which was seafood risotto: clams, mussels. calamari and shrimp cooked in butter with garlic and herbs, served up with soft, fluffy risotto and tomatoes. Too good for the common man.   It was SO good but there was so much of it that I couldn't finish it, which was nothing short of a tragedy. Our awesome server, Kevin promised to email me if they ever offer it again-apparently it is a rare item. I REALLY hope that they serve it again so because I will be there with bells on!!!! SO good......truly one of the best meals I've had in a while.  I got to try to sample Lisa's chocolate cake which had a chili sauce on it which had just a tad of a kick.....nice balance of sweet and savoury.  Anyway, from all the reviews I am not telling anyone anything they don't already know but I am very glad that I finally made it here. There service was so warm and hospitable that it really added immensely to the whole experience.  This is another one of those hidden gems that make me glad I live in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. SOOOOOOO F*cking GOOD!!!!

Q78Ki-0jCV6PXdNPvSXyfQ.text: Wow, wow, wow.  We chose this spot as our most recent date night location and we were not disappointed.  The patio is super eclectic and the vibe is relaxed.  We really were looking to unwind after busy family time and this did the trick.  We started with drinks and the house made sangria hit the spot-strong, sweet and refreshing.  My favorite summertime splurge!    The entrees were outrageously delicious-Pernil and Short Rib Enchiladas.  Both delicious, I favored the enchiladas-I love mole!  Paired with the pico-what an amazing combo of flavors.  My favorite thing might be the sides though.  They all sounded way too good to pass up-and they were, with the star being the cornbread.  Some of the best cornbread I've ever tasted!    Whatever you do, do not come here expecting to receive standard Mexican fare (even though tacos, enchiladas and chile rellenos are on the menu).  It's elevated Latin American cuisine with prices to match.  But the explosion of flavors and fun atmosphere will have me returning.  We were delighted to find this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. If you need me I&#39;ll be here with this sangria
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Relaxation at its finest
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short Rib Enchiladas

JYn7MmOLDY-oHTPAQoPNjw.text: Best random find ever during our trip. We sat in the beautiful patio and it just so happened they have live music and restaurant week was going too (!!!?!!). For $33 per person, we shared a sample of appetizers, had each our own pick or salads and soup, entree, dessert and glass of sangria (score!) or they can make virgin cocktail too. I got the very tasty virgin mojito.   Overall everything was actually quite delicious and well executed. We tried the following: - beef empanada  topped with some amazingly refreshing pico de Gallo or salsa.  - veggie tostada - fresh flavors - a Cuban inspired pork slider- hearty and meaty - the Fuego salad was great. It had some candied nuts too  - the chicken tortilla soup was actually light broth and very delicious. Not heavy or creamy kind but still surprisingly good - the place is known for the pernil (shredded pork) which is a must. It held up to expectations. It came with a sweet sauce to drizzle but I didn't think it needed it.  - the Ropa vieja- tasty enough but I didn't care of it as much as the pernil.  - each entree came with choice of 2 sides so we tried 4. In order of preference: corn bread, chipotle cheese mashed potatoes, jalapeno creamed corn, green beans and almonds. They were all good actually  - the berry empanada with pina colada ice cream was a recent favorite - I wasn't a huge fan cuz the taste reminded me of a pop tart - the bread pudding was not served warm but it was served with a chocolate ice cream that had crispy malt balls.   The waiter was awesome and helpful in giving advise. Great service and food for sure. My only regret is not having a bigger stomach as it was a lot of food and would have liked to try the other small plates from the regular menu.

b_5B_40VSRdegE_LSoQuCQ.text: Fuego Bistro is one of those places where, I think if you know exactly what to order, you'll be very happy with the end result.   Fuego has been on my list for years and for whatever reason, we just never got around to dining here until recently. I largely blame this mostly on my mixed opinion on Latin American cuisine. Not that this place is strictly Latin American, as they seem to kind of do their own thing in many ways.  Playing it safe (probably too safe) with their chips and guac isn't probably your best choice. For 10.50, a bit of guac, salsa, and pico isn't really worth the price, in my opinion.  Now, entrees are a different story. I ordered the pernil asado, which you can pack into some tortillas. The meat boasted some excellent flavor and quality. Additionally, the sides I chose of chipotle cheese mashed potatoes and cornbread were both very unique in comparison to most places. The cornbread here is sweet and chunky. Too chunky for my liking, but still quite satisfying nonetheless.  My girlfriend ordered the empanadas from the small plate section. She thought they were just okay, feeling they would have worked better with my pernil asado as opposed to the somewhat lame ground beef that they use.  Desserts here are a bit odd in the sense the chef/creator seems to really, really like chocolate malted crunch ice cream from Thrifty. I mean, to the point where four of the six offered desserts use it. Not that there's anything wrong with some malted crunch, of course. We opted for the horchata bread pudding, which included scoops of said malted crunch. Not too bad for the asking price.  On a side note, the majority of the restaurant's patrons seem to prefer sitting on their giant patio, which often has me wondering how they handle summer crowds.   Overall, I find Fuego somewhat difficult to rate. The food itself was all executed just fine - to the point where I feel if we returned and experimented with other menu items, there's probably some really great stuff here. But for a first time visit, I'd call it fun, but kind of forgettable.  Recommended to check out.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horchata Bread Pudding
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Empanadas
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arroz

IWQjuv79251x7COz1woLRg.text: Went there with a bud as the two of us celebrated our birthdays.  I had the short rib enchiladas with cornbread and mashed potato sides.  He had the coconut martini shrimp. I'd order two of these and make it my dinner next time. And since it was our birthdays, for dessert we had the chocolate brownie with ice cream.   All were yummy.     The cornbread and mashed potatoes are the best.   So creamy and thick.   I liked the short ribs that were on the menu prior.   I guess they don't have that anymore and have nor pared the meat down and are using it in the enchiladas.   I'm a meat kinda gal when I'm in the mood for meat so I've always liked it.   Disappointed they no longer have it.  I loved the shrimp.   Definitely I would order it as a meal versus an appetizer.  Sarah Chapman was our entertainment for the evening as Skye Lucking painted while Sarah sang.  Jeff, the owner, always so friendly stopped to say hi.   Missy was our server, and Morgan was our server/busser.  I always love coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. coconut martini shrimp
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. yummmy dessert!
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Skye

QpCG36U8unp4sROKI6qIfQ.text: What a tasty little place. Nice portion size for the price. The food is flavorful particularly the pernil asado. The seafood kabobs fish was a little dry and could have used more salsa. The arroz con gandules was a mushy. The chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes were good. The green Chile cornbread could have used more bacon and Chile cut was flavorful. The live band plays folk music and I was expecting Latin music. I would return

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood Kabobs Plate 27.50
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perm il Asado Plate 26.00

_Jg39_SdmzX0Rx2Ftb4wUQ.text: Got a groupon for 4 for dinner entrees. Well they are strict about that rule, must get 4 dinners, appetizers, light options & kids do not include.   The meals are pretty huge. There is happy hour. We got the Fuego nachos, they were really good. There is a kids meal section that includes a drink & dessert (ice cream.) the chicken tenders were really good. The ice cream tasted low fat and frozen in some parts, not that great. I got the steak of the day 12oz steak comes with 2 sides. I choose cheddar mash potatoes, super delicious & I got carrots, they were sweet. My brother got the Fuego bowl which tasted like chipotle. My other brother got Fuego chicken breast with corn bread and cheddar mash potatoes. The corn bread was good.   They have live music playing after 6 or so. Really small inside but there is an outdoor area with heaters outside.   Also it's hidden, it's behind the dance studio.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

sMXM9lD4F9gPAJFovnrcKA.text: Bought a groupon deal for this place and didn't have any expectations for a scrumptious meal. Lucky for me, I don't have any problems with accepting when I'm undeniably wrong, and ended up having one of the most memorable meal EVER!!  We started with drinks. My kilauea volcano not only looked dashing(see its hotness in my photo-no photoshopping required), but it also had substance! Mmmmm!!! I had a taste of the tortilla soup as well. Let's just say, if my sister wasn't the one who ordered it and was enjoying its hearty flavor, a cat fight would've ensued between us over that oh so heavenly tasting tortilla soup!!  My main squeeze was the 12oz prime new york steak special with almond green beans and cream corn. One word...WOWZA!!! Steak was cooked just right to my liking and succulent in flavor. I will say that I wasn't a fan of the cheese topping on the steak after trying it, but a few scrapings of the cheese off of my steak and voila---back in steak heaven!! :)   We went on a cold Thursday night, but they had warm heaters (maybe a little too warm!) out on their patio. Service was good & a lovely musician serenaded us throughout our entire meal. Overall, it was a pretty spectacular night at fuego bistro!! We were too stuffed to try their dessert, but will definitely be back to get our fill!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dinner: 12oz prime New York steak with almond green beans and cream corn. Yum! Drink: kilauea volcano (lava &amp; magma never tasted so good!!)

ZEqHO7Y_0vK32WLT0kbq8w.text: As this is our favorite local restaurant I thought it time to sing its praises. We are pretty boring as my husband usually orders a meat entree and I always order the seafood chile relleno. However my friends have ordered a variety of items and are never disappointed. The corn bread is SECOND TO NONE. The chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes are also wonderful.  The drink menu is fun and creative and I always try something new.  Love the Peggy Sue and the sangrias. Most important is the way the staff makes you feel when you go there which is so welcoming and friendly. They deserve lots of credit as the staff has remained the same for a long time.  They truly love working there and it shows. We love it because the food is fresh and excellent, the staff is delightful, it is quiet and relaxed. It is guaranteed a wonderful evening for either a date night or a night out with good friends.

07oE3g8Q037BYepjyKoH4w.text: Dinner on the patio in September in Phoenix.... absolutely fabulous! Eclectic, yet comfortable patio furniture with perfect lighting and mood. Tried the Fuego Tour to have an opportunity to sample a few of the menu items that sounded amazing. The Cuban slider was to die for, the salmon cake was tender and light, the empanada was seasoned nicely and although the veggie tostada was super  spicy, it had wonderful flavor. The service was great and the live music made this hidden Bistro a wonderful find. Will definitely return!

VFf9O0TWtWDwxcV8UlgXWg.text: Can't believe I've lived in Central PHX for 5 years and have not gone here.  Omg.... a hidden Gem!!  We entered through a cute little courtyard full of trees and tables. Greeted warmly and told to take any seat.  Menu for lunch was perfect.  We started with homemade sangria. Our service was also the bartender. She was exceptional!  We ordered The Tour De Fuego. Consisting of Cubano slider, Vegetarian tostada, beef empanada. Rice and beans.  Also we got Pernil with tortillas and rice and beans.... the pork is slow roasted for days.  I can't wait to go back.  Do yourself a favor and go. Don't walk... run!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade sangria
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Slow roasted pernil

ZiiVkvV0crnb3HdNOtAIAg.text: As usual, another delicious night at Fuego Bistro. The Latin Feast is just a kaleidoscope of flavors sure to please your palette and fill your belly.   Jesus is a great staff member.

9rF_svp2EPnVi0HkmjNXNg.text: Fuego is a typical Spanish/Latin inspired hipster restaurant and the price tag to go with it. There is indoor seating and outdoor seating with nice mist machines, which helps combat the smothering heat. The restaurant is bit tucked away, it's next to a hair shop and a blue/gray wall. We came around 11:30AM on a Friday, which happens to be their "Social Hour" = Happy Hour. It wasn't busy at all, we were the only patrons for at least 30 minutes. Perhaps it's more of an evening or night restaurant. We ordered the: 1. Pernil Asado: Signature pork roast severed with sugar cured cabbage orange habanero mojo, and tortillas (13) -- It was a generous portion size that is enough to share if two people are only moderately hungry 2. Peasant Paella: Shrimp, chicken, chorizo, tilapia in a savory Puerto Rican rice (13) -- The dish had a nice variety but as for texture and flavor, it did not live up to my expectation. I found the rice to be a bit soggy and lacking rich flavors 3. Blue Hawaiian Margarita (10.50): It was cute and topped with a couple pieces of pineapple, cherries, and an umbrella. Alcohol isn't my thing, so I'm not sure what to make of it but I was told it's "not too strong" 4. Horchata Bread Pudding (10.25): I'm a sucker for good bread pudding. It was alright but not spiracular or worth the price. I enjoyed the ice cream much more than the bread pudding TIPS AT FUEGO: 1. Social Hour is 11AM-2PM, 3-6PM, Tuesdays through Saturday and Lunch is from 11AM-2PM 2. They have a Groupon deal, but it's ONLY for entrees: groupon.com/deals/fuego-...

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch and Social Hour Menu

ZAfhQL0Vcd4q2oLfFLZuHg.text: Pretty far from our house, so we don't come here often.  Last time we were here everything was great.  Let me start with what wasn't so good.  The singer was too loud, or rather she had the amplifier turned up too high.  Take it off eleven, girl!  And she did all her songs with the same style to the point where they almost sounded the same.  How do you make the Beatles sound the same as Taylor Swift?  And the style she chose made her very pitchy.  Her voice actually squeaked when she tried to go high.  Last time the live music was MUCH better.  Between the volume and the not-good voice, it really detracted from the dining experience.  The food, however, was good.  Pricey, but good.  The Fuego pasta had a nice smoky flavor with a kick.  I sampled the pernil, and it was very good (like last time).  Same for the empanada appetizer.    The paella was a bit disappointing.  Having been to Spain I have had authentic paella, and this wasn't even close.  Even as an 'interpretation' it was pretty weak.  There was a hint of the flavor there, but it was as if they were afraid to emphasize that flavor.  Probably won't order that one again.  One restaurant week entree was ordered also, and it featured a beef dish not on the regular menu, Ropa Vieja.  That dish was pretty good.  Not really "wow", but pretty good.  All in all not as good a performance as our last visit.  Especially for the price.  Pretty good, but not much "wow".  And you really want "wow" at these prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fuego pasta

8fzSLfk5RmAy0NPdrjdCuQ.text: We ordered he house salad, empanadas and tortilla soup.  The soup was AMAZING, and the flavors were incredible! He salad was really good too but too much dressing for my liking. I didn't eat the empanada by my fiance did and he said it was the best one he ever had and that the meat had a really great spice to it!   We went on a Friday which was "Fuego Friday" with a live band. The band was good but loud, we wish we could have sat further away to enjoy them and a conversation with each other.   I'd come back.

7CRCS6WTyE3wtQ07khFrIQ.text: WOW! I stopped over to see my friend Tommy Connell play. This place is locally owned and they certainly value their staff. They menu had a listing of the staff and how long each have been there. I decided to get a meal while there, the most delicious meal I have had in a long time. Highly recommend the green beans.  Cooked to perfection.  The pork tenderloins were off the chain. Loved the ambiance, live music and staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States

j2RFQxHSSe7c_HgvBGHXlw.text: One of my go to restaurants. The service here is very inviting and they make you feel at home. Food comes in huge portions so you're definitely getting a bang for your buck. Fuego bistro is a very unique restaurant and never fails to amaze me every time.

xXChsLqy07t6L7I2QKxePQ.text: The food LOOKS great. I kept seeing what others were eating and wanting that. Ended up getting the Coconut Shrimp Martini. I think I'll go back and try just about everything on the menu over time. It all looks and sounds so good!   Indoor and outdoor seating. A live band played soft music throughout the night. Great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Shrimp Martini

KvR2bt81BJkPs1jj9bukgQ.text: Love this little hidden gem. Live music in the courtyard makes a great date night.

QRquUIgbo1YTjaBXjTCtQQ.text: After a nice AHA sponsored walk this morning we decided to find some new place to eat. Found "Fuego Bistro" in central Corridor of Phoenix set up in an old building with a shantytown atmosphere playing nice Hindustani Sitar!  They have a good set of vegetarian food too! We ordered Veggie Taco, Spicy Veggie Toastadas, Spicy Veggie Quesadilla, Fuego Salad with blackbeans, and Chocolate Torte for desert. Check it out  Just be sure to ask questions on ingredients before deciding. Their corn bread has bacon and rice is cooked in chicken broth. There accept groupon only for limited items. Be sure to ask before ordering.

ojhiio6zK9BNVKFtQ8t8BQ.text: My hubby and I had a date night here, and we absolutely enjoyed every moment of it. The food and service was impeccable.

OIPx2M7TUYXJRUjz1HSJaw.text: Wow, a lot of rave reviews here. Somehow I think that company management has slipped us all a mickey . . . perhaps Uncle Mickey,  because he and Aunt Phylis and all the kids are posting here. That's because I can't find any of this stuff they are raving about.  OK, yes it is hidden and hard to find. But does that by itself make it good? In my opinion, this is one of those restaurants that is making a killing off Groupon and other promotions. I think that we're now seeing a certain type of restaurant emerge that actually LIVES OFF OF those "daily deal promotions." While my wife and I were eating, I saw two other transactions in which someone handed the Groupon coupon to the waiter.   That's OK if its normally priced, or a good deal, because than Groupon is introducing you to something special and you're getting an even better deal. But hey . . . $9 drinks? $5 bottles of beer? These prices at a place where you have to sit on rinky-dink plastic outdoor furniture with wobbly tables just like you might see at the "patio" outside some cheazy taco joint or fast food place.  My wife ordered a THIRTEEN DOLLAR appetizer, because it was one of the cheaper things on the menu and it included four scallops that someone had squirted some sauce over. That's it. LIterally gone in four bites. While my dish was larger, and the pork and mashed potatoes tasted good, it just didn't make our expectations after reading Yelp reviews.  I like to support small, hidden out of the way places, and I enjoy the kind of latin fare that this restaurant promotes. But I'd like to see fair treatment of the customer first and foremost. Offering a pint of draft beer at a fair price and a mojito special would be one way to start on that path, Fuego. Reducing your dependency upon the "jack up the price and then offer them a Groupon discount" would be a second suggestion.

ApTQl4s1K2FiKv7wRe7QUQ.text: Had a Groupon  Coupon and tried the place out for the first time, food was great, Mohitos good also suggest asking to sit in Main seating area as overflow lacks atmosphere main courses very generous, might want to make dinner out of the appetizers will return

8xxkRr6F-zmtIWa7r5EIxw.text: I've been to Fuego Bistro just twice, but both times it was a great experience.  It's tricky to find, and has a very odd sort of setup next to a ballet studio.  But don't get me wrong, the atmosphere is great.  Tonight they had all the indoor tables from around the bar outside since the weather was nice.  Add in the live music and all the friendly staff and it makes for a great night out.  As a complete side note, my wife noticed that the bathroom door has a mail slot in it.  Who knows what this place was before it was Fuego Bistro.   The food?  Well Jeff, the owner, will most likely stop by your table and sell you really hard on something.  Not in a bad sort of way, I believe the guy is just really exciting about his food on a regular basis.  The good news is he isn't full of it, all the food has been great that I've tried.  Tonight he suggested the special, a seafood chile relleno.  Fried goodness with a great spicy finish to it.    The only possible downside would be the prices.  If it were any cheaper I would be a serious regular there.  But there is always a special of some kind going on.  I got our mojitos discounted just for mentioning Yelp tonight.  The last time I used a groupon.  So shop around for coupons before you go.

L1uu5DSfEtrZduDPEBlZgw.text: I tried Fuego for my birthday dinner this year.  Tired of bland chain restaurants, I was really looking to support a local restaurant that was tasty and not the typical food.  I got everything I wanted at Fuego.  Small and quaint, sitting on the patio in April is a treat for sure.    The 3 of us all tried different entres to really get a feel for the food they fix.  Not a single one of us was disappointed.  The short ribs, pasta, and chicken were amazing.  I equally loved the deserts.  Horchata Bread Pudding.... mmmmm.    If you want to stray off the path, you will appreciate what you find at this local eatery.  Enjoy!

pUiCTF84tjH57pSkHYbIcQ.text: Not a ton I can add that hasn't already been covered.  This place is suhweeeeeeet!  When you make reservations, which you should definitely do, make sure to request the patio.  It's spacious and although I get colder faster than any Phoenix native, I was fine even in early February weather.  The food was phenomenal - I had the Tilapia and my lovely companion had some sort of stuffed chicken deal that was too complicated for me to figure out.   The drinks are strong for being in a restaurant - a huge plus for me.  The mojito is definitely worth a shot.    Take great food, a great atmosphere, attentive wait staff, and throw in a guy playing acoustic covers of slower indie songs (think Decemberists) and you've got a winning combination!

iv3qOBkReAZA-oxY38ps1A.text: The food was pretty damn good.  The drinks, also damn good.  I tried their special seafood enchiladas which were stuffed with goat cheese, shrimp, crab and scallops, all topped with a creamy tomatillo sauce.  YUM. The creamed corn and chipotle mashed potatoes, also YUM.  We sat on the patio and watched a dance class happen next door.  My one and only complaint.... the table.  The actual table itself.  It was wooden, and very pokey.  Like, we all thought we were going to get splinters.  Not nice.

uORyKHN99fr2pKtHquYlHA.text: I find it hilarious that someone would reference this place as being terrible,  compare it to (overpriced and bland) Humble Pie, and in the same breath say it was the best chili relleno you ever tasted.   I can't vouch for the chicken tacos but most street tacos are nowhere near packed with meat. By definition they are usually very tiny with onions,some guacamole, a little cabbage, and some small cuts of meat.  I can say the tilapia tacos are tops(large filet on each) on the list of my girlfriend's quest for good fish tacos. I can say the pork nachos are the best I have had as the pork reminds me of Los Dos Molinos in a small way. The empanadas are excellent as well.  If you go for happy hour you can get two empanadas for 6 bucks. You can also get 2 large fish tacos for 6 bucks. Would you like some awesome tortilla soup? 4 bucks. If you get the dinner version of the emapanadas with a large portion of some of the best rice and a side of black beans I think it sets you back about 11 bucks. I have also had the chili relleno and it is the best I have tasted as well leaving me to wonder with the single review you have for anything, why the venom?  I learned long ago to ask for what is recommended for before you order and if someone recommends a place try what they are harping about first. When I asked they said the chili relleno, pork, empanadas, and red sangrias. Guess how my dining experience went? Try ordering tacos from Los Dos Molinos and you will leave pissed. Order the green chili pork and you will drive 100 miles for it.  I do hope you give it another chance I have honestly never had anything sub par here in my 7 or so visits and they seriously could charge way more for quality than they do.  I agree that Main Ingredient is great also, that's why I took the time to write about it.   But to reiterate:  11-13 dollar for most dinner items besides new york strip(on the list to try), is not pricey  happy hour has most items for 4-6$  street tacos are not bursting with meat  ask what is the best thing on the menu when you order some place then you can write it off all you want.  Humble Pie  was more pricey and not worth it, All it does is take up parking from a much better place next door. For a place with the reference to pizza in it's name you would think it would be better, it tasted like peter piper.  I would love to know what a good chicken taco is in your opinion, I cant think of any besides maybe the California tacos at the now closed Chuy's, but the ones my sister ordered from here were full of chicken and topped with a nice chipotle/ranch like sauce which is similar.

Qx51X6d5bPXAqTOP7bPcDA.text: My partner brought me here for what we thought would be a nice, romantic birthday dinner at a cozy neighborhood spot. We hadn't been in a year or so, and were both disappointed - here's the good + bad:  The good: 1. Shared plate #1 - slow-roasted pork, green chile cornbread casserole and maple-glazed carrots were all excellent, especially the pork which was so flavorful. Would have this again in an instant. 2. Classic lime mojito - very good if not just a bit sweet (but see point about drinks below) 3. The happy hour menu - 1/3 of the dinner page - looked great. 3-6pm, may have to give that a try instead of dinner  The bad: 1. Place was empty at 8pm - just one other table inside besides us (plus one guy at bar, one table on patio) 2. No music until halfway through dinner - then The Cure, Violent Femmes and other 80s alternative - which I like, but not in a sit-down restaurant for dinner. And the bartender sang along occasionally - ugh. 3. Mixed drinks in a pint glass - never a fan unless at a dive bar. 4. Out appetizer never came - waiter said he didn't remember us ordering even though he commented that the dish was good when we ordered. With just one other table, a big disappointment. (to his partial credit, he did bring us A SMALL PORTION of the appetizer with our entrees for free) 5. Shared plate #2 - new york strip, cheddar mashed potatoes and organic green beans were all just OK. Not a fan of the sauce the steak was in, and topping of mushrooms, onions and peppers too heavy. Way too much mashed potatoes and green beans, which were both pretty bland. 6. Toward the end of our meal, a young boy came into the restaurant and started playing with a ball right next to our table. I am not joking. wtf?  Overall, I'd like to think we just experienced an off-night here. But, attention to details like mood and music  (plus getting everything you ordered) are also important. Some of the food was very good, so we may give it another try sometime - but, truthfully, I think there are a number of better restaurants in the area.

8F_uyUc3epVAfNX2MmSkEA.text: Fuego Bistro has awesome Latin food. Everyone talks about the Mojidos and they are great but my favorite was the Angus New York Grilled Steak. It was a little bit pricey at $26 but I had a 50% off coupon that I just bought yesterday at phoenix.org. Don't remember exactly where the coupon is but I found it on the first page of Google when I searched for "Phoenix.org, Fuego Bistro Discount card". I highly recommend the bistro. Don't skimp on the appetizers, they are awesome!

5hrG3b7Sg7ad1n14N_-l5Q.text: Great place ! Service was prompt & friendly.  Food was fabulous - I ordered short ribs with mashed potatoes and maple glazed carrots. My friend ordered the chile relleno with seafood. His was quite good - though maybe too many flavors competing since there were various types of seafood in it. My short ribs were excellent. A huge portion that was 3 meals for each of us. Great value, great quality. Stick with the wine list; we each ordered a cocktail that we wouldn't re-order next time.  Charming, intimate, quaint place.

h-FkiqJGJTx6v6RUq_CNnw.text: I went for the second time a few days ago. The food was just as good as it was the first time we went. It's a little hidden gem that is well worth it.

INTEJljDMSqEejxYr7UikA.text: We ate here for dinner last night after buying a couple of groupon deals and it was amazing!  We ate inside at a really small table by the kitchen.  Normally, not my favorite seat but I actually enjoyed watching all of the dinners come out of the kitchen.  They all looked sooooo good!  I had the stuffed chili relleno and my husband had the pork asado.  Both tasted amazing.  We also had the horchata bread pudding for dessert.  It was good and not too sweet.  We also had the wild salmon croquettes for an appetizer.  It was fantastic.  I'm looking forward to coming back again!

k9oDzBduz2RwyPrLWsBK_Q.text: This place has been in Phx for years and I tried it for the first time today. I didn't have any expectations so I can't say I was disappointed but I wasn't wowed either. I had the chili relleno plate and the sauce was delish. The breading was too thick for my liking but it was good. I believe they used a poblano chili, which was different from my Mexican cuisine expectations but I enjoyed the difference. It was stuffed with cheese and chicken. The rice was fantastic. If I can duplicate it at home I will. That may require a few more visits, though. My dining mate had the pork carnitas tacos and the meat was delish. I'll try next time, for sure!

6fd_Iaf6TBfznL9rpl6RHA.text: Long ago, I went to a great little cafe in uptown Phoenix. We had dinner in a courtyard with a fountain, live music, and a ballet school next to it. I couldn't remember what the place was called or where it was at to save my life. So I never returned...  Years later, I started my search to go back to that great little cafe, only to find out it changed to Fuego Bistro. I was sad at first, until I saw the menu online. Soooooo up my alley. I love delicious spicy mixes of Latin and American cuisines. Restaurant week came and Fuego was on the list and they were including a cocktail with our 3 course dinner. Hells yeah!! Definitely my kind of place!  Here's the meal rundown:  1st course: I got the empanada. So sad it wasn't empanadas. I could eat these for every meal for the rest of my life and never once complain of monotony. My buddy got the tostadas. Lucky him, he got two. I stole some of his beef that was on top and it was melt in my mouth delicious. So far, 2 for 2.  2nd course: I got the chili relleno with jalapeno creamed corn and chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes. O-M-G!!!! I don't even know where to start. The corn definitely had a kick and was made sweet white corn which added a nice balance to the spice. I have since bought sweet white corn and jalapenos to try to recreate these. It won't be as good; but that just means I'll be heading back. If I could make mashed potatoes this good, I'd move to Idaho. The chili relleno was bomb-diggity. Chicken, black beans, cheese, love.  My friend had the signature pernil asado and the same sides as me. I hardly got the chance to try his he ate it so fast. Signature for a reason. YUMMMMMMY!  Score: 4 for 4.  3rd course: I got the horchata chocolate chip bread pudding. I was so full I could not fully appreciate this giant plate of wonderfulness. My friend got the creme brulee and it was just as fantastic, but I'm going to say this round goes to the bread pudding.  6 for 6.  As for the included cocktail, I had the white sangria. I love sangria. It was a perfect blend of sweet and crisp and didn't have too much fruit or wine flavor to it. It was strong and I could only make it through one.  The server was super friendly, the atmosphere fantastic, the food to die for, and the drinks strong and delicious. I'm surprised this place isn't constantly packed with an hour wait. Definitely a new favorite. I'm so happy it's not that old cafe I was searching for.

uI_dd5_LqXBCMC_t8oNIvA.text: Tried this place after getting a groupon.  I was very pleasantly surprised.  The location is not the best, but what was lacking in appearance, certainly made up for it with the food that was served.  The decor inside of the restaurant is very well put together.  Somewhat, a kind of modern mexican feel.    I ordered the Cola and Pineapple Soy Braised Angus Short Rib Roast.  A great choice that I will definitely order again.  The meat was so tender and melted in your mouth.  The spices were spot on.  I paired it with the green chili cornbread casserole and chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes.  Both of which were amazing.  My fiance had the pernil asado.  This was also very good, but was not my favorite of the two.  Although, I don't really eat pork.  Overall, I would definitely recommend.  If you plan on going, get reservations, or you might end up having to sit at the bar.  Its a small place.  Sometimes so busy that they never answer their phone (something they can probably improve on).

Nn6XJIVloNZ3lpVvF8pYgA.text: Chicken tacos are awesome. I like that they have a short and simple menu. Draft beer selection is great.

5pQ9_Gtrb9p7ZuFF0yy7Iw.text: Love love love!!!  Great service, great food, great drinks, great wine.  We sat outside on the patio on a Saturday night, listened to live music and shared some wine and food.  Very romantic setting, and peaceful.  The appetizers are not truly appetizers...they are MEALS!!  Had the ahi tuna tostadas...couldn't eat anything after that.  The portions are large, so split if you can.  The food is very very very very good.  We ended up taking some friends there a few days later.  They loved it too.  Love the atmosphere.  This is a perfect place for a nice romantic dinner on the patio.  Absolutely make reservations first.

m4I43ntqnxIPA8_hjcpabw.text: I love Fuego. I really do. The servers are super nice, like good people nice. And the food? Oh, the food is wonderfully wonderful. What to recommend? Pretty much every main dish is great. I've never had chicken so moist or pork so tender other than fuego. I frequently think of the mashed potatoes and particularly the jalapeno corn bread. Like I said, I love the place. Haven't gone for happy hour yet, but I would very much like to.

xHGafT79M7Nab6yXjgp3yw.text: A little out of the way but worth the venture if you are interested in bistro style street tacos. The tacos were very good- with the exception of the cabbage that they put on what I believe to be all of them. The service was great anhd the prices were okay. A good place for lunch dates!

eWcxeTSPPosnGHBOAQaVkw.text: How anyone gives this place less than 4 stars is beyond me!   I am just assuming they are simply angry elves and will never be pleased, perhaps they were never loved as kids or just need a hug...but pay no attention to them.  This place is amazing!  It's quirky, charming, hidden, sort of a tex-mex latin fusion, but at any rate- it's just plain good!   Definitely try some of the different mojito flavors, I think pomegranate was our favorite.  It's easy to rack up a bill at this place with the entrees, but I've heard they have great happy hour deals so check that out.  About the restaurant itself- it really doesn't look like one from the street.  It is a bit hidden.  The restaurant inside is smaller, but very cute.  Personally I prefer the patio/courtyard, although I haven't been there recently I am assuming they have space heaters set out.  Each time we have eaten here we have the same waitress, who is just as quirky and charming as the restaurant itself, loved her, she just seemed like the happiest person on earth lol!  The owner also stopped by on one occasion, incredibly nice and personable.   In short, go there and try it.  It might not be your style if you don't care for the tex-mex latin cuisine or if you are an angry elf person who cannot be pleased :)  LOL- look at the one person that gave this place a 1 star rating, angry elf!

bDko1-6FEWkPGhJ03r2klQ.text: Do you ever want to go out for dinner but just can't decide on what you want or where you want to go???  Well, I think I have found that place to go for very good food.    The Pernil Asado (pork) was very moist and flavorfull.   My wife got the veggie enchiladas...all fresh veggies.  Cornbread caserole (with bacon), jalapeno cream corn, and chipolatle mashed potatoes were all great.    The portions were very big...had to roll is out!

yoK-9LjU-CT4bUqWVtoHIA.text: Amazing meal tonight.  The food has an amazingly delicate quality. Dying under the stars, listen to good music and enjoy.  I love the Empanadas appetizer. Oh yeah the people are great too.

BTMlW7zdp73Ox4PN06yztQ.text: Love this place! Food is YUMMY!! Jeff, the owner is almost always there & makes you feel like you are a guest in his home.Service is very good.

AhupGX3P8kFNsseKRDuJcw.text: We went for the second time last night and it was really very good. There were some glitches last night that seemed to be felt throughout the restaurant. Case and point: my boyfriend order a rare steak (we even emphasized really rare) and it came medium well. The waitress kindly resolved the issue, but I was almost done with my meal by the time his replacement steak arrived. But I will not fault them for this.   We shared some tortilla soup to start (very tasty and could be a meal by itself). I had the Shrimp dinner . . .very good a little spicy and my shrimp were slightly over cooked.   The star of the night was for sure the cornbread chili casserole - it was sweet with a little spicy . . .so good.   Generally I find their dishes slightly on the spicy side for my taste buds - but overall very good. I would give them a 3 1/2 . . . almost a 4   We will be back . . . may be just for the cornbread and tortilla soup!

2H4oEx72WjlKYQUalZ4E6w.text: So, it was my weekend to choose dinner, and being that it was restaurant week I perused the menus for one that intrigued me. I arrived on the menu for Fuego Bistro and after reading the reviews on yelp decided this was THE PLACE.   We arrived around 7pm and were somewhat confused where to park, but after we did, we found the restaurant entrance and were seated. The host was very friendly and proactively saw our table was shaky and fixed it for us. They have a nice area for sitting outside and had live music, which was quite enjoyable. It did take our waitress awhile to greet us and take our drink order, but other than that slowness at the beginning, the rest of the service was good. Also, something I really enjoy is when the servers are passionate about the food they are serving and at Fuego, that definitely came across.   Now, the most important part, the food. It was excellent. We tried a bit of everything since it was restaurant week. I really liked the nachos (which were HUGE) and empanada. The pasta was excellent, with a nice kick and the chorizo was a great touch. The corn casserole is to die for! Dessert was OK in my opinion, but the appetizers and main courses for surpassed the dessert.   To sum things up, Fuego is a fun, unique restaurant with great food and passionate service.

pBqrU-s5ZkGiC499nSfMiA.text: On the recommendation of a friend, we decided to try Fuego Bistro.  We were pleasantly surprised, to say the least.  The restaurant is comfortably small, with patio seating and a handful of tables inside.  They had a full bar with various liquors and a good wine selection.  We tried their red sangria, which was really flavorful and not too sweet.  I ordered the pernil asado with cheddar mashed potatoes and green chile cornbread.  The plate was huge and gave me enough food to take home for lunch the next day.  My boyfriend had the chile relleno with creamed corn and cornbread.  Both of our dishes were very flavorful and tasty.  We also tried the banana burrito for dessert, which was perfect!  I couldn't have asked for a better tasting meal.  The service was very warm and attentive.  We had a groupon, which helped with the bill, as it was on the pricier side (average $20-25 a plate).  It still would have been worth it to me.  They even gave us a BOGO flier after we paid!  I will definitely be back.

S-JvUo1xbwjcXTPk-SYCxw.text: Love love love this place! Highly recommend the food and the service is amazing!  We tried this place on a living social deal and it was a bit tucked away and hard to find but totally worth the find. Portions are big and food is delicious! Will definitely be our go to place in the future!

3BbWRGrWgDpgsWsx0wFj5w.text: Ok-It pains me to have to take away a star. Dined here on Saturday. The service was really awkward and everything was a little off including the food which my dining companion noted did not "wow" him this time. I had to agree that mine was not quite as tasty as usual. I would have loved a second cocktail but our server disappeared so by that time our dinner was well over so we just decided to go somewhere else for that second drink. There were also two couples waiting for a table that just kind of loitered in our vicinity. It was strange being stared down for a table at Fuego. I am not willing to write Fuego off yet as I loved it so. I am really hoping it was just an "off" night. I don't think I can persuade my dinner date to go back there anytime soon but it is still on my list of faves.
