I will return to Fuego Bistro, it's a small menu but there are several dishes I would try. Our server didn't up-charge us a split plate fee for the entree which was nice, because the prices are a little steep. I also plan to check out their Happy Hour which looks like a great value...once I can finally drink again!

RPGYE_YKXD1lOHxQFuABNQ.text: I stopped in here one day to give it a try as I ususaly go to the one on Camelback Rd. Decided to try something different this time. Since I really like Chile Rellenos I ordered that.  What a disappointment!  I had thought it would be filled with mostly cheese but it wasn't.  I did not like the filling or the crunchy skin.  Also it was too hot and spicey.  next time I will stick to my pork tacos.  Hopefully they will be the same as at their other restaurant.  I also do not like their salsa.  It is not chunky and is TOO HOT.  Now if they served their pico de gallo to those who do not like the spicey salsa and without charging 3 bucks,  I mean like if you are serving salsa then at least besides HOT, serve some medium, and some mild.

kRn-wWYqtTS8pJTwYZX1xA.text: Excellent food and very nice atmosphere. courtyard setting is great. Don't let view from street turn you away.

_ltApU6gS7rxNoPfel3o9Q.text: I love, love, love this place!  While I go to Fuego Cityscape more often, since it is downstairs from my gym, I love the ambiance, indoors and outdoors on the expansive patio.   The food is excellent.  My favorite is the Chile Rellenos, but the Pork Nachos and Empenadas are great as well, as are the very fresh mojitos (can get Pomegranate and Mango Mojitos), wine and everything on the menu.  The manager is super-friendly and very patient with us, and when we go, we tend to close the place down, eating and drinking and being merry.  I told the manager that if you feed us, we will never leave.  I think he believes us!  Do yourself a favor and visit this excellent little restaurant..you will be glad you did!

JpRnbgOcX053fcy7Filj2Q.text: The seafood chili relleno green chile cornbread casserole are must haves.

eVBzpSzHMpqgmGR7eHwuLw.text: The drive to Fuego Bistro is quite interesting.  My navigation told me to turn right, and it looked like I was turning into a ghetto drive-way.  Slowly after a couple minutes, I saw a ballet place and a quaint courtyard leading to the restaurant.  When we walked towards the courtyard, it looked much better.  They have outside seating and some inside seating.  We chose the outside because they had some live music going on.  All the items looked very interesting.  I went for the Restaurant Week choice of Chicken Tortilla Soup, Vegetarian Enchiladas, and Banana Burrito sundae.  The vegetables in the enchilada tasted a lot better than I expected.  My friends shared beef empanadas and chicken chipotle pasta.  The flavors were very vibrant and rich.  Everything tasted exceptional.  This place is family owned and the two chefs are from Guadalajara, Mexico.  This Hole in the Wall is a place I will have to visit again for Happy Hour.

PKxPI46PpG5pl6LtW81KKw.text: Loved the ambiance of this place and the friendliness of our waitress, Lauren!  The presence of a guy playing soft music in the background was a bonus.  The menu is varied and the portions are generous.  It's definitely a place worth visiting for something different.

r3Y2rpUN0v0PDkcZHCOe4w.text: My Mom took me here while visiting her. It's an adorable little place with a nice patio and very nice staff. It's apparently hard to find if you don't have a GPS, but most people do these days so no sweat.  The food was AWESOME!!!! It was some of the best food I've had in a long time. Everything was perfect and very filling. I ordered the carnitas tacos with rice and beans. The carnitas were slow cooked for a few days with various spices. OMFG, yes please. The rice and beans, generally a side that are NBD, were soooo yummy. I could eat that combo everyday. Seriously. That sauce on the tacos was delish too.  The rest of the trip I talked about how good the food was and how I wanted to go back. Sadly it was too far from my Mom's place. Next time it's on!!  I'd also like to casually mention that Yelp may or may not still have a $5 for $10 deal for it. Even better!

RSoOnUT5okCzoRcjygPlyg.text: Beyond tasty! We had a groupon and decided to try Fuego Bistro for the first time. Had never heard of it before. Whoa! Each item we had was so unique and beyond regular fare taste that our taste buds were at attention!  Food: We ordered Empanadas which had a tender crusty outside and a tasty center which included ground beef, cheddar cheese, black bean, corn, peppers, onions, and roasted Anaheim chilis served with a homemade chipotle BBQ sauce which was a spicy sweet taste. Yum! We both ordered the Pernil Asado which is pork roasted until it's so tender and very juicy that it falls apart. No knife required. 2 homemade tortillas and an orange habanero mojo sauce are included. The mojo sauce is so tasty we used every last drop. The entrees come with 2 sides so we tried 1. Green Chili Cornbread Casserole which is so moist and the best corn bread I've ever had. 2. Chipotle Cheddar Mashed Potatoes which have a smoky unique flavor.   One thing I can say is bring your appetite because there's lots of food. This is a real comfort meal!

IvBiipO63ahD2zXzJiwaOw.text: Found this place through Yelp and couldn't have been happier with it.  The area is a bit downtrodden/industrial, but this place has a great courtyard with lights and live music.  The food was fantastic, southwestern but really unique.  The steak and shrimp special was the best steak I have ever tasted.  The flavors of all of the entrees and sides were distinctive and delicious.   We will definitely go back next time we are in Phoenix.

inuNlDyc291d1XR2rPe_Vw.text: I tried Fuego almost 2 years ago...hopefully it's better now.  They won awards for their mojitos so I  excited to try one. Yuck. Food was lukewarm and the mashed potatoes tasted like band aids. I don't know what band aids taste like but that would be my guess.

97me_eaJieo6I630jWzKZg.text: We have no shortage of Mexican Food joints in the Phoenix area. Some would say we maybe have too many. However, as an avid Mexican Food fan, I can't ever have enough. I will say, though, that some tend to be the same old story, with slight tweaks. Example? The burrito at Garcia's tastes a lot like the one at Manuel's. Don't even get me started on Macayo's...  However, Fuego Bistro is that breath of fresh air that we Mexican Food lovers have been waiting for. Everything is fresh, unique, and absolutely fantastic. The first time I came here, I tried the pernil asada, a tender, shredded pork dish that beats any carnitas-style dish I've ever had. The crisp, sweet red cabbage that they serve with it and other dishes is so amazing that even I eat it, and I typically hate cabbage.   Then there's the happy hour. Cheap prices on wonderful food, to include the Cubano Sliders. Oh my goodness, were these something to die for. They go quite well with a cold Modelo with lime too, by the way.  Prices run a bit high, but the lunch menu offers a bit of a break, and happy hour of course is very reasonable. In all, you won't be disappointed here. If anything, you'll be thankful for a fresh take on a cuisine that has become rather saturated into the Phoenix area. My kudos to the chef, staff, and owner of this fine dining establishment.

KLFzsev-aQgL31O9IRlEIA.text: This is my favorite restuarant in Phoenix. I was introduced to this place by my bosses who equally love it.  One of the waitresses is a client of ours as well.  The food is AMAZING!  My favorites are the empanadas,  the chicken with the tomatillo cream sauce and the Fuego pasta. My favorite sides are the green chili cornbread casserole and the chipotle cheddar mashed potatoes.  Just talking about it makes me want to eat there. The space they occupy is near a dance studio so it's fun to see students running around.  The outdoor dining space is gorgeous when the weather is nice and they have live music some nights. The iced tea is a must and I have tried the Kahlua Creme Brulee with friends but I didn't love it because I don't love Kahlua but if you do then it'll be amazing!  You can't go wrong with this place. Casual enough to bring family and friends but the food and atmosphere are lovely enough to bring a date or to impress your boss or clients. The portions are huge which is great because then you get to enjoy your meal all over again the next day! Lastly, the service here is top notch!  I'm pretty sure the owner goes around refilling drinks and bringing out food! Oops almost forgot, for those with kids there is a kids menu for 12 and under who need more familiar foods like chicken fingers, tacos or cheese quesadilla etc.

gwi61lO1SubnsneqUVFL_Q.text: Some friends took us here and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The service was great, food was amazing.  Tried one of the specials, Mahi Mahi...... Their chef is very skilled!  Many flavors of mojitos, very good.  We loved it.

UYtuFKpl01zn_gnKcv-AlA.text: The Yelp rating "As good as it gets" says it so perfectly!  Just had the Fuego Pasta w/ Shrimp and I was absolutely BLOWN AWAY!! After reading the other reviews I felt that I might be out of my comfort zone with the different styles of food that Fuego Bistro offers (I'm more of a  simpleton, Steak and Taters guy). Missy, the fabulous bartender/hostess/goddess, was most excellent in helping me decide between the Pasta and the Empenada and I was most most pleased with the suggestion.   Again, I don't think you can go wrong here. Local AZ business, great food, amazing staff, wonderful owner, the Feng Shui of this place really makes you feel at home! Kudos Fuego, kudos!

gODoMciNb4QM6XFtrvIBMw.text: I gotta lotta love for Fuego Bistro... While visiting familia in Phoenix they raved about this restaurant & since we were on holiday time, strolled in around 3:00 for lunch. We were heartbroken to learn from the gracious kitchen staff that they were closed btw lunch & dinner. Seeing our disappointment he agreed to cook & serve us if we didn't mind his broken English. I love an adventure & my sweet BIL speaks un poquito Espanol;) Our party of 6 was served one of the best meals ever. I had the shredded pork.... Similar to carnitas but juicy, my husband the empanadas. We all shared 2 orders of the mussels which were insane. And my 10 yo, an enchilada aficionado, claimed it was his very best enchiladas EVER.   Cool little authentic joint w/ fantastic service & food. I highly recommend.

G8ZZRjYIuDJ0KgcuCImtOg.text: This restaurant is tucked away but definitely worth finding.  There is a small courtyard with various tables, as well as what appears to be two or three separate indoor seating areas.  Interesting artwork is available for purchase on the walls.  We were promptly and courteously seated, but I did notice that when I had called earlier to make the reservation, I had been asked if we preferred outside or inside seating.  I chose outside, and we were promptly seated inside!  This was no big deal, and we were offered a table outside if we wanted.  Our waitress was friendly and efficient, and the food was excellent, with huge portions.  Make sure to save room for dessert!  The only hiccup was really not the restaurant's fault - their internet was down so they couldn't use the credit card terminal machine.  This created a bit of confusion and significantly slowed down paying the bill.  Despite the fiasco, our server remained calm and polite, even though she was not particularly thrilled about us splitting the bill.  In summary, I do recommend giving this place a good look and enjoy a mojito while you're there!

rotUP2Em_26WvDDxgBTDvg.text: Spinach salad with bacon citrus vinaigrette dressing, goat cheese, red onion and house caramelized nuts @ afternoon happy hour prices.  Cool spot to cool your heels on a hot afternoon on the shaded, mist-cooled patio or the small-but-not cramped wonderfully cool dining room and bar.  This is a really relaxing oasis of calm down to the Ottmar Leibert (spelling?)  Latin jazz in the background, quiet enough so you hold a conversation without having to raise your voice.    A thoroughly inviting a place to sit, have a cool drink of your choice and add something with some heat from the kitchen perhaps more because you are in no hurry than due to hunger.  For the delicate gringo stomached among us, note that Fuego does mean "Fire", and there is a little - or more in nearly every dish I've tried.  None have been overwhelming but some did incite some internal conversation over self-induced gastric distress. For those similarly afflicted, a pink bismuth aqueous solution shooter may be the perfect preparatory aperitif.  It's worth it.    A surprisingly delightful, sophisticated find tucked behind Apollo's on 7th Street in a commercial area of 7th Street not otherwise particularly aesthetically appealing.  I was already a fan of Fuego Cityscape and this Fuego is all that and more.  More  upscale in offerings and prices as well, but watch for the frequent Groupon or similar offers online.  Maybe it was the hot day, the iced tea, and the cool, relaxed comfort of the dining room (not to forget the attentive service), but all in all on this day, this was bliss. 5 Stars.

IP0s8jKb-xQq4vk7FBSyBA.text: So Good, So Very Good Off on a side street and wedged between 2 dance studios its a little tough to find, but worth it.  The food is off the charts good.  Tremendous depth and complexity of flavors. Dishes that compliment each other without ever getting over-whelmed.  A festive atmosphere with live music in the background.... Wow!!!  We had been to The Mission 2 days earlier which everyone raves about.  That was good this was GREAT!!!     Next time we are in town we will be back!

LRIsZqo5_I_u77EQH23XWQ.text: This peaceful, hidden, romantic and unique resturaunt is tucked away in a beautiful garden patio like plaza. I have never had an under 5 star experience here. The food is perfected and is a mouthful of flavor no matter what you get. My favorites are the chipotle mashed potatoes and the jalapeno corn bread paired with the ancho chile rubbed steak. In the evening time they have live music that adds a romantic touch with tables that are candle lit. The staff are very attentive and always make sure your having the best dining experience possible. The only shock is for two people without any coupons the bill will easily be about $100. It's well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is one yummy mojito!

n85pCDWrgbyeQRxm0aA6Uw.text: Last night my husband I went here for dinner.  We have eaten here before and we liked the food.  So, we thought we would try it again.   I'm kind of sad that our experience was not all that great this time.   The waiter that we had was not very good.  Was not very helper and he never came around to see if we liked our food or if we needed anything.    Also the water guy was great, he came around and checked on us, to see if we liked our food or if we needed anything.  I wish we could have tipped him and not our waiter.   Now for the food, it was pretty good.  We ordered the Pineapple short rib roast and it came with mashed potatoes and creamy corn.   It is definitely an enough for two people.      Last and not least, the atmosphere of this restaurant is not all that great either.  It is in the middle of this little shopping center and you could hear the music for the dance studio that was right next to the patio seating.   Happy yelping everyone!!!  If you decided to come here the food is not all that bad.  We in joyed it!!!

VkTRnsvBzqCLhDMwkjGWjQ.text: Decided to ride my bike to one of my favorite neighborhood restaurants for happy hour & the BEST raspberry mojito made by one of THE best bartertenders in town. I had the chicken street tacos which are very fresh & stuff with a lot of chicken & veggies & just the right amount of spice to compliment the tacos. This a great place for happy hour or a nice dinner. Friendly & knowledgable staff and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken street tacos &amp; raspberry mojito.

GvrV-dEEi83XAsme6dnulw.text: Researched restaurants for cinco de mayo dinner .picked trip advisors #1.. Fuego off of 7th st in Phoenix..  somewhat seedy part of town but figured that might make it all the more real .Walked in and first impression was the poor housekeeping.  Dirty floors, dirty walls ,filthy chair seats.  Beer was lukewarm. Food was no better than any of the dozens of other mediocre joints we've been in for the last 50+ years. Food did not come to the table hot. On .the plus side the young quartet played some sweet music.oh yea it's not cheap either.

p1KqSl-0d4LsNrlgL-UebQ.text: Loved it!! the food was fantastic. Service was great! we arrived 30mins late for our reservation (we were already upset with our lateness) Yet they were still very friendly to us. it speaks a lot about who they are.  As we eat the food we were already planning when next to visit.

S2cEHWbi6N1ZLqM1TmSN7A.text: Found a new spot in Phoenix and loved it.  Won Best Hidden Restaurant and I can see why.  Great ambience, great food, great service, great music.  What more do you need?  Check 'em out!!

-BvKse_5fowt_qnFaxwuYg.text: We found that "pot of gold" at the end of the rainbow! This cool little restaurant has it all! Exceptional food! I had the Bistro Seafood Chile Relleno with the cornbread and tortilla soup. The entree and the cornbread were perfect in every way! The outdoor seating was cooled by multiple misters.  Two musicians performed for the patrons and that was fun! Our server was attentive and helpful with the menu. A "Perfect 10" for dinner! Can't wait to try out the lunch and happy hour menu!   If you like unique local restaurants who deliver quality menu items and friendly service, then head down to Fuego Bistro!   On a side note, dinner entrees are in the $23-$28 range.  I asked if you can order off the lunch menu and was told that was not an option. Although we didn't have lunch or happy hour there, I can attest there are plenty of less pricey items to chose from on those menus.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short Rib Enchiladas with carrots and green beans
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bistro Seafood Chili Relleno. A+ Entree!

wEinN8pRRCrOr5Ionmg1iw.text: Never been threaten by a server at a public establishment before what a lunch, worst human degrading experience I've ever had a restaurant . Waitress gave me incorrect pricing on my order & expected for me to pay which i felt pushed to do by her attitude and diminishing behavior as she directed herself towards me, I'm not happy about being lied or being treated so unprofessional during my lunch time, telling me that " i was lucky it was not a corporate chain & continued to make rude a crude remarks, the food was good but i don't think being treated like this is worth the time or my money in this place , being disrespected due to a server not wanting to own up to her mistakes is not worth the time. Server called owner about HER mistake when providing the infomation to me to which all the owner had to say was "MAKE SURE HE PAYS". This is a very rude practice this establishment has, i will make sure this gets out to the public. I'm very disgusted with this establishment & will never recomend anyone or comeback.

bMQsSzN1rSnKTwxmJSAMxA.text: I loved everything about this place.  The food (the flavor of the pernil jumped out at me and hit me in my happy place - savory, salty, fatty), the portions were huge, the space (the courtyard with the fountain) was perfect on a beautiful spring afternoon (my daughter loved it), and the service was personal and friendly.  I'll be back with my beautiful and delicious wife.

33xK0U-YZngNu3-AFF2S0g.text: This place was BEYOND fantastic in every single way possible.  I ordered the Bistro Seafood Chile Relleno - Their Signature Dish Of Pasilla Pepper Stuffed With Shrimp, Scallops & Mahi Mahi, Panko Crusted & Topped With A Lobster Chile Cream Sauce. It was OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!  Pair that with a wonderful prickly pair margarita (the size of my head) and my taste buds danced with delight all night long.  My parents shared the Short Rib Enchiladas (Cola & Pineapple Braised Soy Short Rib Stuffed Into Corn Tortillas Topped With A Rich Mole Sauce And Queso Fresco Cheese) and we all enjoyed green beans, corn bread and cheddar mashed potatoes.  We rounded our evening out with the Mexican Ice Cream sundae which came in a mug the size of someone heading to Oktoberfest. It was crazy good!

f6mk0MGFD-6ERRg9bxIJ3A.text: We went here for dinner and it just so happened to be restaurant week... lucky us! Usually restaurant week isn't my favorite because your service isn't as great or you get smaller portions, but that wasn't the case here (I hadn't dined here before but I will say that if these weren't full size portions then the portions must be HUGE). Live music (on Friday nights at least - and I would assume all weekend), so many gluten free options, great food, great service... awesome!   Food: We (very much) enjoyed the Guacamole, Chips & Salsa small plate... the salsa is a chipotle salsa with a little kick.. yum! We also got to try a sampler platter of small plates, which came with an Empanada, Spicy Veggie Tostada and Cubano Slider... unfortunately for me I could only enjoy the tostada (only GF item of the three) but it was seriously delicious! Definitely hard to share... but nonetheless, delicious. My aunt and cousin did say that the other items were just as good, especially the empanada! I tried a bite of the Tortilla soup (5/5 stars) and had the Spinach Salad - seriously, SO good... their balsamic dressing was one of my favorites I've had. For my main meal, I had the Ropa Vieja (it didn't look like it was on the regular menu) but it was so good. Such great flavor, wonderfully tender and more than I could eat so definitely enough for leftovers); for my sides I had the Jalapeno Cream Corn and Chipotle Cheddar Mashed Potatoes -- both highly recommended... unique, great flavors. For dessert, the Chocolate Torte isn't technically GF because the pan it is made in is lined with flour... I went for it (only eating a bite) and tried to not eat the outsides because none of the actual ingredients contain wheat/gluten... it was very rich and I only had a bite because I was so full.  Drinks: With the restaurant week menu came a glass of their sangria. Honestly, not a fan... tasted semi-watered down. I wish I had tried the Mojito as I had originally planned. It was kind of a let down so I wouldn't order it if (I mean when) I return... my cousin also agreed that this wasn't our favorite.   Service: So great and tentative. The (I think) manager was very friendly and checked on us multiple times throughout our meal. Our waitress was super awesome and friendly! Just as good as the meal itself.   In conclusion, I will definitely be back! The ONLY thing I didn't enjoy 100% was the sangria, as mentioned. But I am picky with my drinks and I'm sure next time whatever drink I have will be amazing. The outside seating may get a little warm in the summer months but they do have misters (they weren't on when we were there because it wasn't too warm). The live music really set a great ambiance. We were right next to the band and it wasn't too loud but it's also loud enough to be heard all over the patio. I definitely think this is one of my new favorites.

Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ropa Vieja (GF), Jalapeño Cream Corn, Chipotle Cheddar Mashed Potatoes (off the restaurant week menu)

aKq3hDvovQLp_fkyw4ERsA.text: Went to Fuego with my family and everything we tried was amazing! We ended up going back 2 nights later because it was so good. I would recommend ordering multiple items off of the Happy Hour menu to share so you get to try everything. Our favorite thing we tried was the pernil pork, it's great in any dish!

P3FmsFvrNTVxpslUBcNTbA.text: I like this place service is great the food is ok and consistent I'm always sure whatever I'm getting will be the same as eat time that's what I mean consistent.

QjBBSJwDfBZC0J8nNubAOQ.text: Sadly didn't get to try the food, so this rating is based on the service/ experience we had.  Made the last minute decision to eat out and Valentines Day. We knew that it would probably be tough finding somewhere without a reservation, but we went on the earlier side to give it a shot anyways.   When we asked if they were able to accommodate a party of two, the manager came up to us and was extremely rude, stressed out, and on edge. He scoffed at us and said "wish I could take your dough, but we cannot take anyone - not even at the bar."  Really didn't care if they were going to be able to seat us or not, but treating us a little bit better when breaking the news would have been appreciated. We will not be coming back here.

NDauUbkZOrnYD7T3zpAyZQ.text: What an awesome find. I had the Pork Medallion with the chipotle mashed potatoes and jalapeno corn. It was a great evening with attentive service and live music. Perfect weather was also a plus. If you are in the area, come check this place out and enjoy anything you eat.

HhiVHE6RWE_oyqNJ2kr3yQ.text: The food was ok. When you consider it's $30 a plate, and we eat at some fantastic places, this was no where close. We got the salmon croquets, and the seafood chili rellenos. Mediocre at best. I've had better in my own kitchen by far. Phoenix, AZ has AMAZING  restaurants. This is not it.

nFZlBvJLmoqVWpSPvuQClA.text: I think 4.5 stars would be more accurate but since our server was so friendly and the food was so tasty, I decided to round up instead of down.   My wife and I came for lunch on a Saturday. What first caught our attention was the lack of any real formal entrance. You kind of just find yourself in a courtyard with tables. Lunch is less formal so we just found a seat and the lone server (that's right, there was only one on shift), took our order. The courtyard wasn't the nicest looking, but it definitely felt warm and cozy.  We got the lunch feast, which was basically a sampler of all their popular dishes. Not only did we thoroughly enjoy it, we also felt the price was more than reasonable. We got appetizers, main courses, and two desserts.  Everything tasted good, with some dishes better than others. In my opinion, the Pernil Asado and their empanadas were the best, while my wife really enjoyed the Cuban sliders and veggie tostadas. We had their chocolate torte and bread pudding for dessert. The bread pudding was good, but their chocolate torte was amazing.   The reason I would lower the score by a half point if possible would be due to the slow service. It had nothing to do with our server, who was friendly and helpful, but rather due to the fact that she was waiting on about a dozen tables at once. Getting our bill and paying took a little longer than desired.   Overall, I highly recommend trying this place out, especially for lunch.

UyWM45YfsmI4XcXokJ5FXA.text: Food and service, 4 stars. Location and prices, 3.  First, we had a hard time finding this place, it is definitely not what we were expecting. Once you get there it is not as bad, but it is tiny and it feels kind of crowded. The menu is very creative, but the dinner prices are a tad to high for a small place like this in this location. You can easily go over a hundred (including tip) for a dinner for 2 (no alcohol, yes to dessert) We had the Fuego pasta and the Angus short ribs. The short ribs with a side of jalapeno cornbread (these guys bring cornbread to a whole new level) and chipotle mashed potatoes.  I thought they were really good, I was not so crazy about the pasta but my hubby liked it.  We shared a Kahula Creme Brulee $9 (Big typo in the menu, I believe it was Kahlua), it was so so, I did not love it. No Kahlua on my creme brulee next time : )  Service was great. We may be back, if we are even in that neighborhood : )

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special... Pork medallions I think
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best corn bread...
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Angus Short Ribs, Chipotle Cheddar mashed potatoes, jalapeño cornbread casserole. They take cornbread to a whole new level

_Rnmcxtyemp-lkYd-lP81Q.text: Amazing.  Micdrop.  From someone who is in the industry and is extremely particular about what I put in my body this place did not disappoint, and in fact, impressed.  I primarily eat fish and I had the kabobs with shrimp and ahi.  Ahi has to be perfectly cooked to temperature and the chef did this.  This was my "cheat meal" as far as nutrition and it was well worth it.  The cornbread had bacon (but large pieces so I could avoid it), the chipotle mashed potatoes were Fuego (no pun intended), and the creamed corn was off the chain.  To be honest this food was just overall amazing and everyone in my party agreed.  I don't know if you can call me a foodie but again I am super particular and have worked in many places that take great pride in their product and Fuego Bistro I see you!  Jesus our server was right on point and super patient with us and our needs!  Right on bro!  Thanks to all the staff- I can't wait to see you again.  You made my night off amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood kabobs at Fuego Bistro!

MOehWXF2Bw-3lWCWEWCV2g.text: Wonderful, cozy, romantic atmosphere. There is my favorite type of foods as everything is fresh and so much to choose from.

kSDSSLd2OJNxDDjxuIJkVQ.text: After 25 years in the valley, I don't know how I missed this. It's not hard to find, but it is kind of hidde. Most of the seating is outdoors.  Great service and prices. If you're gonna try anything on the menu, get the empanadas.

2AdVLao_8_Z9hLF2kzPmhg.text: I just moved back to Arizona after being gone for 7 years and I have to say, the food is the same level of excellence as some of my favorite restaurants in Los Angeles.  I like how it's off the beaten path and you kind of have to know where you're going. It has a super cute patio area where they play live music EVERY NIGHT. The inside is a little smaller but super cozy, and my parents love Missy (the bartender) but our waitress and the others working were all nice.  I got the Pernil Asada with tortilla soup and the fuego salad. My parents ordered the tilapia that was lightly crusted with an amazing sauce. They also got the black beans and the cheesy mashed potatoes. I have to say, every thing I had was delish.  I will definitely be back!

g7QUvXPXDRI0MRl47iwZUg.text: Excellent food, fantastic service. Nice cozy atmosphere off the beaten track. Would highly recommend them for a romantic dinner.

8iwZVzDHpOCe6k6ZtSlgaw.text: Why have I not had friends tell me of this place?!?! The chef's do an amazing job on everything! We're already planning on taking friends there next week. It's a slightly odd maze of small buildings but it's quaint.  Be prepared the portions a very generous and the deserts huge! But please don't tell a bunch of people about this place, we want to enjoy it whenever we want.

t-CTAG3Tt4j0jsawTiSRpA.text: We love this place!  Staff is always nice and friendly and the food is top notch! Have been here at least 2 dozen times and have not had a bad meal. Oh, the live music after 7pm is a bonus.

RmZ0XtK1G2vzMWTZiSk58Q.text: This was one of the BEST meals of my life. And I've eaten everywhere. I don't only recommend this place, I demand you eat here. The Arroz con Gandules was perfectly seasoned. The cheddar chipotle mashed potatoes are incredibly complex and creamy. The pernil is slow roasted for 12 hours and just melt in your mouth. The cornbread is moist and has green chiles. The pasta is creamy. The drinks are incredibly rich, and  plenty to choose from. There's even divine French pressed coffee for after dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Everything is gorgeous and perfect. Like this drink... Jamaican Mai Tai.

Tw3dfp7wFIBWaFm4yOxu6Q.text: Adam Simons plays guitar on Tuesday night so the ambiance is awesome. Best corn bread I've ever had its like a bread pudding. Stuffed Pork and Ahi Shrimp kebabs were both unique flavored. Empanadas were also a delicious appetizer. It was well worth the 30 minute drive to get here from Scottsdale.   The only regret was that we were both too full to order desert. Ps this review is stone cold sober but it looked like they had many amazing drinks if that's your thing.

_tzoj3tRHmDnVd43vP1t4Q.text: Went for the first time for my birthday. Everything was amazing. Patio is great ambiance, especially the live music. Service was great and loved that the server had worked there 11 years. The food was fantastic. A little on the pricey side but well worth it for high quality food and service. Will definitely be coming back.

vl_DQaIHN6YDkUY2E0S1qA.text: There are many reasons why I love this restaurant, so I'll share with you my "Top 5 Reasons You Should Dine At Fuego".  5. The place is f*cking charming as a mo-fo. If you want a romantic setting for date night, sit in the art gallery near the piano. If you want to dance after dark, sit outside on the hacienda style patio under the misters and shake your hips to the live band. If you want to get schwasted via craft cocktails, sit inside near the bar so your drinks won't have far to travel, thus arriving in your hand quicker from round to round.   4. It is locally-owned and operated by a staff that really knows how to make you feel welcome and appreciated. I've been here at least a half dozen times, over the course of the past 5 years, and see some of the same smiling staff members in the dining room and in the kitchen during that period of time. Everyone is gracious, everyone is pleasant, everyone is accommodating.  3. The crowd is a swath of humanity. Old folks, young folks, families with little kids, couples on date night, girlfriends meeting up to share a bottle of wine- there's a little bit of everyone dining and drinking at Fuego. You can't help but feel comfortable.   2. Latin-inspired food that looks and tastes like it's made from scratch. This is not a Mexican restaurant, even though some of the dishes are Mexican-inspired and feature common ingredients from that cuisine, so don't get it twisted. Empanadas, quesadillas, enchiladas, rellenos, TACOS (but tacos are only for lunch or happy hour). All excellent and anything including pernil will set you up for happiness. Get the cornbread as a side and perpare to make an "oh damn" face as you bite into it. You ever go to a restaurant and ignore the server schpiel about the specials? Don't ever do that here. Listen and take notes because you'll probably want to order one. Unless you are a vegan or a vegetarian because the specials always seem to star a meat of some sort. Also of note- the servers always tell you the price of the specials. I can't stand it when that important info is missing but it's always included at Fuego. My favorite steak besides the steaks coming off of my grill at home are served here. Don't pass up the ribeye!  1. Happy Hour. It's called Social Hour at Fuego and it offers discounts on drinks and appetizers that are hard to beat. You could show up with a few friends and do a tapas style dinner for not a lot of ca$h with $4 beers or $6 wine glasses. That would also afford you a chance to try a lot of the food to see what you might want to go steady with as an entree sometime.   It's not the cheapest restaurant (dinner entrees are all $25-$30 give or take a buck) but you'll enjoy every bite of your meal and you'll have impeccable service and probably have leftovers. With a few new drinking and dining establishments opening nearby, I imagine Fuego will only get busier.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild caught salmon w chipotle cherry sauce and cornbread casserole with green beans and pickled cabbage- $28

UYFxlRRH25rWTwdzGcPxIg.text: Fuego is the best latin fusion Phoenix has to offer. I used to live in Puerto Rico and Cuba, and finding their traditional dishes authentically upgraded into fine dining fare is a treat. Portion sizes are large so bring your appetite. The cornbread side is a must order.

2XisJ9E6EXXZKS-NGDdEuw.text: We finally had the chance to visit Fuego Bistro. It is my new favorite restaurant in Phoenix. The food is so flavorful and delicious. The service was outstanding. I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing flavorful dish. Chicken with tomato Verde,goat cheese. Mmm mmm

3_xSQoOHv5ONOpq2W1ijAw.text: We came in during the closed hour from 2-3.  Even though they were technically not open, they opened their doors for my family and friends who were with us. Two of the employees even stayed late to accommodate us and were so warm and welcoming!!  The food was absolutely fantastic and the ambience was so inviting and made one feel like they were on vacation!  All who were with me agree that this place is fantastic!!!

v838RqgXRHh-B9QVZqQPRg.text: This is the perfect date night, and the perfect place to go for delicious food that doesn't break the bank! We didn't make any reservations so we were unable to get a table outside, where live musicians were strumming and singing on their guitars with a lovely fountain in the middle of the plaza. But lucky for us, we got the next best thing and were seated in the adjacent art gallery. We didn't mind at all, because our spontaneous dinner decision became a blessing in disguise, we had THE ENTIRE ROOM to ourselves! When we looked at the menu, the amount of delicious entrees overwhelmed me. But at the very bottom was something awesomely titled "The feast"  which could be ordered for two-six people. The only description on the menu was "Ask server". The mystery baited us, and our lovely waitress Pashley described it as a three course meal that had all the best items the restaurant had to offer. The only catch was that unfortunately we would not be able to apply any of our deals towards our order. We looked at each other, it was a special occasion after all...and so in the name of food adventure and love we said, "Screw it, let's do it!" Our waitress couldn't help but share our excitement and already pre-congratulated us on our decision. "It's A LOT of food," she said mischievously. And so our journey into our 3-course Latin meal began... Course 1: An assortment of appetizers that included a perfectly stuffed and cooked beef empanada, a cuban pork slider, a chicken taco, and a full salad. We basically tasted every animal you could in every type of Latin flavor you could muster, and I am oversimplifying the amount ingredients in this first plate. What can I say except de-li-cious! Perfect way to set the tone! Course 2: Entrees galore! Shredded pork, fish that had been cooked and prepared for over a week drizzled in sauce, sweet jalapeno corn, green beans, corn bread with corn bits in them, pink pickled cabbage. So Good, just so good! Course 3: Dessert! Death by chocolate anyone? We had two plates, one with a fudge torte and ice cream on top with walnuts, the ancho chile chocolate, and another with a gelatinous dessert with caramels and fudge covering it topped off with dollops of whipped cream, the fuego sundae. (Yeah, out of all the dishes, I unashamedly finished this entire plate.) We tried, oh my gosh we tried, to finish everything, and we still went home with two boxes of leftovers and stuffed to the brim. I ate those leftovers for two days afterwards! Was it worth it? Hell yes it was!  On a personal note, we were celebrating our one year anniversary, and the staff, from the jolly maitre de to our lovely waitress Pashley, was so sweet and warm that it made the whole night spectacular. Coupled with the live guitarist, delectable courses, and private room, I'd say this was a win-win-win!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Another close up, sorry I&#39;m obssessed!
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Close up of this delicious sundae
Photo of Fuego Bistro - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Course 3: Sundaes for two! I&#39;m really glad we both got our own!

3lOv4G3ZxdCUJ3ibIaBdwQ.text: Delicious food, generous portions. We had the ribeye enchilada and seafood relleno with the veggie toastada.   Our waitress was a little handsy, trying to remove plates before we were done, but at least she was attentive! :)  Great drink menu too! A hidden Phoenix gem for sure!
